tripAdvisorDetails.name: Breathless Montego Bay Resort & Spa
tripAdvisorDetails.description: NOW OPEN – Luxe and ultra-modern, Breathless Montego Bay Resort & Spa has been reimagined for sophisticated singles, couples and friends who want to live big, breath deep and experience life at its fullest. Located minutes away from the heart of downtown Montego Bay, the highly anticipated and stylish resort will offer guests a unique experience focused on exhilarating parties, weekly and monthly themed events and around the clock entertainment designed to entice and arouse your senses. The stunning 5-story adults-only resort will boast 150 ultra-chic and lavish suites with state-of-the-art technology, all carefully designed to exceed expectations with furnished private balconies and terraces, stunning mountain and bay views, floor-to-ceiling glass doors, gorgeous marble bathrooms and more. A social atmosphere is infused into all aspects and areas of the resort, encouraging guests to mix and mingle while enjoying all of the benefits of an Unlimited-Luxury® experience, where everything is included. Limitless access to seven specialty-themed restaurants featuring communal tables and unique culinary experiences, five trendsetting bars and lounges serving top-shelf spirits and handcrafted cocktails, 24-hour room and concierge services, endless daytime activities and live nightly entertainment; all without limits, reservations required or expected gratuities. We’re committed to redefining your travel journey with our best-in-class CleanComplete Verification™ practices. While health and safety have always been our top priorities, these new protocols further elevate our standards of quality and cleanliness, enabling you to vacation at any AMResorts® property with the ultimate peace of mind. Our 360-degree quality, safety and hygiene system takes into account every aspect of resort operations, backed by the highest-level third-party certification. We will be evolving and innovating our procedures continuously and will share the newest developments as they are implemented. Our protocols begin the moment you start planning a vacation to the time you return home! To learn more about our quality, safety and hygiene practices, please search for AMResorts CleanComplete Verification™ in your favorite browser.

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: The Pool at the Breathless Montego Bay Resort & Spa
xhale Club Junior Suite Tropical View King Room

tripAdvisorReviews.text: An amazing resort with lovely people. Rooms are beautiful and views are breathtaking We stayed at Breathless and we thought the nightlife would be a bit better, but there wasn’t a ton of people. The staff is TOP notch. Alberto and Craig were our butlers and they were they were beyond kind and available for anything we needed. They jumped in to help me coordinate my husbands birthday surprise and it went off with no issues. Jamila on the rooftop is so hospitable and warm. So is Jordan the lifeguard. Will definitely return and recommend to others. Also, try the jerk chicken truck at secrets. Lol
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Definitely give the Breathless resort a try

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear TP

Thank you for rewarding us with this review. Your feedback is very important to us in executing world-class service to all our guests.
It brings us great joy to read how much you enjoyed your stay with us. We want nothing short of a great time for all our guests and are happy that we were able to execute the same on this occasion.

We cannot wait to welcome you back home. Until next time, thank you for taking with Breathless Montego Bay

owner_response.author: Serene  Lloyd

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I am going to be as honest as I can. To put it bluntly,.this is a HOTEL with all-inclusive benefits of the sister property. You pretty much have to go to Secrets to enjoy certain things.  Breathless has a younger vibe. 
Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and welcoming. The lobby was nice and the pool area is BEAUTIFUL. The rooms were nice BUT not the cleanest when we arrived. The bed was very loud just sitting on it and the couch looked as though it was damaged slightly based on the legs. 
We had a good view of the pool. The main issue I had was we had to walk to the beach via Secrets Resort. The restaurants not being accessible was also a problem. They opened for breakfast , lunch and dinner literally.  Not all were open at the same time, so if you wanted something specific then you had to make sure you went to that place at a certain time. I am accustomed to being able to access food at all times at an all-inclusive.  Imagine being at the pool and you get hungry. Your thought is oh let me run to the little restaurant next to the pool. The only problem is, they won't let you in because you have swim attire on and you may be a little wet. You can't come in. They'll suggest you go change, come back down, eat, then go back and put your clothes on again to swim. They'll even say room service is an option.  Which if everyone is ordering all at once...how long will that take...I'll tell you 1 whole hour. That was a problem for just about everyone at the resort. 
My thoughts for someone visiting, just be ready to walk a bit, small portions of food (good but small), some not so nice staff in certain places(borderline rude) and boring entertainment(good idea..wrong resort). The DJ'd parties were cool but the other entertainment was something that should have taken place during the daytime. Hope this helps someone.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: CATCH 22

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Great place, Great staff and food. I cannot wait to return again. Everybody was super nice and humble. I enjoyed my stay here with my family and friends. There was entertainment every night. Be back soon.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Half Moon
tripAdvisorDetails.description: A destination in itself, set on 400 acres of manicured grounds with two miles of beachfront. We offer three distinctive resort experiences - Founders Cove, Rose Hall Villas and Eclipse, most of which have views of the Caribbean Sea. All of our guests can enjoy the extensive facilities of this destination, which include Fern Tree, A Salamander Spa, an award-winning spa oasis in Jamaica, an 18-hole par-72 championship golf course, our own equestrian centre with 28 horses, the Sugar Mill, awarded as Jamaica's best restaurant and Delmare, the highly-desired seafood culinary experience. As a discerning traveller, you will enjoy the luxury of space and tranquility we have to offer. Imagine your first morning taking in the panoramic view of the horizon, and watching the sunrise having just concluded yoga meditation in our overwater bungalow. Whether you choose to lounge on the beach, play a round tennis or golf, visit a local art gallery, or go horse riding along the beach, your days at Half Moon are yours to spend in any way you wish.

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Fern Tree Spa at the Half Moon
The Imperial Suite at the Half Moon
The Pool at the Half Moon

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This was my first time in Jamaica and it was 1 of the best trips ever! We stayed at a villa at Half Moon and it was beautiful. Beautiful serene beaches, crystal blue pools, just a wonderful experience. The staff: Mr. Al Wayne, Ms. Nordean, and Ms. Suzan, were wonderful and took care of all our needs. We enjoyed delicious breakfast and dinner everyday, I didn’t want to leave! I really enjoyed myself and will come back again!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Best Family Trip at Half Moon

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We did a family trip to Jamaica, this was personally my first time going and it did not disappoint! The beach wasn't crowded so it was very peaceful, we lounged in the water for hours and enjoyed drinks! We had a pool and a beautiful view of the ocean. We had a villa and the staff, Miss Suzan, Miss Nordean and Mr. Alwayne were the best! The cooking was amazing! Every day we had delicious breakfast and dishes. They were so nice and accommodated my 5 year old nephew who wanted a bike so badly lol we truly enjoyed our stay and I can not wait to come back!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Family Vaca done right!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: A large group of us stayed at Rose Hall villas at HalfMoon Resort for my son’s wedding celebration. The staff - Suzan (chef extraordinaire - cooked to die for Jamaican dishes at our request); Lucille (kept our rooms and the villa sparkling and our laundry **for 14!** clean); Franklin (butler with the mostest accommodated our every need ***again, 14 people!!) - could not have been more gracious, loving and kind. We did not want to leave HalfMoon as it is truly a paradise found but the wonderful staff in our villa made our stay extraordinary. If you are blessed to stay at HalfMoon Rose Villas request Suzan, Lucille and Franklin. They will take care of you as if you are family.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Extraordinary staff at Rose Hall Villa at HalfMoon Resort

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Hilton Rose Hall Resort & Spa
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Discover the pleasures of an island retreat immersed in the warm hospitality and charm of Jamaica at the All-inclusive Hilton Rose Hall Resort & Spa - a tropical, oceanfront paradise situated on 400 lush acres of an 18th-century sugar plantation. Set directly on the Caribbean Sea and framed by the majestic Jamaican Mountains, this Montego Bay, Jamaica resort is the perfect destination for families seeking fun and adventure, couples longing for a romantic escape, and memorable wedding ceremonies and receptions. Guests enjoy the resort's 489 contemporary guestrooms and suites - each boasting a private balcony or terrace with Ocean Front, Partial Ocean, Tropical and Resort view options.

address_obj.address_string: Main Road, Rose Hall, Montego Bay Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I normally stay at the Sunscape Resort in Montego Bay; however Sunscape was not open. Since I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member I decided that I could not go wrong with a Hilton Resort. I booked through a travel agent and the experience was amazing.  Preston, one of the bellmen greeted my team with a tremendous smile and immediately assumed our luggage. The front desk check in for the Diamond desk took a little while, but once it was my time to check in the experience was great. The Hotel Manager Carl was very engaging. He understands his assignment and has this property in tip-top shape. The Main dining hall is probably one of the best in the world. The cuisine is high quality and the serving staff is second to non. Shout out to Sonie, Malik and LaTisha who all serve in the man dining room.  The rooms were comfortable and the housekeeping staff provided excellent service. The staff in the coffee shop was excellent. I will be back to stay at The Hilton Rose Hall in the near future!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Excellent Experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My experience at this resort was 
Amazing! The staff were all so friendly. The food was always fresh, not a meal disappointed me. I felt right at home and taken care of. Special thanks to Cheekydon & his team &  Mr. Livingston for making the trip for me and my twin sister one for the books! 🫶🏽
tripAdvisorReviews.title: This is you sign fo book with them!!!!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This resort is literally the best resort and the best Hilton I have ever stayed at !!!!! The food was amazing there is so much to do helpful friendly staff just everything was a 10/10 highly recommend. Only thing that could improve is the rooms are a little outdated but everything is so clean.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Best Hilton Ever !! 10/10

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The service by far was the highlight of our vacation.  Everyone was polite and welcoming throughout our entire stay.  Colleen at Mangoes was an absolute sweetheart.  We had an Oceanfront room which was very clean but was in definite need of an upgrade.  The rooms are small but was sufficient enough for our family of 3.  Wifi was pretty decent throughout the resort.  Making dinner reservations at all the restaurants was easy and they were able to seat us right away at each restaurant.  The only restaurant that we did not try was Three Palms.  The food at each restaurant was great.  Our least favorite was the Rum Factory which was our first night.  I heard in past reviews to try Moonstone for breakfast but unfortunately the entire week we were there, the buffet (Fresh) was our only option.  Moonstone was not open for breakfast.  The pools were nice.  We brought our own pool floats as the ones in the lazy river were hard to come by.  My 16 year old son was able to snag one each time we were there so he could go on the slides but there was never a time that all 3 of us would be able to have one at the same time.  Entertainment was great.  Yes, there is A LOT of seaweed on the beach but the staff try their very best to keep it clean daily.  I was very disappointed at how murky the water was.  It was not clear whatsoever but the temperature of the water was great.  We had no issues getting a lounger by the pools or beach.  You may have an issue finding one in the shade but we didn't mind because we were in the water the majority of the time.  We did not wake up at 3am to put our towel down, there were always chairs available.  Drinks were fantastic!  All in all we had a great time and I would definitely recommend.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Relaxing Time with my Family!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The Service and the staff were amazing. Vanessa (Hotel Main Restaurant),Preston ( Hotel Bellman), Leo ( Chef at Charcoal Grill), Chef Ron
(Morning Sous Chef) did a great job by making us feel welcome and had Great conversation with all of them.
The Food at the resort was excellent. lots of variety, different venues and cuisine. 

The Three Palms Restaurant was our only disappointment. Service and food good but we were outside and had 2 wild cats sit by our table and a lot of flies. We were directed outside and should have asked to move inside.
The restaurant needs a facelift. (Paint, New signage, lighting inside.) The extra fee for the restaurant was minimal but the experience was not as good as the Hotel.

We were there for a wedding which had to be moved inside.  The rehearsal dinner and the wedding reception was nice. The staff had to move the ceremony inside due to rain. The staff did react well to the change and moved inside.

We had an HVAC leak in our room.  The maintenance team was prompt, courteous and apologetic. They fixed the problem in less than 30 minutes.

We played golf and rented a Cabana. Both were enjoyable.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Rose Hall Hilton Montego Bay

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Holiday Inn Resort Montego Bay All-Inclusive
tripAdvisorDetails.description: *All rates displayed are All-Inclusive* When comparing Jamaica hotels, consider the All-Inclusive Holiday Inn Resort Hotel-Montego Bay Jamaica. After a full renovation, this favorite Montego Bay hotel looks fantastic! The renewed color theme throughout the hotel will help you kick off your Jamaica vacation. A newly refreshed lobby, enhanced guestrooms with flat-screen TVs, restaurants, beach, and swimming and sunning areas make this Jamaica hotel better than ever. This Jamaica resort is located approximately 7 minutes from the Montego Bay International Airport. We offer an array of services as well as optional tours. Our wedding coordinator can help you plan your dream Caribbean wedding. We introduce our RoseHall Club Adult Only section perfect for couples or singles featuring its own lounge, adult-only pool and bar area, premium amenities, and services. Conference facilities available. Children activity centre from 6 months to 12 years. The All-Inclusive Caribbean vacation includes room, non-motorized water sports, three delicious meals, and snacks - buffet or a la carte. Please note: Some restaurants are not open every day and require reservations. See the food and beverage section for schedules. Local brand cocktails and soft drinks. *Must advise arrival flight in info field when making reservations. Taxes and service charges included. Our property offers a courtesy lounge with a luggage storage area and shower facilities. Covid-19 safety protocols in place and property certified by local authorities and has WTTC Safe Travels Stamp of approval.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The resort it self was not bad scenery beautiful. Beach smelled like sewage most of the time so felt disgusted to swim inside and too much seaweed. Food was really good. Have to say the cooks really work hard here. Male staff  friendly, nice and accommodating.
Female staff were so rude and unfriendly mostly the younger ones..This was my first time in Jamaica while food and country it self is beautiful. My experience with the people made me not want to return. Which is sad considering I was so excited to finally go to Jamaica. Glad to be back in my home. Will start to explore my own country rather then go to a third world country where some of the people seem to not care about their jobs or proper customer service especially when their prices are ridiculously high whether it be the resort or off the resort. Couldn't even do excursions because it would cost me an additional $500.00 US. They just  rip off tourists and say "oh its Covid" that caused the price to sky rocket. I shouldn't be paying more for things in a third world country then i do in North America. The Quiznos at the airport charged me 42.00 for 2 subs with 1 slice of deli meat on each sub. Jamaica is TEEF!. This is my honest opinion of Jamaica and the Holiday Inn.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Jamaica is TEEF!!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
If you are looking for the Jamaican experience this is not the place. Food was horrible - and did not depict the Jamaican vibes.  Staff has no customer service skills.  The building is showing its age.  No hot water, cracks in the walls , toilet did not flush very well, a dirty empty fridge in room.  Oh I haven't mentioned  the worst---  The FLIES - 

Only thing good about this place is the beach. Nothing else.

Have travelled to several Caribbean islands and so far worst I have seen and experience.  Never have I heard or seen so many people complaining about a hotel service. Front desk was swamped with many people wanting to speak to a manager or having many issues.  

We will be going back to Jamaica - Jamaica deserves a second chance- Just not to this place.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COST!

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,

We have taken note of your experience while staying at our hotel, and we are sorry to learn that our product and service offerings did not meet your expectations.

owner_response.author: Winsome Hooper

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Once again a fantastic family holiday which keeps me coming back! The only place I recommend when staying in Montego Bay delivering high value and a range of services on site. Was my 5th stay at the hotel with my very first being in 1998! Has since been the location of many special moments and nice to see familiar faces there. Was pleased to see the general manager was promoted from within they’ve always been very good to me on my stays in the past. I didn’t get a chance to say hello this time round but with them leading the team your in good hands. Very family friendly and the staff are all great if you remember to also treat them with respect and that they’re human they will do the most they can to help you enjoy your stay. The rooms do vary but if you’re looking for an authentic Jamaica experience rather than a butler-like service which isn’t for me then look no further. Great mix of visitors stay here from all over the world many travelled from England, UK like us and Jamaican people also vacation there, which you don’t get in many other hotels. Different areas of the private beach and activities to keep you going on site plus great connections for trips outside the hotel. Big thanks again to all the Holiday Inn, Montego Bay team we hope to see you again soon!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Perfect family holiday. First time bringing my son home to Jamaica and I couldn’t have asked for more!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Stayed here for one night due to a last minute flight change. The check in was super slow. We were first told I only reserved for two adults and had to show that I reserved for 2 adults two children. We reserved a double bed room and received a king bed with a pull out couch that would not open. Maintenance and housekeeping tried with 4 people and still could not open. Eventually we were given a cot for my son to sleep on. We had jo extra pillows for him. We called housekeeping twice and no one delivered pillows for us, my husband had to go downstairs to get one for him. We were told “if that was one available”. We went to look for the “game room” that’s in the picture here on the website and we’re told it closed during covid. The buffet food was disgusting. 

Positives- the entertainment was good, they really got everyone involved and the managers cocktail was so much fun!!!! 

I don’t think we stay here again.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Not that great

tripAdvisorReviews.text: So, we checked in yesterday, they sent me to the VIP area to check in,  arrived at the room keys didn’t work,  housekeeping was in the area & beat on the door.  Went out, came back key didn’t work, back to the front desk,  today we have been locked out the majority of the day,  finally a maintenance man came & did what he could.  But again  we are locked out of our room.   Gonna take that long walk & hope it can be resolved in one trip
tripAdvisorReviews.title: The keys don’t work

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Hyatt Ziva Rose Hall
tripAdvisorDetails.description: This resort features attentive beach and pool butlers, a Moroccan-themed rooftop lounge, sparkling pools, intimate oceanfront fire pits, and the best jerk chicken in Jamaica. Devoted to recreation and relaxation, guests are free to enjoy the best the island has to offer, from gourmet cuisine and spacious accommodations, to thrilling sports on land and sea. It's an experience every member of the family will enjoy.

address_obj.address_string: Rose Hall Road, A1, Rose Hall, Montego Bay Jamaica

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Hyatt Ziva Rose Hall - Activities Pool

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This place was a breath of fresh air and welcoming experience. My family and I enjoyed our stay and each member wished we could prolong our visit. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the events on the resort were amazing and the food… exquisite. Definitely looking forward to visiting again! 10/10
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Awesome Time

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My wife, 7-year-old daughter and I stayed at the Hyatt Ziva Rose Hall for four nights in June 2023. We took the hotel's shuttle to and from the airport for a reasonable cost. The trip is short -- probably 10 to 15 minutes. From the bell stand onward, I thought the service was excellent.

The front desk staff thoroughly explained the resort and amenities to us, and we were offered a cold drink at this time. The room was ready and was very clean. The resort property is a bit older, but it seems well-maintained. The doors appeared to be freshly painted, and the decor and furniture were recent. The room temperature was comfortable. The housekeeping service did a very good job and thoroughly cleaned our room every day.

We started our day with breakfast at Choicez, and we enjoyed the selection and quality of the food available. The servers were friendly and warm. We then made our way to the beach. Keep in mind that the beach here is fairly small, and there are fewer shaded spots to sit in than I would prefer. But the good news is that you can let your kids play in the water without worrying much about them. The water is shallow and the entire beach is protected. 

We frequently ordered drinks from servers on the beach and had jerk chicken for lunch. The service and quality were very good and in line with what we've had at other nice all-inclusive resorts.

Our afternoons were spent at the pool, and we enjoyed that space as well. The swim-up bar had a nice variety of drinks and the bartenders were attentive. Although we stayed on the family side of the resort, I did note a fair number of young adults in the pool without families, but we didn't have any issues or problems.

We would then head back to the room and get cleaned up for dinner. We enjoyed the dinner options but thought that Petit Pariz was the best. Even with a child in tow, the experience was wonderful. Our server was top-notch and the food was excellent. I recommend contacting the resort in advance so that you can make dining reservations before you get there; we didn't do this and our options were somewhat limited.

After dinner, we enjoyed the shows. They aren't anything remarkable, but we enjoyed sitting outside, having a drink, and watching an interesting performance. It was a nice way to end the day. 

We have been to about 5 all-inclusive resorts over the years, and we really enjoyed Hyatt Ziva Rose Hall, largely because of the excellent service and friendly people. Enjoy your vacation!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Wonderful service and attention to detail on a relaxing vacation

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We arrived in Jamaica with no issues. A shuttle picked us up from the airport to the resort.   This experience was amazing. The staff, room, food and any extra amenities were wonderful. Prefect birthday trip  
Thank you
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Birthday vacation

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Rooms sucks!

 Front desk staff really bad.

 Price is crazy high.  

Food quality is not good at all.

 I got sick from eating stale snapper from the French restaurant.

Restaurant staff and room staff amazing.

Buildings needs quality repairs.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Hyatt Ziva and Zalra is Not worth the price charged.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Excellent room and grounds. Very talented live entertainment. Every cuisine you could possibly want with varied menu options. Poor customer service in that room service took 2.25 hours, several staff "didn't know" managers names or what time they reported in the morning, follow-up phone calls not answered or placed on hold indefinitely.  Night manager (Richard) did come to our room at 115am per my request and apologized for poorly trained staff.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Just short of paradise

destinations.name: Iberostar Rose Hall Beach, Suites & Grand

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Iberostar Rose Hall Beach
tripAdvisorDetails.description: This 5-star- hotel is located in beautiful Montego Bay, Jamaica. Directly on the beach. Elegant colonial design. Water sports galore. Scuba diving. Three (3) specialty restaurants. Receive attentive service along with detailed amenities and discover exciting facilities throughout the resort, each made for a different purpose but with one goal, to help make your vacation dream a reality.

address_obj.address_string: Rose Hall Main Road Branch Developments, Little River, Rose Hall, Montego Bay 403512 Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Im giving this hotel 2 stars instead of 1 because the bed was comfortable and the AC was working well- otherwise this would be a 1 star review. 
This resort needs work. The staff have bad attitudes and the food is mostly not good. Save your time at the restaurants, the best food is at the buffet- so basically you’re eating buffet/cafeteria style if you want decent food. From check-in to check-out, there is a lack of information and poor/flat attitudes from the staff. 
The floor in my room was filthy- I walked across the floor once and my feet were black. I mostly had “do not disturb” on my door because I heard there were recent robberies in rooms- and I was staying in my room alone. The day I put the sign to “please come in” for housekeeping- I came back later and the staff had turned my sign over back to “do not disturb” and never entered the room. My mini bar was not restocked. Everything you want at this hotel, you have to ask for, and may get blatantly ignored. I asked for water service in the cafeteria- was ignored by 2 different servers. Outside at the grill- I asked 2-3 employees for a fork- just was ignored or when I was looked at- it was a with a flat dead-eyed stare and literally the walked away from me.  So expect to eat hot food  with your hands if you’re into that kind of thing. When I went to get a towel, was ignored by staff member when I had a question…. it just goes on and on. The general vibe I got from the staff is that they hated their jobs and the guests. I feel like I paid for a 4day vacation to be treated poorly. I would not eat this food or tolerate this service at home- I would just leave. Unfortunately that wasnt an option, as I was in another country- and I was spending time with family members trying to make the best of it. 
Additionally, the pool area although nice to look at, was not clean. The water had chunks of mildew and random debris floating in it- making it kind of gross to go into the pool by early afternoon when it got crowded. 

Overall, I left this resort feeling like I had wasted my time and money. I was disappointed the entire time, and I was happy to leave. Save your money.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Sad but true

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Stayed here with family to visit Glistening Waters (20 minutes away) enroute to Negril.
The hotel reception & bar area look very nice and the view on the from the balcony at night with the pool lights on looks stunning.
Check-in seemed to take longer than was necessary and room was ready at 3pm, standard check-in time.
Staff in reception and security were all lovely.
The room was about a five minute walk away towards the pool area.
I don't recall the room number but we could see the pier and restaurant (to the side) from our balcony. We hadn't booked a Seaview but could actually see the sea!
The room was damp and unfortunately the damp smell remained for the duration of our stay.
Some of the sign posts for room numbers are incorrect and can send you on a wild goose chase. I've never seen this before in a hotel!
If you want water, there are filling stations in various points of the hotel. Luckily, ours was really close to the room. There is no bottled water in the bars.
We heard an alarm going off somewhere down the corridor from our room a number of times over the stay. It sounded like a fire alarm but no one evacuated that we could see! This happened at various times including at night but luckily didn't wake our children.
The food in the main restaurant was fairly good although there were some items were overcooked. I tried a hash brown one day and it was like a piece of wood. They appeared overcooked most days and so I didn't bother with them again. The staff in the restaurant were all really nice and very helpful.
The pool area looked nice but we spent the majority of the time on the beach which was lovely.
There is a kids kids club which our children enjoyed and a kids pool with slides and water firing out all over the place. Again, the kids enjoyed it. Some of the features in the pool though are really unsafe. There are fibreglass (I think) animals which were broken and in the areas they are broken, the material is sharp. If you caught yourself on one of the jagged areas you would probably cut yourself, so be careful. They are beneath water so difficult to spot.
There was nothing disastrous about our stay, but there are a number of things that the hotel should address and fix.
I don't think I'd stay here again.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: It was OK, could be really good

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This was our 4th trip to the island . We had such a great experience the other times with the cruise and the people in Jamaica we looked forward to staying there . The guest at the hotel were great . We had a few issues at the pool bar . Every time we would order a drink he made sure we waited and rolled his eyes every time. There was a Concierge the was a real B @#$ch. we have dealt with rude people before but lord this was bad . We are trying to book dinners and services just like the gentleman at the pool bar didn’t want us to be there. We have never felt like we weren’t welcome to Jamaica before till this trip . We absolutely did not feel the “One Love “ vibe there this week . The resort sent us to a “shopping area” controlled by them and had a rude guest service there as well . We were not diverse enough in black culture she stated. In the other locations away from the resort people were just how we remembered them great friendly people . Our friends that traveled with us this was their 1st Jamaica experience and they are not happy as well killing 3 roaches in the room they had. We will second guess going back to spend our hard earned money in a place that has people treating you like you just don’t belong. With that said this being a lower budget resort I guess you get what you pay for .
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Making us second guess another trip

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I had the best time. The atmosphere, hospitality, and entertainment was spectacular. I really appreciated that I did not have to look for or plan things to do if I wanted to stay on the resort because the entertainment crew made sure something was going on all day. Best trip!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Book your experience NOW!!!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I give the the Hotel staff 5 stars! They were wonderful! The hotel is nice however they need to work on building maintenance.  The roof in the hallsways leaked throughout our 5 day stay.  There were buckets everywhere.  The leaks were not limited to the top floors it was also on the lower level floors.  The leaks were also occurring in the Iberostar Beach an adjacent building. There is no way I would purchase a vacation package from this resort due to poor maintenance.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Disappointed

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Jewel Grande Montego Bay Resort & Spa
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Ultimate oceanfront accommodations with junior to three-bedroom suites and stunning villas, most include designer kitchens and butler-service. Located minutes from Montego Bay’s airport the resort boasts seven superb dining options and optional in-suite private chef dining, complimentary resort-wide WiFi, two oceanfront pools, whirlpool, non-motorized watersports, world-class Italian-villa-inspired 30,000 square foot full-service spa, named Caribbean Journal's Spa of the year 2017, 25,000 square feet of modern meeting and event facilities. Close to championship golf courses, shopping, and island attractions. All-inclusive package options available making this resort ideal for couples, friends, families, weddings, honeymoons, and unforgettable events.

address_obj.address_string: Rose Hall Main Road, Rose Hall, Montego Bay JMDEH20 Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
First the staff and service: Excellent! From the time we entered. Tia at the front desk was amazing! Give her a promotion and a raise!
Our Butlers with a capital B....because they were great. Neo*-( full name Neonlayne) went above and beyond and kept the surprises coming. He made us feel like we were his only customers. Paul also provided great service. BTW- I love the Butler Service whatsapp group- genius! 
Sanjae at the bars- all of them- kept us entertained and was on point with the drinks.
Rakeal (I feel like I am spelling this wrong), has only been here for a month, but you could have sworn she has been here forever! Keep her!
Andrew Hall- wonderful personality! 
Our grill master from the Jerk hut! Quiet and kind.
Total of 5 stars for the overall service!
Landscaping is beautiful! 
Food at the buffet was better than expected. Steakhouse is the best!

Now to the working conditions for the staff. Who is HR for this group of hotels?? C'mon. Give these people two days off. How do you expect them to have a personal life, take care of kids, family, homes with 1 day off! Even if it's not two consecutive days. You can do better Playa Hotels and Resorts.... up your game. Without people you can't do the work and make the profits. Thumbs down on this! 

Rooms: Building 'A' needs a total overhaul! Rooms are very spacious, but very dated, needs a lot of renovations and new furniture. 
The hallways to the rooms have broken doors, hanging off hinges, dirty furniture. Elevators need repairs. Certainly not 5 star. Was very disappointed- this is not a cheap hotel! But I swore I was walking into a 2.5 star venue when going down the hallway to my room.

Building C: cleaner hallways and rooms. Oceanfront room was great. 

Moonstone restaurant- needs a good reno as well. Rusty chairs, door to the kitchen needs a coat of white paint. Simple things to make this the 5 star hotel that it claims to be.

Overall very accommodating for families with kids, excellent service, nice beach, good food and outstanding service! I probably won't pay this much again at this hotel until some upgrades are done. Giving 5 stars for service and landscaping combined. Food as well.
3 stars for room in building A, and 4 for room in Building C - We had a room change from ocean view to ocean front! So much better!

I took photos of the broken doors, and dirty hallways in building A, but not posting as I don't think it's indicative of all the buildings.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: May be Back

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Nice and staff is wonderful but the set up is not good. I had to walk too far just to eat. Not much selection of food. The butler service and the beach staff was excellent. Just too far to walk to get food.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Good but too far walk to eat

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My family of 5 spent a week at Jewel Grande and wanted to give my honest feedback. Kids are 16, 14 and 11.

Beach: I will start by saying, I am very accustom to super clear water where you can see see your feet when standing. With that said, you can’t here and this was not due to weather. We had no rain the whole trip and weather was impeccable! The water is murky in their bay. They have seaweed, but clear a patch of area to go out to the water which is nice, so no worries there. I just wasn’t a fan of the beach here at all. My last stay in Jamaica our hotel had crystal clear water with floats anchored to the ocean floor. We spent everyday there, which due to the murky water we didn’t spend any time here. The Hobie cats are awesome! Also, chairs are more than plentiful at the beach. I don’t see the need for a cabana. Plenty of palm trees creating shade.
Pool: The pools have beautiful views, however being a pool owner myself, I did notice the cleanliness of the pool could be better. When we went to the pool, we always found a chair. To get a good chair or several together, be there by 11.
Food: We found the food to be overall pretty bland. We are Texans, so we are use to lots of flavors. We did enjoy the breakfast buffet, the hibachi was good (and table service at pier side was good too!), we also enjoyed the Italian restaurant. Waves, the steakhouse and Mexican restaurant was flavorless in our opinion. Tip on reservations- I noticed you can really get in anywhere you want at any time except hibachi because there’s only 2 hibachi tables. We never went to eat at the time our butler made the reservation and never had trouble getting seated immediately.
Villa: We felt it wasn’t worth the money but did accommodate our family size nicely which is why we chose it. It comes with a butler, we had Ronald and Garçon who were amazing!!! With that said, we didn’t really use them much. We did 2 private excursions and they packed us a cooler of drinks to put in the car which was so nice as well as left us snacks at the villa. We didn’t use to plunge pool, it was dirty and maintenance never cleaned it (called twice), but likely wouldn’t have used it even if it was clean. The villa has lots of stairs. Master is on 3rd floor for the views, but lots of climbing to get there. Also, the decor is pretty dated, but we knew that by the pictures.
Excursions: We did 2 private excursions which I felt was definitely worth the money! $300 for the day for a van. 1 day we went to Negril. We stopped in Lucea, the capital of Hanover and ate some local cuisine with our amazing driver. When we got to Negril we went shopping, then spent some time on seven mile beach, which has the most beautiful water! We headed over to Ricks Cafe, ate and did cliff jumping. This is the place to view sunsets! 2nd excursion was to Ocho Rios. We went to Dunns River Falls, which was amazing!l We then headed to Blue Hole which was so breathtaking, the kids jumped the waterfalls. We also went on a snorkeling catarman cruise another day, which the kids loved! You get to stop at Jimmy Buffets where they have water toys and you can eat.
Spa: we enjoyed ourselves and the amenities that come with it.
Airport: we didn’t do Club Mobay and I don’t regret saving that money!! Arriving, we got through customs in about 25-30 minutes. We booked transportation directly through hotel. So easy! We were in the van within 5 minutes of giving our name. Departure, the security line looks absolutely insane at the airport in Jamaica but moves so fast, took us 40 mins to get through with time to eat on the other side of security.

The staff at the Jewel is amazing and want to make your stay nice! We definitely enjoyed our week at the Jewel, I’m just not sure I’d book this hotel again due to the beach and food. I’d give it 3.5 out of 5 stars.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Week long trip with family of 5

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Nice place good location as it’s 15 min from hotel. Gave it four stars as food was good and good assortment of places to eat. Nice grounds and friendly staff. Amazing view with ocean front room and room was nice and big with washer and dryer.  

Main issues 
No utensils in rooms. 
Lots of seaweed at beach so not easy or fun to swim. 
No welcome drink 
No liquor in room like some other Jamaican high end resorts. 

Good place for the price and would stay again if I had to.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Good Resort in Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I just returned from a one week vacation at this resort with my family of 5. My overall experience was good. I received a surprising upgrade which was greatly appreciated. 

The room was nice, but could use a good clean. The countertops, tub, shower and floors looked like they hadn't been scrubbed (only surface cleaned) in quite some time. The cushions on balcony chairs have seen better days. They were covered in stains and cigarette burns. Housekeeping will make beds and supply towels (sometimes) only. One day they didn't come until 6pm and asked me "what do you want me to do?" They should know their job. 

Our stay came with a butler service. They made dinner reservations and would book excursions. I did ask about a fishing excursion on day 2 and never heard back after he told me he would look into it. They were both very friendly, providing us info on daily activities and nightly entertainment and checking in with us. 

The pools were kept tidy and clean, but the jacuzzis were not working the entire week. I didn't have any trouble finding chairs with shade by the pool if I saved them before 10am. The beach is nice, but has alot of seaweed that staff were constantly raking up. There are areas of seaweed in the swimming area. My daughter got stung by a jellyfish swimming through it. But there are a few clear areas with soft sand to swim and sit in. Although, the water always looks murky. The cabanas were nice and clean. The cabana concierge service was fantastic getting drinks and lunch for guests.

The food was JAMAIZING! I didn't have one bad meal. There's something for everyone and a quite a few restaurants to choose from (Italian, International, Steak house, Jamaican, Japanese). 

I had a wonderful time, but I most likely won't return. I would prefer a place with a larger beach, less seaweed and clearer water.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A Jewel...that could use a polish

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Hotel Riu Palace Jamaica
tripAdvisorDetails.description:
El hotel Todo Incluido 24h Sólo Adultos Riu Palace Jamaica abre todo el año y está situado en el exclusivo enclave de Mahoe Bay, al norte de Jamaica. Riu Palace es la categoría más elegante de la cadena hotelera RIU, con hoteles que cumplen los más altos estándares en términos de lujo, excelencia y sofisticación, creando una experiencia única. Su ubicación es ideal por su proximidad a Montego Bay (4,5 km) y al aeropuerto internacional Sangster de Montego Bay (MBJ) (2,7 km) e invita a explorar la zona. El hotel cuenta con 288 habitaciones cómodamente amuebladas con WiFi gratuita y ofrece muchas comodidades. Relájese en nuestro spa o póngase en forma en el gimnasio. 3 piscinas infinitas al aire libre, 2 de ellas con swim up bar. Animación diurna y nocturna, así como discoteca. Para los amantes de la gastronomía, estaciones de cocina en vivo en nuestro buffet principal, así como restaurantes de especialidades japonesas, de fusión, italianas y Steakhouse; 4 bares.

#RiuParty en el Hotel Riu Palace Jamaica.
¿Te gusta disfrutar de las mejores fiestas durante tus vacaciones? ¡RiuParty está hecho para ti! Baila al ritmo de la música de los mejores Dj's y transfórmate con los espectáculos y performance que te ofrece cada fiesta. ¡Aprovecha tu Todo Incluido y disfruta de la mejor diversión con RIU!

address_obj.address_string: Rose Hall, Mahoe Bay, Montego Bay Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Fabulous hotel, friendly and welcoming people, food very good and the entertainment got people dancing.  Foam party was fun. Cocktails were tasty and not already made up. Best holiday and will definitely go back soon.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: First timer

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We are repeat guests , as it’s our 9th time at the Riu Palace.  At first we were disappointed in the room they gave us facing a wall and the room smelled so bad of weed, I know it’s Jamaica and we are cool with weed but we did not want to sleep in that smell but we did for 1 night and they next day the manager changed us to the room we always stay in. The food of course is amazing, the service and workers are so friendly and always welcoming and saying welcome home! A huge thank you to Johneve at front desk, Hugh and Abraham bell boys, Jemar at the buffet for breakfast and lunch and my special friend Ronaldo who is  a waiter at the beach and pool.  House cleaning was fantastic , always asking if we needed anything . We will return for our 10th visit!  One Love!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: 9th  visit

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We have just returned from a 10 day visit and we wasn’t disappointed!
The hotel and rooms are immaculately clean and the staff from the front desk to the entertainment team bend over backwards to make sure your stay is as comfortable and as memorable as possible. The food was first class with a good selection at all sittings. 
The only thing stopping me giving this place full marks is the beach. It is relatively small compared to the 2 other hotels and the sand is man made which is very uncomfortable on your feet. The sea is not as impressive as I’m used to and is full of weed…It also felt as if you were walking in mud a short distance out.
Overall an awesome holiday blessed with awesome weather.
Just a shame for me, the overall experience was let down by the beach…Yeah Man 😉
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A Magnificent Hotel, Shame about the Beach !

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Round Hill Hotel and Villas
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Steeped in rich history, timeless elegance and true understated luxury, Round Hill welcomes you with genuine Jamaican hospitality while captivating you at every turn. We invite you to our 110-acre private enclave of luxury villas, boutique oceanfront rooms, award-winning seaside dining and an exquisite spa that lies nestled in a lush tropical hillside along a private bay of turquoise waters. Here, guests become family, paradise is found, and experiences become lasting memories.

address_obj.address_string: John Pringle Drive Montego Bay, Hopewell, Montego Bay Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Round Hill is a completely unique place in Jamaica and perhaps in the world - the only place I know of where you have the cozy ambience of a small resort with the amenities of a large resort. That said, it's expensive. It was expensive when we were there six years ago and it's even more expensive now. It's true that the rooms (in the Pineapple House which is the hotel section) are not as luxurious as some you might stay in for the price, you are paying for the service, the quality of the food, the magical beauty of the place. 

In my last review back in 2017 I complained about the coffee, but that's been completely resolved with a French Press and Blue Mountain coffee. 

Miscellaneous tips:

The breakfast situation is still a little confusing if you don't know, and it's not always explained well. There are two levels of buffets: Continental which includes smoked fish, bagels, fruit, cereals, pastries; and the complete buffet with hot Jamaican dishes. When you get the buffet you can also order off the menu. 

An 18% are included in the bill for the meal, and those tips and anything you add are pooled among the staff. If you want your server to receive something extra you need to give it to them in cash. 

The frozen sorrel margarita is the best thing on the drink menu. I had one every day. 

Rooms in the Pineapple House have the best beach and pool access. The lower numbers will be closer to the pool and be noisier, if you want a quieter room ask for one farther from the pool. 

The dining at dinner off the menu was really spectacular. One day a week there is a beach buffet which was not that great but the rest of the meals made up for it. 

Last but not least, the gym is very well equipped and has a beautiful view of the sea. 

I think that's it. If you're on the fence, just go. You'll be glad you did.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Second trip and just as wonderful

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Lynn-in-Chapel Hill, 
What a terrific read and thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. It is always great to know that we have maintained the recipe albeit with specific improvements based on trends from valuable guest feedback. Your notes on our tremendous team are so impactful as their authenticity complements the natural, robust landscape. We will keep invigorating the culinary journey between now and your next visit, but rest assured we will keep the frozen sorrel margaritas flowing! Wishing you safe travels and many happy returns to Round Hill.
owner_response.author: Jeremy Zuber

tripAdvisorReviews.text: My family stayed at the Hillside House on the Round Hill Resort last week and it was a dream vacation.  Round Hill Resort is beautiful, quiet, and one of the best places we have ever stayed.  The services is amazing- Stewart, Anthony, and Dennis were the best.  This is a MUST STAY.

We can’t wait to come back again and again and it’s so close to the airport (less than 30 minutes from the airport) that it’s very easy to!

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Royal Decameron Cornwall Beach
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Warm turquoise beaches, fusion flavors and reggae sounds will make your senses vibrate at this famous bay located on the northwest area of Jamaica; the same bay that was conquered by the greatest conquistador, Christopher Columbus, who during colonial times described it as “The Gulf of Good Weather.” Nothing would be more pleasurable for this explorer than to find his way to this paradise after a long journey from the Old Continent, than to disembark the entire crew of La Nina, La Pinta and La Santa Maria for a good relaxing time. A delicious weather is among its charms, characterized by a warm spring throughout the year, that also fuels the contagious festive and spontaneous spirit of its people. You may enjoy the luxury of our new ‘Royal Decameron Cornwall,’ a modern property with Caribbean and tropical style, with a vacation infrastructure located on a private beach that gives it its name, and only 5 minutes from the Sir Donald Sangster International Airport, and the commercial district of Montego Bay and its ‘Hit Strip.’ You may also explore fascinating geographical locations in Jamaica from our resort, such as the ‘Dunn River Waterfalls,’ the ‘Blue Mountains National Park,’ go river rafting on the ‘Martha Brae River,’ swim with dolphins or visit the ‘Bob Marley House – Museum.’ Due to Coronavirus (COVID-19), this property is taking steps to help protect the safety of guests and staff. Certain services and amenities may be reduced or unavailable as a result.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
ITS SOOOOOO GOOD I LOVE I JUST LOVE IT
people WAS SO NICE and the  dessert it's just delish  and the room is just so pretty  its so nice i just love it  i want to go again but my mom said to go somewhere new  love it
