owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to let us know you had a great time with us. We are happy to know enjoyed the warmth of our staff, our rooms and our yummy desserts. 

We would love to have you with us another time.

Royal regards,
owner_response.author: Mikala Mills

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The front desk act like they hate their job. Check in is at 3. But they claimed it was from 3-5 I asked them to show me where it’s states that and couldn’t. There is only 2 restaurants on site. The entertainment/dance club is at the sister hotel. The minibar in the room is 2 beers. You have to buy the snorkeling gear. False advertisement on their website. Food was just ok. The taxi driver at the hotel tries to overcharge. Wanted to charge $40 for a place that was 1 mile away.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Go somewhere else

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest:

Thank you for your feedback, it will be considered for our continuous improvement. 

Regarding your experience we are training all our staff to give the best customer service to all our guests. It is important to share that while we may start the registration process before 3pm, check in is between 3 and 5pm and this it is stated on our website. 

On our property we have a buffet and a la carte restaurant, guests who stay with us also have full access to our sister property Montego Beach who also has a buffet and an a la cate restaurant. Daily entertainment and live dinner music  takes place on both properties, for our main nightly entertainment takes place at our Montego beach property at the main stage. Mini bars are stocked daily with beer, soda and water. Due to Covid-19 we no longer offer snorkels due to shared mouth pieces. 

We invite you to visit us another time to enjoy a more memorable stay. 

Royal regards,
owner_response.author: Mikala Mills

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I had a great time! Previously, I had visited De Cameron's resorts at other countries and decided to ignore the negative reviews. I'm glad I booked with them.

Clean and quiet rooms. AC worked without a problem. Very friendly staff. The only time I experienced rudeness was when making a reservation to the Jamaican restaurant, but that was at the other hotel.  

I had no problem with their food. They provided a variety of fruit and veggies.  This was my first time trying jerk chicken, and I liked it!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Loved it!

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to let us know you had a great time with us.

We apologise for the breakdown service while making the reservation and invite you to visit us another time.

Royal regards,
owner_response.author: Mikala Mills

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Breezy lobby and dining area, quiet, comfortable room, fun pool and beautiful beach access on both properties. Food is delicious and staff is fabulous. Great drinks, super clean common areas. The entertainment was a big surprise, top shelf.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Cool breezes, warm & friendly Jamaican staff and hot entertainment

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to let us know you had a great time with us. Our mission is to serve with passion in order to make you, our guest happy. it is a pleasure to know that you have experience that.

Royal regards,
owner_response.author: Mikala Mills

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This is a Great Resort, tucked away in a good location, beautiful beach! &  Lovely pool !
Staff is very helpful and Friendly,  great service.!!  
Food is good, and staff very helpful if you have dietary issues.  Celiac, Dairy free,  Gluten free etc.    Great bar service and fabulous Island cocktails!  
Rooms are simple and Clean with lovely balconys. Every room is facing  the ocean! 
Great views .
This is a lowkey, quiet resort  great for a truly relaxing getaway!!   Very few children. 
I felt very safe there.  Lots of security.  There is Very limited night entertainment this is why its great place to go to relax and unwind. 

They need new lounge chairs around the pool,  unfortunately - the one downfall - they are on back order- due to Covid.   Hopefully they will be there soon.   

I will go back next year for more R & R.  See & visit with the wonderful friendly Staff.

VK  Canada
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great Hidden Gem

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear guest:

Thank you for taking the time to let us know you had a great time with us. 

The are aware of the condition of our pool chairs we are awaiting our shipment of our furniture. 

We are happy you enjoyed our how close we are to the airport and other restaurant and party spots.

We pride ourselves in having the best resort beach in the area and we do our best to keep it clean it is a joy knowing it was noticed. 

We mission is to serve with passion in order to make our clients happy and while we consider Cornwall our more low key property there is nightly entertainment can be enjoyed at out Montego property starting at 8 with their preshow and award ceremony.

We look forward to having you next year for more relaxation.

Royal regards,
owner_response.author: Mikala Mills

tripAdvisorDetails.name: S Hotel Jamaica - All Inclusive - Boutique Hotel
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Welcome to the real Jamaica; to the S Hotel - All inclusive - Boutique resort where your guest suite is an entrée into Jamaican lifestyle. In the center of the Hip Strip and overlooking Jamaica’s famed Doctor’s Cave beach, the stylish S Hotel is an All meals inclusive resort and the ultimate trendsetting hotspot positioned to put the resort city of Montego Bay back on the map among cultural connoisseurs. The contemporary, 120-room property artfully combines urban sophistication and a laid-back resort lifestyle with an underlying rootsy vibe. The hip décor flows through the welcoming lobby, the two restaurants to the South Beach style pool and the signature guest rooms with nine-foot spa showers and twelve-foot-wide balconies. Sky Level has a glass walled sky pool and sky deck showing the unique vista of the island wrapping around itself to form the bay. You’ve found your luxury basecamp from which to explore the island of Jamaica! Rooms are offered on all-inclusive room plans.

address_obj.address_string: 7 Jimmy Cliff Boulevard, Montego Bay Jamaica

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Pool next to the beach with cabanas and pool chairs

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I came to the S Hotel with a friend to celebrate her birthday. Upon check in there were additional fees to pay for which were not discussed when booking over the phone. We received a cold towel and welcome drink which was refreshing. It is an indoor/outdoor hotel so keep that in mind that only your room and restaurants will be air conditioned. 

Room:
Upon arrival to our room, we found that even though it was clean, there were deep stains in the floor. The building and rooms could use repair. You can tell they just keep layering on paint. The beds were very comfortable! The robes came in 1 size which is an XL but fits like a M. The water from the sink splashes water everywhere even at low pressure. The showers were very nice. Room service is slow and if you ask for anything, they will give you part of what you asked for or nothing at all. It was incredibly disappointing. 

Food/Drinks:
We had some really good food while dining. The breakfast and lunch were good. Service was great! The problem we had is that the restaurants are not all open every night and you can only get dinner at 6 or 8pm. I’ve never experienced anything like that at resorts. They do not have many restaurants to choose from either. The best one, of the ones I could experience, was the Rock Steady. It’s on the top floor. We never got a chance to try the steakhouse. They will tell you to book restaurants early but then the restaurants are empty so make it make sense. The bartenders are really cool! You will need to ask them to add liquor to your drinks. They are pretty weak. 

Pool/Beach:
The main pool is small but very cute. The rooftop pool gives a beautiful view of the ocean. We loved it!

Staff:
The staff were very pleasant and easy to discuss things with. Daroyl/Darrel is awesome!! Be very clear in your ask, especially for pricing of excursions or drivers. Make them give you a complete breakdown of costs. 

Overall, I had a good time with friends and enjoyed the staff. I’ve stayed at some nice resorts with better amenities for less money and high end ones as well. I wouldn’t return to this resort.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Overpriced Boutique Hotel

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
As usual I was and still is  enamoured with the general decor of the property but more so the size of the rooms and bathrooms. During my last visit the hotel was transitioning into an all-inclusive and for this trip, is now a fully adult all-iclusive get away. More restaurants are now added but I particularly like the jerk centre, the 24 hour cafe not to be out done the general  eating area which still serves excellent food. The service is superb as was expected.
My slight disappointment was not seeing some of the familiar staff that I had grown accustomed to seeing. Nothwithstanding, their replacements are obviously well trained and exceptionally pleasant. I would recommend this diamond to anyone trying to find an enjoyable hotel in Jamaica to ty the S Hotel and please remember to check out the Jamaican Friday evening food...excellent!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: COMFORT AT ITS MAXIMUM

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The S Hotel is my first and only choice when I'm in Montego Bay, Jamaica! I have been going to the S Hotel since March of 2020 and the thing that remains consistent is the incredible staff (I LOVE ANDRES COPE with my whole entire heart), the upscale feel and aesthetic, the chill and serene vibe, and they have one of the sexiest bathrooms on the planet. Add in the close proximity to the airport and Hip Strip and you have the perfect hotel in the perfect location. Can't wait to get back soon!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Montego Bay's BEST!!!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: First time to Jamaica, and it was an awesome experience. Relaxing and joyous vibe. My wife and I really enjoyed the amenities the hotel offered; our room was great. The food was good, the staff was professional and nice.  We really enjoyed our time.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Relaxing and Enjoyable

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The resort is beautiful, the food and drinks are delicious and the customer service is excellent!!  We loved the restaurant options and the staff was so friendly and accommodating  
The beach was absolutely beautiful too!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Highly recommended

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Sandals Royal Caribbean Resort and Private Island
tripAdvisorDetails.description: •Jamaica’s only Resort with a Private Offshore Island, housing an authentic Thai Restaurant. • Exquisite, one of a kind Over-the-Water Private Island Butler Villas with Infinity Pools and Over-the-Water Private Island Butler Honeymoon Bungalows. • 21 exquisite 5 Star Global Gourmet® restaurant options (9 at Sandals Royal Caribbean & 12 at Sandals Montego Bay). • British-style afternoon tea served daily. • British Pub offering an authentic pub dining experience in a relaxing and enticing environment. • Magnificent Swim-Up Crystal Lagoon Suites and Suites with Tranquillity Soaking Tubs for two.

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Over the Water Suites and  Private Island

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
It needs help but Good Help on the entertainement !!! Well below average... we are talking about elementary level. From speakers to musicians to dancers...With all the respect for them because I am sure they are doing their best but they need to be trained and may be for what people pays they need to hire singers, dancer, comedian and etc and let them rotate to all the resorts they have....

Food? What food!!! Hellooooo!! Open your eyes!!! Bombay is good if you like spicy!!! the rest is Fast food....Lunch? fast food.

Butlers wake up? Do you think to get tips automaticly given the basic service? They gave us a phone for what? me to call? where is your above expectation service? What did you suggest me to do today? What are the plans? Any Suggestions? I asked for Aperol in my room... I found Apricot Syrup... My ice bucket was water after few hours and when back after dinner still no ice..... warm water with an empty Ruffino Prosecco!!! hellooooooo!!! and you know what happenned 3 times in the row over 4 nights...... fresh fruit never replaced.... 5 apples the first day.....at the second day we have 2 apples and 3rd and 4th days empty containers....
i dont want to look paranoid but at the end the butler told me personally if i took care the prior butler!!! WHAT! Are you asking me the tips? first at all dont even ask.... second i did the first day I arrived as start to show our appreciations.....I was offended.... end of the story
tripAdvisorReviews.title: NEEDS HELP

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your review of Sandals Royal Caribbean. We sincerely apologize if you felt like your experience was not one hundred percent reflective of the true Sandals experience. We also regret to learn that you were not entirely satisfied with the entertainment. We acknowledge that entertainment is subjective by its very nature and our activities are tailored to the needs of all our guests. Notwithstanding, we constantly review our entertainment policy to ensure that we are doing our best to satisfy all guest needs as much as possible, and your particular comments have been forwarded to the Entertainment Manager for consideration. We also respect that opinions regarding food will always be subjective in nature, however, we wish to clarify that all meals are prepared fresh on-site and our chefs are always more than willing to prepare meals precisely to your tastes if they are made aware that something is not to your liking. We sincerely do value all guest feedback, whether in the form of positive comments or constructive criticism and as such, we can assure you that we remain respectful of the opinions you have expressed. It is our hope that you would permit the positive aspects of your stay to outweigh any dismay you may have felt as we would truly appreciate an opportunity to regain our high standing with you during a future stay at another one of our resorts.
owner_response.author: Shawn Redhead

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We went for 7 days as a couple to get away. Let’s do the positives first! 

-The location and facilities are beautiful. The beach area is small while their doing a renovation in one section. 
-The food in all locations was great as I don’t think we had a bad meal. 

So the negatives which comes down to management of the facility really needs to get on some major things. Yes it seems like a lot but remember we paid $6K for a top of the line All Inclusive Resort. 

-The plane noise flying only couple hundred feet directly above you is really loud during the day and early evening 
-The Staff at the beach bar are not so friendly. No smiles or trying to interact with you . This compared to Pool bar where Bartender Black was  friendly and inviting. 
-Bomb Bay dinner took over an hour when we eat at 8 PM and only a couple people in the entire restaurant.
-We left are room all day and left the clean room light on.  No one ever came and I had to go to the front desk to have it cleaned.
-The Fire Alarm went off while simple taking a showering for 15 minutes.
-During the fire Dance on beach. The whole time they were working on the beach grill with electric Saws and couldn’t  hear. How could someone in charge allow this to happen with 6 staff present.
-The Reggae band was hour late setting up and only played for 30 minutes. During the delay, we had to watch drunk guest dance on the stage to entertain us. 
-The Main bathroom near the lounges and entrance was Unisex. So while I was in at the stand up going a lady came in and was horrified and walked out. I apologize to her when I left and she said of course not my fault.
-Every night two bus loads of guest left our resort to the sister resort for dinner and entertainment. Entertainment needs a lot of work. 
-At 6AM on Tuesday and Friday the workers using blowers to blow around our front door waking us up. 

I actually left some stuff out. Whoever the manager is needs to get working!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great location needs some management help!

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your review of Sandals Royal Caribbean. It seems there were some aspects of your stay that you enjoyed, but there may have been some areas that you were not completely satisfied with. We have always sought to recruit socially engaging employees with pleasant personalities, as we are fully aware that our team members are our greatest assets, so it is disheartening if you felt like your experience did not reflect this. Training continues to be a vital part of our improvement plan and as such, we have shared your feedback with our management team for action as required.

We are respectful of the opinions you have expressed and recognize that one person’s specific experience can only be judged by that individual. We do request that guests on the property please notify us of anything that does not meet their standards via the Loop system, which is a direct line to resort management, as we are always willing to work with our guests to make sure you walk away feeling like your stay was money well spent. At this time, if you have not already done so, we invite you to share your other lingering concerns with us at customersupport@sandals.com. Please note that most of the changes we make at the resort level are a direct result of the feedback received from our guests and it is our sincere hope that in time, you will come to look back on your time with us in a more favorable light.
owner_response.author: Shawn Redhead

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My husband and I just got back from our first Sandals trip. We stayed at Royal Carribean in Montego Bay June 17-24, 2023.  We are fortunate enough to travel quite a bit and have been to all inclusive resorts as well as non all inclusive resorts. We have several friends that are all "Sandals Only" travelers so we were anxious to experience all the wonderful things they have experienced.  Our first few days were not as wonderful as our friends experiences. Granted they have never stayed at this particular resort so that may have been the difference.   The staff members were hit and miss... some gave great customer service while others seemed annoyed being there. 

While the vacation went on, there were many positives we had that made us think we would be willing to give Sandals another try for a future trip.  Here are the pros and cons:

- DRINKS WERE NOT STRONG!!! Even when requesting extra strong drinks still seemed weak. I really hope it is not true about watered down alcohol but, it sure seemed that way.  We got to the point where we requested super strong drinks and a shot on the side. 

-The Pool Bartenders were AWESOME!!! Shout out to Shawayne and Black. They were super friendly and fun. I enjoyed both of them. The Beach Bartenders were NOT friendly and sometimes even rude. On our beach days... I would just walk over to the pool to see Shawayne and Black. 

-The Paino Bartender... Okello (might be misspelled, my apologizes) was very friendly and fun! He made the best martinis. YUMMY! 

-The grounds were beautiful! The pools and spas were super clean and inviting.

-The beach is small but, very pretty!  The only complaint is you kinda feel like a third class citizen with the butlers reserving all the best and shady spots. I guess it is what is! But when you are paying 6K plus for week... it is frustrating. 

-The Food was great overall!!! The Indian, French, and Thai restaurant were wonderful. Friendly staff.   Special shout out to Robert in the French restaurant.... top notch customer service by him! Italian restaurant was just ok.

- We did have one not so great experience at Spices Restaurant for dinner. We arrived to the hostess desk and while standing there another couple arrived after us with a butler. The butler escorted them past us. We were told to have a seat and wait. Again.. I get it. They had a butler but, it was still frustrating when you are paying a lot of money too. We noticed that couple had finished their meal and left before our meal even arrived. 

-We splurged for a couple massage overlooking the beach! It was fabulous. The ladies put us to sleep! Strongly recommend. 

-Unfortunately, the night of our Butches reservations (over at the Montego Bay Resort), my husband got very dizzy (he was not drinking this day) while getting ready for dinner. He almost fell but, caught himself. We decide to have him get checked by the nurse on call. She was so compassionate. She checked him and thought it was an ear infection. She called the on call doctor. It only took about an hour for the doctor to arrive and confirm the diagnosis. Afterwards, we were told to get him back to the hotel room for rest. They took care of getting the meds delivered to our room in less than two hours. This company that Sandals contracts for medical care is top notch! Yes, we had to pay out of pocket and submit later to our insurance company... but, it was well worth it!!! This was when we said.. perhaps we will try Sandals again. It is comforting to be in foreign country and know if you get sick... there is something on grounds and they will take care of meds if needed! I went to desk to tell the manager on duty, Tadean. I requested that since we missed dinner, would we be able to get room service even though we were not in a room that did not offered that.  Tadean took care of it for us! And my husband was able to rest and not worry about food. 

-  The Entertainment staff was friendly and fun! And they are very talented. I wish there was better communication with the Themed nights. The App was not very specific about what the shows were exactly just the title. We missed the Fire Show on the Beach.  The flyer we were given at check in was vague too.  The screen in the lobby did not always work.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Overall Good time! Just a few snags.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We had a spectacular time.  The entertainment was amazing, the food was extraordinary, the entire staff was phenomenal. We fully appreciated everything that was done in order to enhance our vacation experience. Thank you so much for everything.  When we have saved up enough, we will be back.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: The most amazing vacation spot ever

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This resort is amazing!  The service, accommodations, and food are 5 star.  It a very quiet and relaxing resort. The staff will go out of their way to help you and get you whatever you need.  Very clean and beautiful. Perfect for a couples getaway!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Amazing Couples Trip

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Secrets St. James Montego Bay
tripAdvisorDetails.description: If you’re looking for a luxury all-inclusive resort in Montego Bay, look no further than Secrets St. James Montego Bay. Given the close proximity of popular landmarks, such as Harbour Street (1.9 mi) and Blessed Sacrament Cathedral (2.0 mi), guests of Secrets St James Hotel can easily experience some of Montego Bay's most well known attractions. Free wifi is offered to guests, and rooms at Secrets St. James Montego Bay offer a flat screen TV, a minibar, and air conditioning. During your stay, take advantage of some of the amenities offered, including room service and a concierge. Guests of Secrets St James Hotel are also welcome to enjoy a pool and breakfast, located on site. For travelers arriving by car, free parking is available. If you like barbeque restaurants, Secrets St. James Montego Bay is conveniently located near Pork Pit and MVP Smokehouse. Montego Bay is also known for some great marinas, including Montego Bay Yacht Club and Montego Bay Marine Park, which are not too far from Secrets St James Hotel. The staff at Secrets St. James Montego Bay looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit. We’re committed to redefining your travel journey with our best-in-class CleanComplete Verification™ practices. While health and safety have always been our top priorities, these new protocols further elevate our standards of quality and cleanliness, enabling you to vacation at any AMResorts® property with the ultimate peace of mind. Our 360-degree quality, safety and hygiene system takes into account every aspect of resort operations, backed by the highest-level third-party certification. We will be evolving and innovating our procedures continuously and will share the newest developments as they are implemented. Our protocols begin the moment you start planning a vacation to the time you return home! To learn more about our quality, safety and hygiene practices, please search for AMResorts CleanComplete Verification™ in your favorite browser.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We are repeaters at the resort and we celebrated our anniversary.  Butler service was a new amenity for us and it was the way to go.   

Ta’jae and Darwin were amazing! If you are staying in the preferred club section defiantly request Darwin and Ta' jae, they were consistently checking on us to make sure “we were good’ and pampered.  They were GREAT butlers  who made our anniversary memorable that we can’t stop talking about it.  There service was exceptional and should be tipped accordingly.

 Blue Mountain Jamaican food improved immensely from our last visit and himatsu was fabulous and the chef very entertaining. 

 Thank you to  bellman Chris Brown who remembered us because we are repeaters at the resort and always had a smile.  Ja’Nelle  made check-in a good experience to make sure we received  the room we wanted.  Payrian our housekeeper kept our room sanitized and clean with plenty of wash cloths and towels.  Shout out to Dowain the bartender at the Marlin who knew my favorite drink “Jamaican Memories”.  Thank you Shanice our concierge who remember us as repeaters and was so pleasant to talk too.

I suggest that the general managers walk the grounds and meet the people.  Hospitality to your customers will go a long way. You may  learn more about your employees and what what you are doing right and what needs improvement
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Anniversary Repeaters

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Long and slow lines and high expectations for tips.  Not a fun experience starting vacation with the family.  

Secrets uses Amstar for travel and what an experience.   We were put in two lines to wait.  We waited for a bus to the resort for 20 minutes.  We were told to just stand to the side.  Then they took us to the bus and we waited another 40 minutes.  The driver told us he wasn’t allowed to leave until he waited for two more travelers.  Another 10 minutes they arrived and we left - after 50 minutes sitting on the bus and 20 minutes standing outside customs and immigration.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Plan to spend your time waiting.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We very much enjoyed our stay! We were on the preferred club side which is completely worth it. The master suite was amazing  with corner views of the ocean and pool! Tajae & Darwin were top class butlers that made the entire trip exceptional! Darwin, we felt went out of his way to make sure my wife and I truly had everything and anything we needed at any given time! If you’re headed here, make sure to ask for these two men as they will make your trip that much better
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Amazing time! Tajae & Darwin Are the BEST butlers!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We spent a week at St James Montego Bay for our 28 year anniversary Chase and Dean our butlers were fabulous the resort was amazing the staff was amazing the food was amazing our swim up pool was amazing the view was beautiful we has a beautiful time.Also the drinks keep coming and coming always tried a different drink every other day.  We had a blast and we’re planning on going back next year.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Anniversary time being pampered.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I enjoyed secrets st James. Was there for my 50th birthday. One of my most memorable moments was at the Boudreaux French restaurant. The manager Mervant and the chef Tayan prepared me the most delicious Jamaican corn meal Pourage. I will never forget how special they made me feel.  When I tell you, the hospitality they gave me was more than 100%. They are the best. I want to let them know how special they were to me on my special day. They went out of their way to prepare me a an authentic Jamaican pourage. 
Thank you so much from Bienvenida.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: My favorite moment at secrets st James.

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear  Ida R, 

Thank you for choosing Secrets St. James as the destination to celebrate such a momentous occasion. The hotel is pleased to note that you had a lovely stay and we will be sure to pass your kind sentiments to all the team members mentioned. They will be equally pleased to hear that they were able to contribute to your positive experience with us. 
We eagerly anticipate the opportunity to welcome you back home!
Thank you again for visiting Secrets St. James.

Kind regards, 
Serene Lloyd
owner_response.author: Serene Lloyd

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Sunscape Splash Montego Bay Resort and Spa
Zoetry Montego Bay Jamaica
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Zoetry Montego Bay Jamaica, an ultra-luxurious boutique resort in the upscale Ironshore neighborhood, will bring the Endless Privileges(R) experience, where everything is included, to the island of Jamaica. This beachfront sanctuary will be located on a private stretch of white sand beach, a world away from daily distractions, but only 5 minutes from shopping, dining, golf and Sangster International Airport. Just steps away from the Caribbean Ocean, all of Zoetry Montego Bay's 49 suites will offer enhanced amenities and extraordinary architecture and features, designed to embody the holistic approach of Zoetry Wellness & Spa Resorts, with suites situated in three main buildings: Wood & Water, Bamboo and Blue Mountain - a nod to Jamaica's ecological tapestry. With Endless Privileges(R), guests will enjoy unlimited worldwide calls and concierge service, a daily bottle of sparkling wine fresh fruit, gourmet dining options with an assortment of organic food and beverage selections, 24-hour in-suite dining and more. From open terraces and balconies to floor-to-ceiling sliding doors, guests will enjoy views of the ocean or the lush tropical landscape while sparkling infinity pool, world-class spa, fitness center and yoga room will satisfy the most luxurious wishes.

address_obj.address_string: Rose Hall Main Rd Mahoe Bay, Montego Bay Jamaica

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Junior Suite King - Zoëtry Montego Bay

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This is NOT worth the price.  I was billed $850 for 1 day of staying here, I told them when I arrived that my flght was going to be very very early in the morning and I had to depart way before check out time of 12 noon, I had to leave at 8am, and beucase I am a discoverlist member I get early check ins,  however the lady at the front desk was rude and did not care , she made me wait till right at 3pm to check in, even when she knew I was only there 1 day.   then I get to the room and the ipad was broke, I could not order room service, the walls in my room were wet and mold and leaks,  the room was dirty, there was a party of loud music playing until 3am i got zero sleep, i can to cally security and she did not care to stop the music...also many hotel emplyees smoking pot non stop outside my room...
tripAdvisorReviews.title: NOT WORTH IT

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The location is very nice.  It is small, has a private beach and a lot of the rooms have a good view of the beach/ocean.  However, that is where the good things end.  The all-inclusive is NOT worth the price at all.  There is basically 1 restaurant open for breakfast, 1 for lunch and 1 for dinner everyday.  The food was mediocre at best.
As well, the service is lacking.  I booked a spa package through AMR/Hyatt before arriving, and the location had no idea what I was talking about despite being owned by AMR/Hyatt.  I had to discuss this with at least 5 people, show my confirmation, AND they still asked to see that it was charged to my credit card before they would honor it.  SOOOOO frustrating.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Not worth the all-inclusive price

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We stayed at Zoetry for 9 nights for our honeymoon. 
On arrival, we were greeted by the friendly team and offered a drink straight away. We were early for check in, but the team managed to get us in our room an hour before check in, which was great!
We were given 2 butlers, Michael-Lee and Kyle. They were so friendly and no request was too much. They came and found us daily and checked we were having a great time, and always made sure we had a drink in hand. They use a whatsapp system to contact them, which is very efficient! They even decorated our room on arrival and additionally. for my birthday with balloons and flowers during our stay. 
The bar staff at the hotel were so fun and friendly. We have to especially mention Barbara in the Lobby bar. She is so lively and kind. When I had a bad sunburn, she found me some fresh aloevera. She also, would whip up a cocktail on request of what you were fancying. The Bob Marley frozen cocktail is amazing! Kerman in the Polo lounge was so friendly and we had great conversations with him.
The resort is quiet, but this is exactly what we needed for our honeymoon. Theres live music every other evening, we especially enjoyed the steel drum band! Dario the entertainment manager is a character!
The breakfast had some great options and the coffee is fab!
We had lovely dinners every evening, with different them food cuisine evenings.
Our only suggestion would be that lunch was a little limiting. We think an everyday special food choice would be great at the Canoa. Jerky Joes is so fun and the Jerk chicken was fab!
We really enjoyed the beach as it was less windy than the pool area. They have a nice area for swimming and clean the beach and in the sea everyday!
The water sports are fun, and you receive a free snorkeling boat trip in your stay. We saw a turtle!
This is a perfect resort for relaxing and unwinding and enjoying good food and friendly staff. And the sunsets are stunning!
Thank you for making our honeymoon so wonderful!

Dear Guest;

We regret based on your feedback, that you were not satisfied with certain aspects of your stay. We wanted to address and clarify several items from your list above. Just before your arrival we experienced torrential rains which would have caused more natural elements in our ocean, which our beach team works on daily. Our beach has a natural reef which makes our waters more calm. The crab we were told you saw, was removed and put back in the natural environment. Zoetry Montego Bay is a naturally beautiful resort, with 49 suites and it is a smaller property when compared to a much larger hotel, but, that is the beauty of this location. Our Quality department is investigating thoroughly other details provided and will give us further feedback so that we can have this resolved. Should you have further feedback our quality contact email is quality.zombj@zoetryresorts.com

Customer Relations

Additionally, a variety of international restaurants and bars are at your disposal, as well as our world-class spa, state-of-the-art fitness center and an exceptional range of activities and services. tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Aerial View at Excellence Oyster Bay
Excellence Club in the Villa selection

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This hotel is meant to be a five star all inclusive property For me it fell well short and is a four star at best and I know that others have picked this up too I’m still at the hotel and can’t wait to leave in 73 hours time Don’t get me wrong I’ve been to several 5 star all inclusive properties all over the Caribbean and this has to be one of the worst value for money
I came with my wife and two adult daughters for 20 nights and was quoted $11500 for two basic suites. This proved to be double the price as compared to what is available now on the resort on the internet!
Nevertheless the site is idyllic and the facilities are great but it stops there.

The staff are friendly enough but expect a tip which is wrong for an AI resort and an attitude problem if you cross them, apparently a local trait!

They say they have ten restaurants but most are shut at lunchtime and lots at dinner so you end up eating at the same basic rubbish ones.

In fact the food is well below par (except breakfast). . There was no lobster at the lobster restaurant and don’t expect filet steak at the grill either! For the price paid this was real rubbish. The available food doesn’t compare to the other 5 star AI properties in the Caribbean and is often cold due to slow service.

Drinks: I’m not a drinker but was told that top shelf drinks didn’t compare to the other Caribbean hotels.

Animation: hardly any daytime and a miserable show at night 

Water sports They have lazy beach bum staff whose only desire is to sit in their hut doing nothing Everything they do is a favor for you ie kayakina or canoeing. You can go out in a catamaran with one of them especially if you’re female be ready for the chat up but woe to you if you want to catamaran alone. It’s too dangerous they cry but no more dangerous than other resorts I cry. Okay pay $50 and take a test they say. Ok I pay $50 and after 30 mins of sailing we come back and he says nothing except come back tomorrow.The next day a different beach bum tells me that it was too rough to assess me the previous day and that he would. After another uneventful 30 minutes where he tried to chat up my daughters who had come along we came back early the next day and he said that I could have the boat the next day solo. This was a downright lie as the next day he wanted to assess me again (with my daughters). I must add that I’m a licensed hobie 2 sail sailor ir the category above the ones in this resort albeit recovering from cancer so a bit slower to react and move but I never tipped the boat or hit anything during the test and successfully turned it around.
I declined a third test and went to see the manager who surprise surprise wasn’t in. The deputy manager heard my case and promised to relay my concerns to the manager the next day. The following day the manager wasn’t in again and I saw a hireling who stuck to the bum beach boys rules. I have never seen such poor management in my life! 
Do not believe their polite responses it’s all a facade as they all have an attitude problem when contradicted .
Instead do boycott the Excellence chain and spend your money in Cancun Mexico home of several lovely memories. I can’t wait to leave this horrible place.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A four star resort at best Not worth the moneys

tripAdvisorReviews.text: You won’t regret it. The food is very good, plenty of variety. Lots of drinks. Drink locations and the service is very frequent! The beach is beautiful, the spa is WORTH IT. Definitely check it out.  Gym is very clean, lots of equipment and space. There’s tons and tons of activities everyday so you can go from zero to 100 real easy.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Ocean Coral Spring Resort
tripAdvisorDetails.description: The Ocean Coral Spring is a new five-star resort to be opened at the end of 2019. Located on the seafront of Coral Spring and offering access to a spectacular white sand beach with turquoise waters, it features modern rooms, large pools and wide range of dining options. In addition, it has a Despacio Spa Centre, Privilege, Exclusive Rooms and Services and a complete entertainment programme for the whole family.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This was absolutely the worst lodging I have stayed in that is supposed to be a resort. The best part was one of the bartenders in the lobby, he was always pleasant and happy and helpful, and the pool, it's nice and there's a swim up bar, but that's where the "niceness" ends for me. 

It's very far from anything worth seeing, at least 45 minutes away from ACTUAL Montego Bay, there's nothing within walking distance for tourists to visit. 

The AC thermostat in the room is basically useless and there for decoration, the 1st night, my room was absolutely freezing, called maintenance and they "fixed it", the next day, it was stuffy, called again and I was told there's basically no way to adjust the temperature because the entire hotel is ran off 1 main system....WHY?!?! So all you can really do is adjust the fan speed. 

The elevators are creepy and very small and can really only fit 3 adults before it beeps at you and the door won't close, oh by the way, this is also the same elevator used by staff to transport housekeeping, room service and the beverage carts, we noticed ONE staff elevator, but again...it was small, why is there no actual service elevator??

You pretty much have to figure out your route closest to your room as there are multiple walkways and signage on the walls aren't as visible as they should be. 

About 6 restaurants and we tried 3 or 4 and they were all dreadful, bland, sometimes cold food! The cocktails are made WAAAAYYYYYY too sweet and the sodas are flat because they use 2 liter bottles and mini bottles that just sit open and get hot and flat. There's a hibachi restaurant that seemed pretty popular but we never made it because they seem to only cater to those who have a "privilege" reservation. Martha's seemed to be the go-to as it is large and buffet style, while they had a large selection of items to chose from, everything was just awful and flavorless, where is the seasoning?? The best thing I had was a rice and gravy beef dish at Red Snapper, but oh....they're only open to all during lunch hours, "privilege" only at dinner. Everyone raved about this fried chicken at Route 66 which is open late-night, but get there right when they open if you want it because they run out.....by the way....it too is bland, there's also no menu so they approach your table telling you what they DO have that night. Room service is an absolute joke, there are only 4 things available and only during lunch....unless you are "privilege". The pizza that came to my room.....I've had better school lunch pizza in the 80s. Oh and DON'T look for bottled water anywhere because they don't have any!! But they stock the rooms with it....how does that make sense??

The tile in the shower was nasty in my room and I showered in my flip flops every day, it's like they just do not have the proper cleaning solutions to remove the soap scum or whatever it is. The towel stocking is very inconsistent, I'm glad I brought my own face towel, some days I got no hand towels, some days 1 face towel. 

The beach isn't pleasant at all, the water is nasty and filled with algae and seaweed and the beach is rocky. The so-called bar on the beach, the employees seemed less than enthused to be working. 

There's a coffee shop on the premises, a jewelry store, a sports bar with a club attached to it (that plays an awful mix of 90s/early 2000s songs that nobody wants to hear), and a ridiculously expensive souvenir shop, which you're pretty much stuck shopping at if you never leave the resort. 

Nothing felt like being in Jamaica besides the accents of the staff, it really felt like I was on a cruise ship as there were "dance lessons" conducted at the pool every day.....to the same songs!

All in all....this was my 1st trip to Jamaica and I was really looking forward to it and this resort left a bad taste in my mouth, but I know there are other places and resorts so I will need a do over so I can actually thoroughly enjoy myself, and have good food and drinks.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Where do I begin??

tripAdvisorReviews.text: A group of us decided to try a new location . We came to Riu Montego Bay the year before and we also have been to Ocho Rios but decided to try a new location. The resort in my opinion is the cleanness and pretties we been to . The drive is not long but not short i would say about 40 minutes . The airport was a little busy so free tip if you can get in before 12pm that's going to help you . If you cannot get in early use Club mobay Vip its a easy way to get out of the airport its easy to google up . Once we got to the resort we could see its was new . The option for food is great i would say more than enough for our group and nobody had any complaints . If i was to nip pick i was expecting to see the soursopfruit but they didnt have any and its a great drink i had last year around this time of travel its extremely good with ice . The people are friendly and helpful and i met Crystal from the sales department at the back to the beach was one of the best conversations i had shes an excellent worker .  The entertainment was good and those people work overtime you will not be disappointed i can say its the best entertainment there . We tried all the activites including bowling and it was fun . The beach is clean and taken care of we were worried about seaweed but it wasnt an issue . Jeldean is the best omeltte maker ive met at the resort try and find her you will love them . For airport private transfers i booked with Top choice Jamaica Tours and they also arranged our Atv,zip line and dunns river falls tours .  The dunebuggy tour was a bit of a drive back to montego bay but it was so worth it . Rasta Safari was the name it was awesome fresh fruits jamaica local riding and we learned alot . I can say there extremally dependable and have been using them for 3 years now .  Desmond is great at making drinks you need so visit him at the bar and remember the name . Everyone in Jamaica made our trip great and this one was special since it was my best friends anniversary . These are all the tips i can offer which has helped me so i hope others have a better experience .  Tip all your workers and drivers brings 20s 10s 5s and 1 dollars is really all you need we had about $400 in tips with us . Have about $2000 for excursions for options . The people love USD cash dont change it at the airport its a huge lost for all .
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Beautiful Place

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
First and foremost, if you have made this reservation and there’s a way for you to get out of it and select another resort don’t wait another second. Feel completely duped by Air Canada vacations and a ridiculous five star rating that this resort purports to be.

If you cannot change your plans, some quick advice which really won’t change your experience but at least you will know before you go. Firstly go to the bank and pull out at least US$2-300 in ones and fives, you will need this because no staff person will even make eye contact unless you were holding money in your hand. The blatant tipping culture, is one thing, however with some exceptions, the staff are rude and do not want to help at all even with money in hand. 

Second prepare yourself for low end mediocre food, especially in the marthas market, route 66, red snapper and Jamaica grill, where it is 2 star motel level. Again if you want to have anything that is “better“, it’s on the menu for a $50 usd up-charge, but don’t expect this to change the quality.

On the positive side, the pool is huge and clean and well-maintained. Also the housekeeping staff are thorough and room was in good repair and well serviced by the cleaning staff. 

Specifics
- gym small and some equipment in disrepair, ok not 5 star. But the worst is no sanitizing wipes anywhere
- Needed extra toilet paper one evening as wife was unwell, went to front desk but they insisted to send someone, the guy that brought it to the room wouldn’t hand it over without a $5 tip at the door at 11pm
- The bars..where to start: understaffed  to be sure and hand washing plastic cups in front of customers because they are constantly running short. The cups are picked up in dirty plastic bags which are dumped right on the bar and rewashed by hand as you wait! All the mix comes from plastic soda bottles left open and warm. The beer taps constantly malfunction and run out often. Never mind as mentioned they won’t even look at you if you don’t have cash in hand. Do not expect proper drinks you would get at any basic bar, more like a frat party level of the cheapest standards, with the slowest and rudest service.
- With all the tipping needed, the atm charges $7 service fee to get cash out. Then there is nowhere to get small bills except back out from to the bellmen. They will change your money but not without a $5 tip!
- As mentioned in other reviews there are not enough umbrellas by the pool, so if your not at the pool to get your towels down forget it. Also discovered a new trick near end of trip, the pool attendants take the metal pins from umbrellas, yes it will cost you to get one from them…$ . Also if your not up by 6am your chances of getting an umbrella is nil, and a lounge chair is 50/50 as they are all taken
- In the restaurants impossible to get reservations, so end up eating at cafeteria for dinners. Waiter brings drinks sometimes in 15 mins or doesn’t at all. Order the wine and we learned guests can at least get up to serve themselves.
- The coffee shop in the morning is staffed by just two poor people stuck serving a huge lineup, I feel so bad for them no wonder you can tell they hate the guests and their jobs. Expect to wait at least 15 mins for a tiny cup of latte or cappuccino. At one point saw what appeared to be a manager come in finally to maybe take charge, he looked at the huge lineup of annoyed guests. To my shock he gets behind the counter, makes himself a coffee and walks back outside. Stunned..

In summary if they advertised a 3 star and it was an incredible deal at half of what we paid, most of this would still be completely unacceptable. However stating they are ‘5 stars’ is the kicker, not only would we never stay here again (even if they paid me), there is zero chance we will ever return to Jamaica. What a waste of money but more importantly valuable family time ruined for a week we can’t get back. Blame rests squarely on bad management, there is simply no one in charge here. The owners need to get a professional operator and clean this mess up, as structurally the resort is beautiful, just so badly managed. Far too many great choices to pick from in Caribbean, do your self and family a favour avoid at all costs!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Ocean coral springs - do yourself a favour and avoid or at least be informed for what to expect.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Royalton Negril, An Autograph Collection All-Inclusive Resort
tripAdvisorDetails.description:
Looking for a place to stay in Negril? Then look no further than Royalton Negril, a romantic all-inclusive resort that brings the best of Negril to your doorstep.
Guest rooms offer amenities such as a flat screen TV, a minibar, and air conditioning, and guests can go online with free wifi offered by the all-inclusive resort.
Royalton Negril features a concierge and room service, to help make your stay more enjoyable. The property also boasts a pool and free breakfast. If you are driving to Royalton Negril, free parking is available.
Given the close proximity to Mary, Gate of Heaven Catholic Church (3.0 mi), guests of Royalton Negril can easily experience one of Negril's most popular landmarks.
While visiting Negril, you may want to try some shrimp at one of the nearby restaurants, such as Fireman's Lobster Pit, The Best in the West, or Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville Negril.
Best of all, Royalton Negril makes it easy to experience some great Negril attractions like Negril Lighthouse, which is a popular lighthouse.
We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Royalton Negril as you experience everything Negril has to offer.

address_obj.address_string: Norman Manley Blvd, Negril JMDWD14 Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I am a returning resident havent been home in years so i was looking forward to coming to Negril the last time i was here i was in my teens . I took 2 flights to get here and the drive took a while felt like 2hrs so i highly recommend unless you love sitting on a bus waiting for people then use a private taxi i used Top choice Jamaica tours and i can say i was impressed with the service and consistency from online response to drivers i never expected it from local drivers its been a while for me . Anyways lets talk about the resort it looks great and i have no issues with the local staff . I do have an issue with the towels and i believe better management to oversea them might be really needed  I was there 6 nights and 3 days by 11am they were gone . I didn't get any oxtail that was very disappointing because thats what i came thinking i would get .  Jamaicans love oxtail please fix this . The drinks were okay entertainment people worked extremely hard . I did learn a few dance moves to bring back to home . I would say the beaches were clean not over spectacular . I would have prefer more local beats being played i beleive people coming here dont want to hear the same songs there use to . Im a coffe guy and the coffee was good . Jerk chicken was okay but the one at best in the west was so much better . I saw 2 weddings and they seem happy . My room was big clean and i had an ocean view . It did rain a bunch but i still had fun with my crew . I would say its not perfect and maybe i was expecting alot more maybe it was this time . I would come back to see if the food options are better but overall theres nothing here to say oh they ruin my vacation . The staff work hard ill say it again managment where are you and i will leave it just at that . PS Yanique is a great worker .
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Enjoyed it

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Azul Beach Resort Negril by Karisma
tripAdvisorDetails.description:
Located in Negril on the island's western coast, this is a pristine paradise featuring dramatic sunsets and tranquil waters, and where couples, families and friends can reconnect beneath brilliant blue skies and tropical sunshine.

This ocean view suite hotel offers spacious, contemporary oceanfront accommodations, with special adults-only sections dedicated exclusively to romantic honeymoon suites. You'll find a variety of restaurants serving masterfully prepared and artfully presented International cuisine, enhanced by breathtaking ocean views. There's a world-class spa. Premium liquor. Live entertainment day and night. A near endless variety of activities on land and in the crystal clear waters. And supervised programs for kids and teens designed to make sure everyone has a great time.

Within this vacation landscape, we've created two distinct luxury enclaves to suit your individual tastes.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: FOOD IS HORRIBLE...FOOD SUCKS...BAD FOOD...ON RESORT STAFF ACT LIKE THEY DONT WANT YOU THERE!  MALE STAFF IS GREAT, FEMALES HAVE HORRIBLE DISPOSITIONS.  I'd rather eat at Golden Coral...did I say the worst food ever!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Not for Foodies

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
It’s incredibly difficult to enjoy your vacation when you are woken up out of your bed due to a fire alarm!!! My husband and I had to exit the building in our pajamas in the middle of the night. There were several staff on the outside that provided no direction for guests. Guests got tired of being outside and just went back in the building. We had absolutely no idea if the building was safe to go back into or not (had no idea if it was on fire on just a false alarm). Families with kids we’re woken up out of their sleep. It was a nightmare. Then when everyone got back to their rooms, it went off in the building next to us. We had to pop our head out the room to see if it was our building again. A concierge member called the next morning to ask how our stay was going. I asked if they knew why the alarm went off and they simply replied they weren’t aware it had gone off - there weren’t any notes left for them and they would look into it.

But wait… there’s more! The fire alarm went off in various parts of the resort 6 times in 36 hours (that we witnessed). It went off the next night while we were sleeping again. Went off in the buffet while we were eating dinner the next night. Never received a response from the concierge, but the next day when I went to the front desk they reported that the alarm from the first night was someone smoking in their room. They had no idea about the others as they hadn’t been able to “investigate” them yet. They also took no responsibility on their staff’s inability to communicate to their guests on whether the building was safe to enter or not. We also inquired about their protocols for evacuation, because some guests never even left their rooms when the alarms went off. They looked at me without an answer. Heavens forbid if there really was a fire, because you are on your own.

Also, we had reservations at the Italian restaurant. We waited an hour and a half for our food. Then only 3 out of 4 guests in our party were served and we were told that the other persons food was coming. All three of us finished our food and the other persons plate never arrived.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Alarming

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Food was disappointing . Too many vendors on the beach. US State Department advised “don’t leave the reservation”.  Advised that sexual assaults are prevalent at all inclusive results.  Also noted the insurance will cover you if you injure or die as result of cliff diving.  We received the advisory as were on the beach.  No matter what you hear, Jamaica is a 3rd world country.  Im not going back, stick with US Virgin Islands.  The resort itself was nothing special.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Buyer beware

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Our family went twice to this location! The beach is beautiful and my family of 14 loved it there. Davita and Adrienne set the bar so high for butler staff for Karisma group! They went all out for our large family and they made our whole vacation!!! Ms carrianne the bartender was excellent too! We will definitely be back!!!

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Couples Swept Away
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Immediately upon entering Couples Swept Away, you realize that you have arrived in paradise. Exotic flowers bloom amidst acres of green—on seven miles of the purest white sand beach in Negril, Jamaica. Dotted among the tropical gardens—open-air cafes, small pool enclaves and fresh fruit oases are yours to discover. Never crowded or hurried, the resort offers an intimate tranquility and when desired, total seclusion. All rooms embrace a quiet elegance with island cedar furnishings and pure white linens. Plantation shutters open onto private verandahs with views of gardens and azure sea. Breezy open-air restaurants engage candle-lit lanterns and billowing white curtains to strike a romantic note. While the pristine 10-acre sports complex encompasses every imaginable activity, the superb spa serves as a haven of relaxation. Couples Swept Away simply captures your heart and soothes your soul.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
As a first timer, I read as much as I could before going to CSA. I must say that every negative thing that I read about, was never a problem for us. I brought the bug repellant, but never had to use it. I brought the towel clips, but it probably wasn’t necessary. I brought extra sunscreen, but the gift shop sunscreen was not as expensive as some said. Even the comments about clothes not drying overnight was not an issue for us because we had a very comfortable air-conditioned room that dried our bathing suits and wet clothing just fine. Used the resort transportation from airport, no problems. Bottom line, if you are not “high maintenance”,  you will love CSA. Beautiful grounds, wonderful food, friendly people, superb staff, awesome options for excursions and things to do, and gorgeous beach and water!!
Can’t wait to go back.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Heaven on Earth!

We are also delighted that you enjoyed our facilities and we can't wait to welcome you back to CSA for another amazing experience. 

Kind regards,

Couples Customer Care Team
owner_response.author: Michelle Gordon

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This was our third visit to Couples Swept Away. I have read other reviews this time before going to see what others thought.

I would agree the resort is getting a bit dated, but I am not there to live in a room but to enjoy the beach. The rooms were clean, and the cleaning staff did a great job. It’s only dated because nothing has changed over the years. Is that bad? In this case, I really don’t think it is. Our room had air conditioning and you can set them to whatever your comfort level is. At night you can hear the music and occasional traffic but most of that stops after 10pm. 
The food was good. The main buffet had adequate choices and a few nights per week you can order from a menu which was a nice touch. The restaurants that required a reservation were even better. They could be a bit more efficient with the omelet and pasta stations, and that could be easily remedied with placement of product and better trained cooks. But it was bearable. My wife said their house wine was good. I had the liquor, and it was perfectly fine. 
The beach and the included activities are what makes this place shine. It’s what most others we talked to really raved about and of course I would agree. It can be relaxing if you choose, or it can be active if you take part in all the included water activities. Only part of Jamaica I don’t like is the constant annoyance of the local beach vendors. I can only imagine what it would be like without them constantly trying to sell you something. I don’t understand why this concept has continued to go on when so many see it as a negative to their experience on the beach. I understand they need to make a living, but I suspect there are a few alternatives for them. The approved vendors who had tables to set up their goods was a very pleasant experience, and they were not pushy at all. 
If you love a beach with activities, this is the place for you. The staff in general where pleasant and the wait staff in the buffet were always filling up our water and asking if we wanted another drink. They were well trained and alert at most times. 
For the negative, we had a few, most not worth mentioning. I do need to mention one item that was noticeable this time around. I don’t think I ever noticed it prior. Maybe it’s the age group or post covid but the amount of tipping I witnessed was a bit alarming. To the point that it was getting to be expected. I did notice a service level difference with those who did and trust me word got around who was a good tipper and those that did not. I had to start tipping just to avoid being ignored. I think the staff need a reminder to simply refuse the tipping. I also understand that most probably made a subsistence level income. It’s management’s responsibility to make sure they are paid fairly in line with the other resorts. Once tipping starts, it’s very hard to stop and makes the vacationers uneasy and starts to generate a two-class system of visitors. Another alternative is to simply allow it and let the chips fall where they shall. It’s hard for me to tip a bartender when I go to the bar and get 2 drinks. However, it's much easier for me to tip a person carrying luggage all day. I will let the resort figure out a solution. I simply want to say I have witnessed it on more than one occasion there this time around. 
Would I go again. Yes, this is a good place for a good price. The staff are friendly, they are for the most part doing things right. It’s a shame it takes around 2 hours to get there from the airport. You can fly from the airport to Negril but it’s expensive. I know the people there get taxed around 13% for sales they make, and the resorts also get taxed. I must ask, where does this money go? It’s not infrastructure as I have witnessed no improvements in 5 years. I can only imagine if the roads were done nicely how much more traffic the resorts might get or even the local stores. It’s a shame the money we spend there doesn’t seem to be given back to the people in the form of local utilities and infrastructure improvements.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Awesome Beach and Sunset

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear lonw347, 

Thank you for sharing your feedback on your third visit to Couples Swept Away. We're glad to hear that you found the rooms clean and comfortable, and that the staff provided pleasant service throughout your stay.

We appreciate your positive comments about the food, especially the options available at the main buffet and the quality of the house wine. We also understand your observations regarding the omelet and pasta stations, and we'll take them into consideration for improvement.

It's fantastic to hear that you enjoyed the beach and the included activities, which made your stay shine. 
We  apologize for any inconvenience caused by local beach vendors, and we'll continue to address this matter with our security personnel.

We appreciate your kind words about the well-trained and attentive staff, and we understand your concerns about tipping. Please note that our resort has a no tipping policy to create an equal and inclusive experience for all guests. We'll continue to reinforce this policy with our staff and explore ways to address the issues you observed.

We value your feedback and hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for another enjoyable stay in the future.

Kind regards,
Couples Customer Care Team
owner_response.author: Michelle Gordon

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I cannot express how much we loved this holiday!!! This is by far my best holiday I have ever been on. 
Firstly the staff are the most friendliest I have ever met they actually made our holiday. Big shout out to Kenroy and George at the pool side bar!! We had so much laughter here and the drinks were amazing. The staff in the Nightclub (RJ) and we have forgotten some names were all so nice. And all of the dinner staff everyone was so nice we cannot name them all. 
Me and my husband loved our room. The tree frogs you hear at night are amazing and there is so much to do on site.
We tried the bob marley trip and dunns river falls. This is a whole day trip and did take us from 6.30am un till 7.30pm but totally worth it. Our guide was amazing and kept giving us information about Jamaica.
We took the free glass bottom boat ride and the captain was hilarious. Made the trip.
All food was amazing I didn't eat anything the same. There were different restaurants and all had very different food. The daily grill made food to order and its delicious!!
We didn't find any waiting for food.
Cats are not an issue from reading other reviews. There are not loads we counted 5 and they don't bother you at all if you don't want them too. They are not around you when eating.
When we arrived on the first night we were greeted so well. Hot towels and champagne. 
The acts were very good and we watched whilst eating a meal. If you want to party a little the piano bar is good and they open the Nightclub untill you are ready to leave.
We had our room opposite the Nightclub and you cannot hear it from our room as it is located upstairs.

Honestly we will be back yearly it was so good!! Cannot wait to see you again Couples Resort from a very chilled out couple wishing they were there now in the UK.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: PARADISE!! What an amazing hotel x

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear edsdiamondd,

Thank you for taking the time to share your incredible experience at our hotel! We're thrilled to hear that it was the best holiday you've ever been on.

It's wonderful to know that our staff, particularly Kenroy, George, and the poolside bar team, made such a positive impact on your stay. We appreciate the shoutout to RJ and the Nightclub staff as well. We'll be sure to pass along your kind words to all the staff members who made your holiday memorable.

We're delighted that you enjoyed your room and the unique sounds of the tree frogs at night. It's great to hear that you found plenty to do on-site and that the excursions, such as the Bob Marley trip and Dunn's River Falls, were worth the full day's adventure

Thank you for your heartfelt comments and for your intention to return yearly. We can't wait to welcome you back to Couples Resort for another amazing and relaxing holiday. Until then, take care, and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Kind regards, 

Couples Customer Care Team
owner_response.author: Michelle Gordon

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Grand Pineapple Beach Negril
tripAdvisorDetails.description: The All-inclusive Grand Pineapple Beach Resort Negril is authentically Caribbean architecture featuring gingerbread trim and bright colors in this intimate, low-key resort.The resort’s 14 multi colored cottages and Manor rooms bring back memories of Jamaica’s Old Plantation Great Houses with their spectrum of colors in over 4 acres of luscious gardens drenched in privacy, creating a peaceful retreat as far from everything as you care to be.The cottages are complimented by two blocks of manor rooms on the Beach and Garden side of the resort, each replicating the past Jamaican architectural magnificence. The Resort is moderately priced, catering to singles, couples and families alike. This quiet oasis is the essence of Negril...casual, relaxed, laidback and unhurried.

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: The Pool at the Grand Pineapple Beach Negril

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The first time we stayed in November of 2016 this place had a different manager and the rooms were brightly colored and we had open shutters that looked out to our patio.  We loved it.  We went back in March of 2017 and they had a new manager, this is when we started seeing things go down hill.  It was so crowded in March with regulars who go every March. We decided never to go in March again. The last time we went was the LAST! The staff is miserable. There are a few that you can tell are taken care of by the regulars , but most walk around with a frown on their face and the bar tender we had was horrible. never made eye contact with us never smiled. They have run out of alcohol every time we have stayed there. The food is sub par and not worth paying for.Plan on buying your own beer too because they run out often. Plus all they offer is the regular redstripe. They dont even have the light Red Stripe beer. This place is owned by Sandals and they treat their employees awfully.  We had ONE employee that we loved there and he always was smiling. He left and went to Sandals to work. DO NOT STAY HERE. The rooms are run down and old. Our toilet over flowed three times we had to have it fixed. They painted the outside of these places to all light blue and took out the shutters. That took away the Caribbean vibe and they did nothing to improve the inside of the rooms. Stay anyplace but here. Horrible, Stay at any other place but here. Food and Drinks they include are limited and awful.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Third time was not the charm

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Hello and thank you for taking the time to share your review of Grand Pineapple Negril. It saddens us to know that in spite of our best efforts, you would have returned home with a diminished opinion of our resort. We are committed to providing our guests with the highest quality services and facilities and we sincerely regret if we fell short of our goal in this instance. 

With deep respect, we are baffled by your comments regarding the treatment of our team members by Management and wish to highlight that Grand Pineapple Negril has a sterling record in community relations and more significantly a documented and practiced internal relations.  The Management of Grand Pineapple Negril has always viewed our team members as our greatest asset and in recognition of this philosophy which forms the basis our operation, we continually strive to solicit feedback from our team members on their experiences and how we can facilitate and energize their work environment. We also have recognition programs for team members for their long and dedicated service to Grand Pineapple Negril at our Staff Awards Ceremonies. Nevertheless, we do remain respectful of the opinions you have expressed and should you have a change of heart in the future, we would be truly grateful to have you as a guest again for a stay that we trust will be more in line with your expectations as a past guest.
owner_response.author: Shawn Redhead

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This was our fourth time to GPB.  We traveled in the beginning of February and returned for the Super Bowl.  Enjoyed last years bowl by accident, and returned for this years by design.  A lot of the same returning guests each year on this weekend.  Fun to see them again.  They put out a snack buffet during the game and also were serving dinner at that time.  Watching the super bowl on the beach in Negril in February equals a lot of fun.  

This place is fun, some what quiet, and very relaxing.  If you like to relax and just chill,  this could be your place.  It has become my favorite place.  It's not fancy,  you won't get knocked off your feet with amenities.  But it checks all the boxes for my wife and I.  I have noticed the last couple of years that feedback has lead to improvements.  The buildings on the beachside have been painted.  I thought they looked very nice.  The bathroom in our room looked as if it had been painted and freshened up some.  We have stayed in this particular room before.  Windows in the rooms have replaced the old glass shutter type windows.  I have noticed subtle changes in the food service for the better.  The deserts continue to please.  We always enjoy going out for dinner a night or two to nearby businesses. The only suggestion  my wife would have, to offer yogurt at breakfast each morning.  More of a dietary request.  A couple of mornings when it wasn't on the buffet, she asked and was able to get it from the kitchen.  

The only suggestion that I have would be to keep the band playing longer on the nights that they are there.  At times it  is nice just to sit and chill, after dinner, and listen and have fun with the band.  Yes there are several places nearby  to enjoy entertainment,  but it is really nice to hang at the Pineapple and enjoy the evening.

I have always enjoyed the employees of GPB.  All have been friendly and willing to help in any way.  Marvette, Jeffroy always greet us upon our return.  Everitt keeps the grounds looking top notch all the time.  Already booked for next year for the Super bowl.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The pineapple has always been a bit rough and ready, but we’ve always put of with this, because of the group of friends we meet there, but enough is enough. From the moment you check in, the welcome is not very warm and things go down hill from there. The staff are friendly but you can tell they are not happy in their work. If you want want a drink past 10pm you will need to go to the supermarket and buy your own because they frequently run out. The food is not the best either; if there is something half decent to eat in the trays it soon disappears and there’s a long wait to refill, so be prepared to go out and eat somewhere else, there are some nice restaurants near by. The returners dinner was a joke! We were served RAW steak, most of the people I spoke to either sent it back or couldn’t eat it (and good luck if you’re a vegetarian as your meal may never arrive). Overall we won’t be returning for the 5th time unless some drastic changes take place...shame
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Fourth time and...

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This was our third time staying at the Grand Pineapple. We love this place. We love the resort because it is small and we get to see a lot of the same faces every year. The staff is great ! The one thing I really like about this place is that its very quaint. This isn’t a 5 star resort so if that’s what you want, don’t come here. That is the one reason I come here. I’m not real fond of the snobby people that usually go to those resorts. This place is laid back and quiet for the most part. Alfreds next door can keep you up if you are close to the beach. The guys and girls on the beach selling stuff can get a little overwhelming sometimes, but usually understand a polite no thank you.There are only a few things I would like to see different. I would love to see an updated salad bar and more variety on the food choices. The breakfast egg station needs to keep more omelet ingredients all the way until 10. Some of us like to sleep in on vacation. Oh yeah, please cook the bacon CRISPY !!!! Other than that everything is irie. Great beach,  with lots to do if you want.  We booked our return trip next February. I can’t wait to get back to Jamaica.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: It was back to Hedonism II for more fun times.  I've gone several times over the years yet the resort continues to make positive changes and continued maintenance.  And it's nice to have Hedo staff members welcome you home with a big smile (Uvaun at the bar, Ms T Abbot in the dining hall, Deneisha our housekeeper and others)   The lobby recently got remodeling touches and it really looks nice, and there are tree signs now around resort showcasing what types of tress they area - all nice touches.
