tripAdvisorReviews.text:
A great week at H2.  This was our first trip to Hedonism II but not our first trip to a lifestyle resort.  We try to take a lifestyle vacation every year but other things keep us from being able to do it.  

Our experience at H2 was very good and we didn't know what to expect in comparison to the other resorts we have been too.  We will say it was a very fun week and depending on where you are in the lifestyle you can find a flavor that meets what you want.  One thing we love about Hedo is there is plenty of room to do what caters to what you want at the resort.  We probably mixed it up throughout the week.   So here is our take:

Nude Beach / Pool Area:
We spent most of our week at the nude beach and most days we would spend the later afternoon hours in the pool with the fun.  Since we are beach people we prefer the beach.   The pool is fun and the activities will definitely keep you laughing and entertained.  You can feel free to do your thing in the pool and others will enjoy as well and participate.   The Mrs. is hard of hearing so when the pool fun cranks up it can be hard to have a conversation but definitely a good time.  

We love the fact that we can walk up to the bar and grabs drinks as well as eat lunch at the grill at the nude beach. 

Clothing Optional Beach:
There were a few days where the sargassum seaweed took over the nude beach so we moved down the the clothing optional beach for this simple reason.  After a few days they had the sargassum cleaned up.  We found the clothing optional beach very relaxing and quiet.  While some don't strip down most do but that's not an issue for us.  The Flame grill is close by for lunch and the bar at the clothing optional pool is easy to get too.  One thing about the clothing optional beach that we discovered with some new friends we met was the far end towards Sandals in the evening you can chill on the beach and watch the sunsets.  Very nice and calming.

Food Options:
The food was great and there were plenty of options to mix it up.  We mixed it up throughout the week and were pleased with every dining location.  

Entertainment:
The shows were fun every evening and the piano bar was a great place to hit   after the shows.  Most evenings we would watch the show and then hang out in the main dining for a while or move to the piano bar or one of the bar areas to simply chat with our friends and new found friends.

Other Stuff and Activities:
The walk down 7 Mile Beach is nice and we enjoyed checking out the shops along the way.  Half the fun is talking with the locals trying to sell us stuff some legal and most not.  Always entertaining conversations.  Taking your vanilla pictures along the beach is proof if your kids ask that you went to another resort. LOL

We used the dive shop to take snorkeling trips and glass bottom boat trips.  Marcus was a great and funny as hell.   If you want you can also sail, surf sail and scuba dive but we simply didn't do those.  Plenty of stuff to do. 

Kuma Sutra:
We did the couples tantric massage and lets just say it was very relaxing and  enlightening.  Read up on what it is and discuss as a couple before you take the plunge.  We highly recommend it.  

So overall we love the place.  The staff was great, we felt the service was great and the resort is beautiful.  The rooms were a little small for our taste but not a deal breaker by any means.  The daily room service was great and our room was always cleaned and refreshed every day.

Thanks to the Hedo staff for a great experience and we will be back very soon.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Added Another Favorite Adult Only Vacation Location

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My husband and I came to Hedo for the first time ever in June. And wow, what an outstandingly awesome experience! We loved the food, the entertainment, the pool parties, the staff, and made many sexy and/or meaningful connections with other guests. This is truly such a unique place and you can be sure that we'll be back.

I especially wanted to mention about the experiences we had at the Kama Sutra Palace. We did 4/5 of the free hour-long workshops on tantric meditation/sex practices and they were wonderful - hard to describe, you would just have to experience them. We have already tried some of the new sex positions, and the results are both ecstatic and relationship-deepening.

We also had a one-hour tantric massage with Carlo and Rosie. I still get the warm fuzzies when I think about it. So different from a conventional massage. Not really sexual, Carlo and Rosie were 100% appropriate at all times... but at the same time *deeply* sexual in that one of us had a sort of all-over-body orgasm that lasted for a looong time.What they teach you at Kama Sutra Palace transcends raw animal sexuality and quick orgasms by a lot, it just elevates sex and how we treat each other to a potential whole new plane. 

We talked about it after the massage and they said that is actually their goal with these workshops. Carlo and Rosie are lovely people, beautiful human beings who just happen to have Jedi-level mastery over the tantric and energetic arts. HIGHLY recommended. They said they're going to come up with some new workshops for next year - so now we can't wait to come back!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Kama Sutra Palace - What an incredible bonus

tripAdvisorDetails.description: The All Inclusive 24h Hotel Riu Palace Tropical Bay opens all year round and is located on Jamaica's west coast, in the tourist area of Negril, on the island's longest and most beautiful beach. Riu Palace is the most elegant category in the RIU hotel chain, with hotels that meet the highest standards in terms of luxury, excellence and sophistication, creating a unique experience. The location is ideal due to its proximity to Negril (6 km), Montego Bay (80 km) and Sangster International Airport Montego Bay (MBJ) (80 km) and invites you to explore the area. The hotel is surrounded by lush tropical gardens and has 452 comfortably furnished rooms with free WiFi and many amenities. Relax in our spa or get in shape at the gym. 3 outdoor pools, 1 of them with swim up bar, and 1 children's pool. For the youngest guests, RiuLand kids’ club (4-7 & 8-12 years old). For adults, daytime and evening entertainment and water sports. For lovers of gastronomy, live cooking stations and themed buffets at our main restaurant, as well as Fusion, Italian, Japanese and Steakhouse specialty restaurants; 6 bars located in different areas of the hotel.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Rockhouse Hotel
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Rockhouse is a boutique hotel stretching across the cliffs of Pristine Cove. Nestled amongst eight acres of tropical lush gardens, thatched roofed villas are perched on the water's edge. Guests swim in the sixty foot horizon pool or take the stairs carved into the rock down to the cove for snorkeling on the reef. Home to two award winning restaurants - the Rockhouse Restaurant & Bar and the Pushcart Restaurant & Rum Bar. The renowned Rockhouse Spa has a philosophy that is a simple, holistic approach to well-being, health and happiness. Yoga classes are offered daily overlooking the sea.Consistently ranked one of the top resorts in the Caribbean, the Rockhouse won Caribbean's Leading Boutique Hotel 2011, 14, 16 &17 and JA's Leading Spa 2014-16 at the World Travel Awards. Also, the Rockhouse was also voted the No. 1 "Best Value Hotel in the Caribbean" in Travel + Leisure's "World's Best Value Awards" and included in Conde Naste Traveler's Readers Choice list of "Best in the World".

tripAdvisorReviews.text: It's hard to even start this review because words don't quite capture how special this place is. We booked a standard room, and we still very much enjoyed every aspect of this hotel. Huge value in this resort for how clean and unique it is.  The things that REALLY shine, are the location, tranquility of the cliffs and the ability to just jump off from multiple places into a bath warm ocean with snorkeling, and seculded beach chairs facing a gorgeous cliff ocean hotel. Just as spectacular as the location is the STAFF. We can't say enough about every person we met, they are clearly taken well care of a trained and seem to like their jobs. They are attentive, kind, happy and remarkably fun. Front desk took very good care of us when we had a room concern (nothing major at all). Our standard room had everything we needed and a place to just lay out heads as we preferred hanging by the cliffs near the pool and really like the 2 for 1 happy hour at the pool bar. We stayed 3 nights and it was long enough but 4 or 5 would have been more than welcomed.there was this weird ability to "shut down" completely and it felt like a tranquil and happy peice of heaven. This is a remarkably BEAUTIFUL resort. We did the complimentary yoga on the Tues and liked it a lot. We rented flippers and brought our own snorkel gear and the flippers were 3 bucks for the day each. Super reasonable. Beds are comfortable and rooms very clean. We did explore outside the resort for food, and really enjoyed next door, some local grub at sips and bites. Ask to take it to go and eat it on the cliffs while reading and tanning. It's all very close by. We heard the restaurant was lovely and pushcart has a a DJ night life but we were early to rise, early to bed to enjoy outside the most during the day. We even walked to Rick's and wasn't really impressed as Rockhouse is superior in every way without the hoards of tourists. This is a bucket list place, and a must do.  I paddle boarded every morning too and saw sting rays and fun things way down deep in the water but it was very safe. I checked out a lot of cliff front places. Once we got there we walked down the road and checked the other places out. This resort is the best one for our budget, no doubt. Only room tip I have is for the extra 50 bucks do the studios as they are just farther from the road. If you have the budget for the villa it definitely will kick up the luxury. We are just greatful to the lovely WONDERFUL staff for making our stay super special and we will be back. We especially felt great after finding out how much they really give back to supporting local schools and are farm to table with their food being grown around the corner. It's business run as it should with the intent to creat an amazing experience AND be socially responsible. This place is remarkably special. We miss you all and will be back - Walker and Tammy.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Don't hesitate, there's something extra special here!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This hotel was picture perfect and very relaxing. Super nice staff, especially Richardo Mcmillan who always had a smile on his face and took the time to draw my daughter a beautiful picture. Our room was amazing with a beautiful view. Highly recommend.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Highly recommend

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We had a wonderful stay at Rockhouse - the property and water is truly spectacular!

ROOMS:
Most rooms were booked out for our dates and as we needed an extra bed for our 13yo we settled on the Deluxe Studio.  The price of Deluxe Studio is really great value if you are more adventurous and less inclined to spend time in your room except for sleeping etc.
The studio rooms are in a great position on the large property, right near the main pool.  The rooms themselves were large enough and clean.  The issue with these rooms though is they are VERY dark with little natural light.  They also do not have glass windows, so you hear every noise that comes through the bug screens and shutters.  Lots of mosquitos as well, though the hotel supplied bug spray in each room.  Housekeeping fantastic.  We enjoyed our room for the price and it was only 3 nights, however, for a longer stay I would have preferred a villa or the new rooms behind the pool.  The main issue for us was how dark the rooms were and the fact they had no proper windows.

GROUNDS:
The property is so unique which is what makes it so special.  The water is unbelievable and makes for a fun trip.  We spent most of our days swimming, using the free paddle boards which are scattered throughout the property, snorkeling, jumping off various rocks and using the wonderful pool.  Whilst large the resort is easy to navigate and the signage for where you can enter the water is well mapped out.  
The ocean is not too rough at Rockhouse compared to some other places we visited along the cliffs.  We also saw dolphins every night which was very cool!
The swimming pool is lovely, not many loungers around the pool but ample supply on the adjacent sun deck.  Pool service from the staff working at the bar was sensational, they did such a great job and were so prompt with taking your order, cleaning up etc.

RESTAURANTS:
We tried both Rockhouse and Pushcart for dinner which was nice at both - yet on the pricier side.  Breakfast at Rockhouse each morning was delicious and reasonably priced (except fresh juices which were similar price to a cocktail!?)
Pool bar was great for drinks and a small menu for lunch/snacks.  Happy hour was 5pm until sunset and great value.  

LOCATION:
Great location on the west end.  Next door to Rockhouse is a small mini mart which I used to buy water and some other shelf grocery items.
If you're eager, it is a short route taxi ride to other west-end highlights like Rick's Cafe etc in one direction or the main town in the other direction.  Route taxis very easy to catch from the front of property.

Overall we had a wonderful stay.  The room we chose was cheap so I can't complain about it too much, but would definitely upgrade to a different room for a longer stay,
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Wonderful property in great location and 10/10 water!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Average hotel facility 
We came for a spa day and a hotel, whilst staying on the island as we liked the restaurant last time, 
On arrival our room was in the back of the garden hardly a sea view and everything was so expensive 
Staff were so so not the friendliest Iv come accross in a boutique spa hotel of this standard 
Also me and wife had a massage. Which was very average and pretty methodical rather than helpful 
All Around average stay , probably be returning for a night in the caves next…
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Average Joe

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We booked a premium villa for a 3 night stay at Rockhouse Hotel. At the time of booking, I made a special request to have a villa furthest away from the main road. To my disappointment, they gave us Villa #1 which was the villa directly across from the home with a barking dog which ran along the main road.  After reading several reviews prior to check in, I was fully aware which villas were along the main road and this villa in particular had complaints about a barking dog. I was very upset that they had ignored my request. I even told the front desk there is a barking dog and the bell hop said, "There is no barking dog, ma'am." Obviously, that was a flat out lie. This dog was a night guard dog and whenever it saw something, it would bark. This made it very difficult to get decent rest. If you are in Villas 1 - 4... you will witness this yourselves. For the price you are paying, my expectations is to able to rest comfortably. For this reason, I am rating a 2 star. The property itself is lovely, but if you cannot guarantee which room you are in, I would just visit the property rather than staying there.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Villa #1 - Traffic & barking dog

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Royalton Negril, An Autograph Collection All-Inclusive Resort
tripAdvisorDetails.description:
Looking for a place to stay in Negril? Then look no further than Royalton Negril, a romantic all-inclusive resort that brings the best of Negril to your doorstep.
Guest rooms offer amenities such as a flat screen TV, a minibar, and air conditioning, and guests can go online with free wifi offered by the all-inclusive resort.
Royalton Negril features a concierge and room service, to help make your stay more enjoyable. The property also boasts a pool and free breakfast. If you are driving to Royalton Negril, free parking is available.
Given the close proximity to Mary, Gate of Heaven Catholic Church (3.0 mi), guests of Royalton Negril can easily experience one of Negril's most popular landmarks.
While visiting Negril, you may want to try some shrimp at one of the nearby restaurants, such as Fireman's Lobster Pit, The Best in the West, or Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville Negril.
Best of all, Royalton Negril makes it easy to experience some great Negril attractions like Negril Lighthouse, which is a popular lighthouse.
We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Royalton Negril as you experience everything Negril has to offer.

I want to be fair writing this review but its hard booked diamond club and felt the money spent was not worth it, we were delayed by 6 hrs checkin was a rushed process we asked for adjoining rooms, the front desk agent programed our keys to the incorrect room twice. The food was awful except the buffet. some of the staff was really nice and some act like we owed them something. my girlfriends and i wanted to relax but kept getting bothered by ppl wanting to sell us things.

my biggest complaint is diamond members are in the back part of the hotel away from the main part of the hotel and the walk is a distance the hotel does not offer caddy rides after 11pm
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Diamond package is a joke

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I am a returning resident havent been home in years so i was looking forward to coming to Negril the last time i was here i was in my teens . I took 2 flights to get here and the drive took a while felt like 2hrs so i highly recommend unless you love sitting on a bus waiting for people then use a private taxi i used Top choice Jamaica tours and i can say i was impressed with the service and consistency from online response to drivers i never expected it from local drivers its been a while for me . Anyways lets talk about the resort it looks great and i have no issues with the local staff . I do have an issue with the towels and i believe better management to oversea them might be really needed  I was there 6 nights and 3 days by 11am they were gone . I didn't get any oxtail that was very disappointing because thats what i came thinking i would get .  Jamaicans love oxtail please fix this . The drinks were okay entertainment people worked extremely hard . I did learn a few dance moves to bring back to home . I would say the beaches were clean not over spectacular . I would have prefer more local beats being played i beleive people coming here dont want to hear the same songs there use to . Im a coffe guy and the coffee was good . Jerk chicken was okay but the one at best in the west was so much better . I saw 2 weddings and they seem happy . My room was big clean and i had an ocean view . It did rain a bunch but i still had fun with my crew . I would say its not perfect and maybe i was expecting alot more maybe it was this time . I would come back to see if the food options are better but overall theres nothing here to say oh they ruin my vacation . The staff work hard ill say it again managment where are you and i will leave it just at that . PS Yanique is a great worker .
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Enjoyed it

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Sunset At The Palms
tripAdvisorDetails.description: A great spot for romantics or a destination wedding. Nestled amongst tropical gardens and flowering plants at the edge of Negril, this unique all-inclusive gem is best described as intimate, chic and serene. The resort offers 85 "tree-house-style," elegantly appointed guestrooms on ten-acres of lush landscaping, a design praised by Architectural Digest. Melt away with a soothing spa service in our unique treatment garden, cool off at the swim-up bar with a tropical drink or "chill" at the resort's five beachfront acres and two miles of white sand beach, just steps away. When dining is on the menu, you'll enjoy both international and authentic Jamaican cuisine at four restaurants and bars.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We are a returning couple and we really "got the band back together" by going again!

The Staff will get a kick out of reading this!

There is simply no place on the planet that provides the most welcoming folks, a top 5 world class beach as well as the most beautiful lush jungles and byways along with water that to me, is unmatched in beauty and safety as close to where I live near Annapolis, period!

You guys rock!

Our return to Sunset at the Palms was a Story of “Getting the Band Back Together”!

It was so cool to see so many friends from our previous visit 6 years ago! The Club Mobay(pro tip-buy their airport service if you don't have it) met us at the Gate with a sign & a smile and walked us past the 2+ hour-Disney lines to a reserved Customs agent who got us through in 4 minutes flat.

then to the Mobay lounge for a nice lunch & private bathrooms to clean up,
Omar at the car service who met us at the airport entrance with a sign remembered us from the last trip.

Shinnel who I met as my assigned concierge in ’17 and became “best of friends” was there to greet us again. Her, Chenil and Alexandra all are very good at making you feel special because they all have warm hearts.

Eric the insane-driving taxi driver was found hanging around on the road next the resort in a brand new minivan! We hired him again and he even drives sane now-progress! Much laughter and much fun!

They told us Sinclair the “knowledgeable taxi driver” doing the YS Falls trips was still there,

Kevon our Sunset beach guy was still there and even Henry the free lance boat operator who we hired before was still there!

There was Piano Paul, an elderly man in ’17 but a personable entertainer, I had feared covid may have got him. I was thrilled to recognize his playing as we were eating dinner in one of the restaurants!

They had assigned us a tree house with screens since I forgot to mention I NEED glass windows b/c of difficulty in high humidity ….my sweetheart was on it with a call to Shinnel to get us switched…and they put us back in #702 where we stayed in ’17.

Know this before you go, they are VERY accommodating. 

They even have a day pass available for a guests if you already have a friend on the Island.

It really was “getting the band back together”.

We met the new manager Romeo McIntyre (’19) who had a Returnees dinner for us and the other guests on the beach, big fire, great time. He has done a fine job of letting the folks who know how to treat their guests, do their jobs. We found no change in the level of service b/c most of the folks that worked there before, are still there!

FOOD- Huge improvement over last time! GREAT JOB Romeo! The fruit was better and the the quality of the food top to bottom was much better. I may have lost weight on that last trip but didn't this time!
Well done guys!

While 2 years of being empty certainly hurt the tropical landscape, they have obviously been working hard to restore it. The buildings also are 6 yrs in the jungle, older but still nice and cool. Imagine eating outdoors in an open but covered restaurant with fans in the middle of a lush jungle….zero bugs!

There was a reason that we returned when we could have chosen to go anywhere..................it's really that nice!

Hey Kerry, can I talk about Dash?

Special K
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Getting the Band Back Together

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Over 16 years ago we were looking for an adult only, quite, relaxing place and found SSAP.  It was magnificent. Just stayed here again as a repeat guest and it blew us away. Food was amazing (and we are foodies).  Beach was one of the best in Negril. But we really came here for the staff and other guest.  Staff makes you feel at home.  From the General Manager, to concierges, bar and food staff weee excellent. Most of the other guest are there for the same reasons we love this place and everyone just mixes in well together. Will never stay any where else (unless we have to bring the kids next time)!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Best couples trip ever!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We went June 3rd-10th 2023. Started out rough because flight was horrible. Allegiant is the worse. But from the time we arrived to the min we stepped back on the bus to leave , our every need was met. There was 12 of us . So yes this resort is laid back not a party resort ,so we made our own party. Shinnel was our Concierge and she made are stay awesome. Along with all the other waitresses ,waiters and bartenders. Odine was probably our favorite. If you have something you need and they don't have it they can get it for you. Buffet was great. And we liked both lotus leaf and chefs showcase. The beach is short walk away and beach bar food was awesome. The staff is the reason for a 5 star. They made our trip one of the best.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The staff is what made me go to 5 stars. Accommodations are lovely the treehouses are comfy. When our air stopped working properly they were so fast to fix it. The beach is great and the water is beautiful. This resort has a quiet vibe which is super chill and if that is what you are looking for is perfect.  Food was good and the beach service was really nice. They have a beach bar and food where they will serve you right at your cabana. The bathrooms at the beach are also super nice.  The staff is friendly, attentive, funny and just overall the best I have encountered at an all inclusive. The martini bar is spot on and they will make you a really amazing martini of any variety.  The pool and pool bar is open until 1:00am if you feel like a late night swim but the beach closes at 7:00pm. You do have to cross a road for the beach but they have  a crossing guard and the beach is nice. You can see other resorts on the beach and they are so much more crowded- I felt like we had our own private beach. 
Go here is you are looking for relaxing chill vibe with a beautiful quiet beach.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: If you want to chill hard this is your place

owner_response.title: Owner response

Thank you so much for this great review.  Wecould not agree with you more...Our Staff are incredible!  We look forward to welcoming you home again soon.

Sincerely,

Randymon
owner_response.author: Randy Russell

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Overall a very relaxing unplugged trip. Supports the use of less devices and more submerged in nature. Your subconscious gets a break from constant screens to always hearing birds or crickets as your background. Each room is a tree house with its own bedroom, balcony and bathroom. The downside is the AC unit isn't as strong so during the hottest parts of day it's still a bit warm in the room prob between 1pm-4pm. Most ppl don't use their room at that time but if you do, it's something to note. It would have been fine for us except I am pregnant and always extremely hot so needed full blast AC. We made it work by utilizing the gym during that time which had the best coolest AC on the hotel and then heading to the beach which we learned had the best breeze.
The bed matress was actually pretty good and gave support for a good night's rest.

My recommendation is to skip the pool and bar by the pool and head to the beach. The beach has the better lunch menu, it's own bar and service right to your beach chair all included with your stay.
Pros
Beach was top notch. Clean white sand, calm and clear waters. The umbrellas/shade and chairs are included and you dont have to pay extra. You can also retrieve your new towels from the beach bar too. Lunch is open to 5pm which is very convenient. Downside. If you come from Caribbean decent you will be largely disappointed with the north American burgers, fries, wraps menu for lunch daily. The best thing is the jerk nachos and authentic fish sandwich which I really enjoyed. Breakfast is a mix of local and North American foods which was my fav daily. Dinner was mixed. Sometimes you may get a few jamacian local items and sometimes you may not. If you are looking for carribean food daily this isn't the place. They do jamacian dinners twice a week otherwsie it's mixed. 
Pleasant surprises
You won't find much plastic which I liked. The water bottles you can't get away from and they are provided in your room. Otherwise the straws and mixing sticks for drinks are non plastic sustainable options which I truly appreciated. Everywhere is kept clean on the grounds including the private beach which is kept pristine. Plenty towels are provided. There are only 85 rooms so they personalize guest service and if you need anything, you can ask and they do their best to provide to you without a cost. I broke out in heat rash and they willingly found me fresh aloe to calm my skin. All the workers are friendly and don't ask or pressure you for tips.
Overall final pros
You def leave more relaxed than you would expect
Top tier beach
Top tier service
Gorgeous Flora and fauna on the entire property which is itself an experience
Everything is close to walk to

Overall cons
Don't go here if you are pregnant and need to be in AC a lot or if you are a foodie looking for more Caribbean food than mixed options
Because the beach is a 2 min walk from the property it's not within the same land which means the property is not breezey which is something I overlooked. Normally having a hotel on the beach means lots of breeze when you are sitting out longing at night or in the day having a drink in an outdoor bar
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great personalized service and picturesque flora/fauna

tripAdvisorReviews.text: All the other reviews here are quite sufficient for you to make up your mind about the resort. This review is for the spa, and for Tearda especially! I had the Jamaican Experience massage with her, and she is fantastic - one of the best massages I've had. Book with her if you can!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Get a massage with Tearda

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My wife and I booked a week at Bahia Principe Grand as part of a package on Expedia, so we had no advance knowledge of the place. All we knew is that the photos looked great ... understanding that sometimes photos on a website don't always paint an accurate picture.

In this case, though, they did. We had high expectations for our week in Jamaica and because of the resort an staff at Bahia Principe Grand, our vacation still managed to exceed those expectations.

The all-inclusive resort is huge, but we never felt crowded. There are courtesy golf carts to take guests from the main lobby to the beach, restaurant and beach areas. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, the pool is huge and crystal clear, with swim up bars at either end and in addition to two buffet restaurants, there are also several specialty restaurants that require reservations.

But what sets the place apart is the service. It starts the minute you step into the lobby for check in when you're greeted with a complementary glass of rum punch. Everyone that works there, from the desk folks to the bellmen, waiters, waitresses, lifeguards and the bartenders who are very generous in their pours went out of their way to make sure we were happy and having a good time.

As for the food, the buffet in the main building and at the beach were decent with a wide variety of offerings. Breakfast was especially good, thanks to Kenroy, the guy who made our fresh omelets and made me smile with his great attitude every morning! But the real stars of the show were the specialty restaurants. We had steak dinner at the The Knife and Italian at Vida Dolce and both were excellent!

In addition to the pool and the beach, there was live music on the patio every night -- including a Bob Marley tribute and a steel drum band performance. And my wife got a massage at the full service spa for an extra fee ($99 for a 50-minute session).

The resort also offers a variety of excursions, including the outstanding day trip we booked to Nagril.  

All-in-all it was a relaxing, memorable, fun week at a more than reasonable price! It was so good that we plan on going back again next year!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: An unforgettable week in paradise

tripAdvisorReviews.text: It was HORRIBLE.  Very outdated. No Air Conditioning in lobby or throughout the hallway. Some elevators weren't working.  My son saw a roach in his room.  Couldn't attend any activities because to HOT, no AC. Have to call everyday for towels & wash cloths. Grand should be call the Ghetto. I will never or recommend anyone to visit there.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Worst Resort I been to

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Booked from June 15-22, 2023

Pros:
-very beautiful resort, very clean rooms and well maintained grounds. Water pressure is great in the shower.
-food is really good, lots of choices. Jamaican and Western dishes available. We loved the jerk chicken, made to order pasta and grilled fish and shrimps.
-beach is clean, water is clear and very calm on the grand side.  Up to the roped area is probably 6 feet. Lots of beach chairs and shade.
-hallways were not carpeted on villas on the left side facing the hotel, villas 14, 15 & 16. Villas 17 &18 were  closed and being renovated
- beach restaurant is very near for lunch if you are at the beach and doesn’t want to go all the way to the Orquidea buffet for lunch
-pool is huge! We didn’t use it though because we preferred the beach.
-beautiful kids waterpark
-drinks in the room were replenished everyday- water, beer, coke and juice

Cons:
-lots of unfriendly staff. Guests seem to be invisible in this resort. Just a handful of staff will greet you.
-don’t count on promises/words of staff at reception or guest services. We were told  3X we were getting champagne and chocolates for our anniversary but nothing came. When we followed up the second time, we were told it might be because we had the “ do not disturb” sign. After making sure that sign wasn’t placed on the door again and after 3rd follow up with the staff saying “it will be delivered before the night ends” still nothing. So don’t keep your hopes up. Very disappointed because we chose to celebrate our 35th anniversary here, spending more than what we usually do as a special celebration and there was no special treatment at all. 
-first room we were assigned was at villa 12. When we went in the ceiling was leaking and there was a pool of water on the floor. The hallway carpets seemed really old.
-the pasta station was very popular, always a long line up. There was just one person doing everything in that station- cooking, washing the pots, refilling the ingredients. Attention Bahia management, please look into that!
-sewage smell coming from drain in the shower. We kept it covered with a plastic bag filled with water when not in use. We were happy with our room and didn’t want to risk being moved to a worse room.
-people were smoking weed in the beach area. 
-lots of flies, even landing on food. They have  big fans to try to keep them away.

This morning in front of the buffet, staff were urging guests to share their “happiness” and give reviews online. When I said I will share my review but there were some things that I wasn’t happy about, she replied “It’s all right, we can’t make everyone happy.” That’s exactly the attitude you will get from the staff in this resort. In my experiences in the Dominican Republic, Mexico and most specially in Cuba with all the shortages happening right now, I don’t feel as welcome here in Jamaica.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Beautiful resort with a lot of very unfriendly staff who doesn’t seem to care about the guests!

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Franklyn D. Resort & Spa
tripAdvisorDetails.description: All-inclusive, All- Suite Beachfront Family Resort with a dedicated Vacation Nanny assigned to every family to care for the kids from check-in to check-out. All- Inclusive package includes spacious accommodations in large 1, 2, 3 & 4 bedroom suites with separate living areas,kitchenette and balcony or terrace. Continental, Italian/French/ Indian and Jamaican cuisine from a choice of 4 restaurants along with a Sushi Bar (seasonal) & Creperie;Premium Bar, Glass Bottom Boat Rides,kayaking, snorkeling, paddle boards, tennis, 4 pools including- 100' waterslide, separate kids, tweens and teens programs with supervised daily activities.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
FDR gave my family and I the vacation we thought we could only dream of! Do you want to take your kid on vacation with you, but also want to relax? Yes, I said relax and kids in the same sentence. Haha 
This is the place! Everything/everyone was wonderful! 

The Nanny service is amazing. We got a second one since we have two young children and and it was perfect. They were kind and caring with our girls. It felt very personal and I wasn’t just dropping off my kids at a daycare. They did what my kids wanted to do all day long. By the end of our trip (which we extended) our girls didn’t want to leave. We felt like family while we were there. 

The rest of the staff is also amazing. The lifeguards are always alert and they get in the water and play with your kids! The servers, bartenders, chefs, and entertainment coordinators are wonderful too. 

The food was delicious! We didn’t know what to expect at a kid friendly resort, but we were blown away. Fresh fish, local cuisine, but also French and Italian food. 

Our accommodations were very large,  comfortable, and cool (AC was exceptional). 

I enjoyed a scrub and a massage while I was there- also amazing! 
We can’t wait to come back!!!!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: The perfect RELAXING family vacation spot!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We just returned home from another fabulous vacation at FDR. I think this was our 10th visit to the resort and we are already planning another trip next year. The reason we return year after year is because it is a true vacation for the entire family. There is an activity for everyone or nothing at all, depending on your preference. Our first trip was when my children were 8 months and 3 years old. We had two lovely nannies, one to stay with the baby while he took naps and the other to chase our 3-year-old around while she swam, played in the sand, and did arts and crafts. I was able to enjoy a pool side chair in the shade with a book; for a full-time mom this was true luxury. Now our children are 11 and 14 and our nanny this year was Patricia, she was perfect. Our 11-year-old is very active, Patricia made sure he participated in every beach football (soccer) game and cricket match.  Our 14-year-old is more independent and prefers to spend her vacation in the water, Patricia was always waiting with a towel when we finally dragged her to dry land.  
A few things of note that I love about FDR. The suites are spacious and comfortable. 
The resort has an overall laid-back attitude and feel, it doesn’t matter what you wear just that you are enjoying yourself. No dress code or reservations at the restaurants. 
The resort is private and safe. As my children have gotten older and more independent, I feel completely comfortable with them navigating the property on their own. The way the resort is set up there is no public access so no one can wander in or out without passing staff/security.
The absolute best attribute of FDR is their staff, they are so friendly and welcoming. Chrisse and Lorna-Gay at the bar make the best drinks and smoothies. Shanille on the lifeguard/boat staff is always up for a snorkel or fishing trip on the boat. We have been to other resorts that “allow” children, but everyone at FDR ADORES children and will go above and beyond at every opportunity.    
If you are traveling to Jamaica with children FDR is the BEST!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: The Best Family Vacation Resort

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My husband, my son (8 years old) and I spent 11 nights at FDR (feb 28 to march 11th). FDR is not a 5 star hotel... is paradise. we've been to many hotels, 5 star and up. Let me tell you there's NOTHING like FDR. You wanna know why? Well there you go: You don't have to book the  restaurant to eat supper like in many other hotels. You don't need transportation to go to the beach, pool or anywhere. Everything is walking distance from the room.  The room is comfortable. You have a nanny (Cinthia we miss you!) for the day at NO EXTRA COST. They have a kid's club with many activities for the whole day. The food is absolutely delicious. Everywhere you step is clean. The employees are respectful, always smiling and ready to help you. FDR...we'll be back! And this time we are bringing friends with us. Thank you everybody for making our stay THE BEST EVER!
Fanny
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Real relaxing vacation in PARADISE!

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Thank you for providing such amazing feedback on your recent stay with us.  We are delighted to read that you had a relaxing vacation in Paradise and that your stay was the Best Ever!

We appreciate your kind comments about our amenities and the food. 

We certainly look forward to hosting your family again soon and to welcoming your friends.
owner_response.author: Trishawana Davidson

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My husband, almost three year old daughter and I stayed at the FDR for a week in February and absolutely loved it. If you have young children and are looking for a place where you can actually feel like you’re on vacation, this is it. 

Renee, our nanny for the week, was wonderful. Our daughter had a blast swimming, tie-dying a t-shirt, hanging out at the beach and playing games with the other kids. Knowing she was in safe hands meant my husband and I could have a few hours to ourselves each day - a dream vacation for a working parents! 

The resort isn’t fancy, but the location is beautiful, the food is tasty and the staff is so kind and fun. Everyone knew my daughter’s name and greeted her like a little celebrity. 

We’re already planning our trip next year and I wish we could return sooner!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Can I move in?

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for taking the time to share your recent experience at our resort.

We are happy to read that you absolutely loved your stay with us. Thank you for sharing your kind comment about your nanny Renee, we are happy that she was able to assist in providing a “dream vacation for parents”.

We look forward to hosting your family again soon.
owner_response.author: Trishawana Davidson

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We traveled as a family (2 adults, 2 kids -- 4 & 6 years old). This resort was perfect. The junior 2 bedroom had lots of space with 2 bathrooms, a kitchenette and 2 patios.  The staff were so friendly especially the nannies, restaurant and bar staff.  Our oldest enjoyed the nightly entertainment and performing in the shows.  It wasn't crowded when we were there but still many families and several other children that our girls enjoyed playing with.  The food was great and they were able to accommodate our very picky 4 year old by preparing toast 3 times a day!

If you go to this resort wanting a casual friendly family atmosphere you will not be disappointed.  I look forward to returning soon!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great family vacation

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Thank you for reviewing your stay at FDR.

We are elated that you had a great family vacation. Thanks for recognizing our dedicated Nannies as well as the restaurant and bar staff.

We cannot wait to greet you with another warm welcome in the near future.
owner_response.author: Trishawana Davidson

destinations.name: Jewel Paradise Cove Resort & Spa, Runaway Bay

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Jewel Paradise Cove Beach Resort & Spa
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Discover the Jewel Paradise Cove Beach Resort & Spa, a secluded adults-only tropical paradise. Enjoy an array of signature Jewel Resorts amenities and world-class services, including Jamaica’s only oceanfront, two-story spa, the full-service Radiant Spa. Jewel Paradise Cove promises relaxation and rejuvenation with 225 rooms and butler-serviced junior suites in a colonial contemporary, yet casual island style. Enjoy resort-wide Wi-Fi, seven dining experiences, a variety of bars including swim-up bars and a smoothie station on West Beach, two private beaches, pools with pool concierge service, seasonal spa retreats, a full-service salon and fitness center. Jewel Paradise Cove is also the perfect place for your next meeting, event, reunion or dream wedding.

address_obj.address_string: Jewel Paradise Cove Drive, Runaway Bay Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
My husband and I visited Jamaica for the first time for our 10 year anniversary. ALL of the staff were absolutely wonderful. In fact everywhere we went we felt all of the people from Jamaica were so kind, welcoming, and hospitable. The resort has great food and the drinks are definitely not watered down! Sherene at one of the pool bars was our favorite bartender. Merric makes the best omelettes ever in the breakfast buffet. The lady who works in the coffee hut also makes great drinks and was very kind. 

Favorites:
-The Platinum restaurant for the amazing view, great service, and good food
-Oceanview room! Definitely upgrade, it’s so worth the view 
-Cabana rental on the beach with stellar butler service
-Free water sports! Kayaking, paddle boarding, and catamaran rides
-Booze Cruise booked directly from the resort with snorkeling! 
-Entertainment Team! The best! Thanks for teaching me how to play cricket and calling me out multiple times when I revert to the rules of baseball LOL so fun! Also loved yoga, water aerobics, and trivia!
-Reading my book in the hammock by the ocean at sunset 
-The pizza!!! Omg I’m already craving it. Definitely order the Hawaiian pizza (not sure the actual name but it has chicken, pineapple, and some kind of magical mango sauce on the most delicious crust) ever)
-My massage with Tanya in the spa 
-Book the Blue Hole excursion with River tubing. Unforgettable! 
-The water slide! It’s so fun, I mean who doesn’t love a water slide?? 

Cons:

-The beach is small. It’s big enough but you can’t go out far due to the roped off area as it is seaweed covered after the rope. You also can’t walk the beaches because it is completely closed off (although this does enhance safety I suppose) The beach I believe is man made so the sand is not what you will get if you go to Negril or Montego Bay Area. 

-Night time shows were ok but I was hoping for more of a Jamaican vibe. Things were advertised such as “Jamaican Street Party” which turned out to be just music playing and people sitting and drinking. More variety would be great.
*** I will say we were so exhausted by 9pm that we didn’t always want to venture out anyways but I do think this is one area that could improve. I will also add however that we didn’t make it up to the night club so I can’t fully speak to the night time vibes. 

Last thing - I was disappointed when the water aerobics was replaced with a U.S Zumba teacher the last couple of days we were there. I was not a fan and much prefer the entertainment team who did a great job with water aerobics. 

We had a fantastic vacation!! We would absolutely stay here again!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: 1st timers to Jamaica and JPC set the bar high! I don’t think we could stay anywhere else as we would be disappointed!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This was our 3rd time at Jewel and again, our experience was top notch. Searh my profile for my reviews from our first 2 trips. 

From our spesific room request to the morning we checked out, we felt at home. We saw many familiar faces, staff who welcomed us home and we met some new faces/new friends. Like mentioned in my previous reviews, the staff at Jewel are the best and everyone goes above and beyond to make your vacation a memerable one. The service here is truly service from the heart.

Airport transfer and excursions......reach out to Tomeik at Reggae Island Tours on FB and tell him Lee-Ann and Sam sent you!! I've known him for years and he's a great guy, dependable, accomodating and safe! 

The Drinks!!! OK, I'll be honest. I go to drink/party/let loose. Everyone who pours here, pours great drinks! The Sunken Treasure Bar is my favorite and has the best bartenders. Drinks are NOT watered down and the cocktails are yummy, while I mostly stick to my favorite. You must try some rum cream. So good!!

Like our first 2 visits, the food was great. I never had any trouble finding something yummy to eat and never went hungry. Chef Fredrick is THE MAN!!  And like everyone else, we can't say enough about Merric at the omlette station. Hubby brought his own scotch bonnets and Merric happily added them to his breakfast! 

The pools are are all great but the main pool is my favorite. Jonoy...who not only kept the pool immaculate , is also a wonderful guy. He brought us to visit where our son's ashes are, at our former favorite resort, Jewel Runaway Bay. This meant the world to us!! Star employee, for sure!!  

Our room was the one I requested...thank you Camille....and it was always clean and a/c was perfect. I find the bed extremely comfortable and woke up with zero backpain, like I do at home. 

The beaches here are man-made but I have zero complaints there. The water is warm and calm and I love the marine life...esp. at the small snorkel beach. 

The entertainment was fantatic, esp. The Silver Birds Steel Drum Band. Like on previous visits, it's one of my favorite nights, getting to see them perform.

Take advantage of the activities here. The glass bottom boat ride is included. Ariel, who took us out,  is one of the new faces to us and a great addition to Jewel. There is also hobie cat rides, paddle boarding, kyaking, trivia, tennis, beer pong as well as other games, nature walks...and much more. 

 A highlight for us is the grounds. We absolutely love walking around the resort, enjoying all the plants, flowers, and fruit trees. Shout out to Donovan and his team! 

Another highlight for us is the sunset bar. Every evening before dinner, we enjoy our drinks up there, watching the sunset. Jewel sunsets are the best sunsets!! 

One thing that was added since our previous trip was the Silent Heeadphone Party. I'd love it if Jewel coud do that 2x a week, as it was SO. MUCH. FUN. I love to dance on vacation and I found the silent headphone party was more happening than Bling, which can be hit ot miss. That said....Bling is great on Retro Night, when old school is played! 

Speaking of music....this would be my one complaint. My prefect afternoon is hanging out in the main pool, hearing some of my favorite dancehall songs. I did request them played, even provided a list, lol. But I did not get to hear much of my classic dancehall songs. So when we return, I'll be bringing my bluetooth. Reggae is Jamaica's gift to the world but there is more to Reggae than Bob Marley. Just sayin'. 

Wifi has definitly improved since our last visit which is appreciated! 

Security at Jewel is fantastic, for those who have that concern. You'll be safe here! Jamaica as a whole is a great and beautiful country and I know that with the current reavel advisories, people are scared but need not be!! The advisories are to do with very spesific areas, where you wouldn't be anywhere near. I have been to Jamaica 8 times and have NEVER felt unsafe. 

I'll close with once again mentioning the staff. Miss. Barbara ( GM ) and all the people who work at Jewel are the best in the business!! I've said it before, I'll say it again....you are treated like family at Jewel and we can not wait to return....hopefully in December!!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Third Time's A Charm

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This resort was nice.  The food was great and the drinks were always cold!  TJ was our pool bartender,  go see him!  For the love of all things,  bring tip money people!!!!!!!!!!!  It’s amazing how far $2 will go for you and the service staff and your resort experience!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Jamaica Trip

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We are back from our 6th vacation at Jewel Paradise Cove and it won't be our last!
Food was amazing as usual. We had breakfast at the buffet every day, something for everyone here from healthy choices like fresh fruit and different porridges to crispy bacon and omelets made fresh for you by Merrick. For lunch there are so many choices, we had something different each day.  No reservations needed for dinner except at the Japanese but we never had to wait too long for a table and the food was always great no matter where we ended up.
The resort's pools are so lovely and clean. We spend all of our days going from pool to pool, the all have unique features and great swim up bars. Shout out to Janice,  Tamique and TJ for keeping us hydrated!
The evening entertainment is great but for us, we enjoy a drink in the Sunset bar before we head up to the Piano bar at 9:00. Marlon runs the Piano bar and he is the star of the resort! One night he had 71 people in that little bar and he did not miss a beat. No one was kept waiting for there drinks and at the same time he is telling jokes, doing magic tricks and singing.  We look forward to seeing him every year. 
This year our son and his girlfriend joined us on our trip and our son proposed while we were there! All of the staff were thrilled for us and helped us celebrate wherever we went.
We are already planning our next trip to this fabulous resort!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: 6th Visit!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I had a good experience at Jewels paradise cove. The weather was good. I really enjoyed the food,  it was great. The staff were nice and friendly. The drinks ... very good. Janice at the emerald bar...nuff love you were excellent .
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A jewel

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Jewel Runaway Bay Beach Resort & Waterpark
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Surrounded by acres of lush landscaping, pristine beaches and crystal-clear waters the all-inclusive “all-ages” Jewel Runaway Bay Beach Resort & Waterpark offers exceptional entertainment, including Jewel Lagoon Waterpark and amenities geared toward adults and children alike. Whether taking your adventures under water or staying on the shore, you’ll find endless ways to make your getaway a truly memorable experience.

address_obj.address_string: 58 Main Street North Coast Hwy, Runaway Bay Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text: You will bond with the staff and the food is delicious. Egg boy was the best; knew about the places we lived and made breakfast fun and enjoyable. The shows were fun too and the water park was a blast.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: really loved staying.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We stayed at the Jewel from December 23-30 2019, and found ourselves asking “Really?”

After doing extensive research, my wife had determined that based on reading many articles and reviews, the Jewel was going to be a sparkling gem, when in fact we felt as though it was a diamond in the rough.

I have a few pros and cons that I will list, and hopefully it helps any would be readers

Pros-

1. The Beach.

The beach was incredible, the sand was very fine, and spacious enough that you never felt crowded. The ocean was shallow well past the roped off swimming area. The water was crystal clear and full of many different kinds of fish that swim around the large rocks at the edge of the swimming area. Tip- Bring bread into the water to feed the fish, they will surround you and come right to the surface!

2. The Staff.

While most of the staff were friendly enough, there were a handful of staff that went above and beyond. The housekeeper Shandae was a lovely sweet girl who did beautiful towel art. The Lifeguards Cleon (Infinity pool), Iron Man (Main pool), and Ralph (Infinity pool) were awesome, we spent lots of time talking and getting to know the guys that were there keeping us safe!
Finally, Michael the Bartender... please make an effort to seek him out and say hi, he is such a nice young man. He spent countless hours at the swim up bar talking to our 3 kids, playing catch from behind the bar, and serving us endless exceptional drinks! He truly made our vacation! BIG UP MICHAEL!!

3. The food.

The food overall was decent.

The Moonstone grill was very good, serving Burgers, Wings, Wraps, and a variety of different grilled sausage.

The Coral Cafe buffet was fairly repetitive, albeit tasty. There was an International section, Jamaican section, fresh fruits and smoothies, breads/bagels/English muffins/croissants,cold meats and cheeses, eggs to order (Make sure to chat with egg boy, he is very knowledgeable), omelet bar, pasta bar, stir fry bar, salad bar,and desert/coffee/mimosa station

There are 5 a la carte restaurants,

Jade Samurai Teppanyaki/ Golden Sabre Sushi-

I can only speak to the Jade Samurai, as it was the only one we ate at.

It’s the only restaurant that requires reservations, make sure to book them early as it books up very quickly, that being said the food and service are excellent!

Moonstone (Italian)
Platinum (Caribbean)
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Christmas at the Jewel

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I know its been a while since we went there Jan 2020 but i was looking at reviews on other places and was like i should review Jewel.
The bus drive was lengthy but you cant fault the resort in that way.
The resort was spacious and had plenty to offer with play rooms and food options.  The one night the buffet was done in the court yard which was different but interesting.  I did enjoy the hibachi restaurant which i ended up doing twice but i had never gone before so it could skew my experience.  Again you are in the caribean and these experiences you shouldnt compare to the ones you would usually get back home if you want some grand experience go to Vegas or something.
The pools were nice, the larger deeper pool felt colder than the one overlooking the beach.  The waterpark looked fun but didnt enjoy as much since my daughter was still quite young and weary of things.  
The staff seemed quite friendly all around and i couldnt say they were rude ever  (remember if your rude or have some expections of acting superior youll get a ruder response treat everyone with respect and dont look for a fight just cuz)
I enjoyed this trip alot and for a first time in Jamaica I was a great experience.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: First time to jamaica was enjoyable

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Was not impressed with the phone not working in are rooms. In case of an emergency,  i guess i had to just scream.
Room keys had to be reset every day. Small resort so not to far to walk to the lobby but very frustrating. 
Food options for gluten free were the pits!
It is 2022 you need more options for people with food allergies. 
Every restaurant and bar was always out of stock of an item that was on the menu.
Piss poor inventory on all the restaurants and bars.
The pizza is delicious! Will recommend the pizza.

Entertainment was fair but i have seen a lot better.
The live band on Saturday night was good the rest of the nights would only get a 4/10.

The resort is small in size so that is a plus if you want some quiet relaxing time. 
I will give the resort a 9/10 for the tranquility, the grounds were gorgeous. 
The resort is not loud, so we appreciated that too.

Will i come back? Most likely not. Will pay a little more for better food options and drink options and better entertainment.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: You get what you pay for!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I traveled to Jamaica with my best friend. We stayed at the Jewel for 14 nights from 22nd Dec 21 - 5th Jan 22. 
So lets start with the highlights of our stay.  The staff at this hotel are lovely. They are kind and very helpful. The room was spacious and cleaned daily. Fresh towels were provided on a daily basis. There are choices of restaurants to dine at during your stay and there is a great little place on the beach that does jerk pork at chicken at lunch time. There is also a Grill bar which offers cheeseburgers, fries, wraps, salads and nachos. This is open till 2am in the morning. On the beech you are provided with Kayaks, body boards, pedalos and  free glass bottom boat trips and other trips. These are all included with your all inclusive package. There are great shows at night, but due to Covid19 the nightclub was closed. There is a great spot on the beach where you can get smoothies made with fresh fruit. These were very tasty. The bar offers all of your expected brands of spirits and a great choice of cocktails.  The hotel has lots of hand sanitizers and they are doing a great job at keeping their guests safe. The gym is located down by the beach and is open 24/7. There are tennis courts which are also open 24/7. There is a little gift shop onsite and you can play pool or ping pong. There is also a water slide and lots of little hidden jacuzzies dotted about the complex. There is a lovely coffee shop on site which offers lots of varieties of coffees and they are all wonderful quality and again part of your all inclusive package.

Downsides: The beach is man made and the sand is not white like most beaches I have been to in the Caribbean.  The sea is cornered off so the water only comes up to your chest. Not great if you like to swim. The breakfast buffet was disgusting and needs attention. We had to live on eggs on toast as the bacon was cold and burned and all other foods on offer  were of a poor quality. The staff at breakfast are attentive when you first arrive, but this only lasts if you continuously tip. I have a rule that I only tip on the 2nd week, this gives me time to establish the quality of the persons service before making tips. I think if they can sort out the breakfast then this hotel is pretty much perfect. The grounds are maintained beautifully and the staff are lovely. I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel and would recommend it to friends.  The Asian restaurant, Jamaican restaurant, Italian restaurant are all worth a visit. There are lots of choices of foods throughout the day and plenty of spaces to book into them. There are always lots of sun beds available and two main pools which always have space to sit by. They both have swim up pool bars and the staff are great. This hotel will not let you down. Don't take any notice of the moaning minis that write poor reviews about this hotel because they are wrong. My only piece of advice for the hotel would be to offer a full English breakfast option and ensure this is kept hot. But that's simply a personal preference and you as a guest may enjoy the foods on offer at breakfast time. So if you have booked your stay here, get on that plane and enjoy it. I had two weeks of pure relaxation and bliss.  Thank you for reading this review and if you have any questions simply ask.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: An amazing stay at this hotel

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Royal Decameron Club Caribbean
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Located in Runaway Bay about an hour from Montego Bay International Airport, the Royal Decameron Club Caribbean is located in one of the most beautiful and picturesque place of the island, populated by friendly and happy people. This hotel's architecture offers incredible paths through the gardens and terraces until you reach the 2 swimming pools, one exclusively for adults and another with all the facilities for children. This hotel also has a long dock for sunbathing. The cottage-style rooms bring a tropical environment and let you enjoy the peace of the beach where you can partake in a large variety of water sports. Its restaurants offer many different types of cuisine which range from typical Jamaican flavors to the exquisite tastes of Asian food. Due to Coronavirus (COVID-19), this property is taking steps to help protect the safety of guests and staff. Certain services and amenities may be reduced or unavailable as a result.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Very friendly driver would recommend booking him for any trips that you are doing whilst staying at this hotel ,the hotel grounds are beautiful thevmaid service are very friendly and they do almost anything for you and the bar staff are also very friendly

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The place is so bad it laughable for the first four days got no towels in the room had to keep going to reception and asking for them the bathroom is disgusting had to have it deep cleaned ( see picture this is after the clean) The hotel ran out of drinks sprits beer and soft drinks  so called always available ice cream only arrives twice in 14 day’s restaurant kept running out of food  food was never replenished day were you had to Waite for plates and knives and forks for 15 to 20 minutes as they had run out staff badly trained half don’t know what there doing and the other half don’t care The disco is a joke the place stinks of dope and is only used by the staff

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The place was just okay. It is 3-stars for a reason. The room was pretty clean except for the lamp shades…disgusting. We had to ask for towels everyday for the room and there were a couple of times throughout the week that we had to wait for beach towels. The food was just okay. We found things to eat at each meal. We stayed in one of the courtyard rooms. It was very loud at night from a bar that is in front of the resort. By midweek it either quieted down or we got used to it. The bathroom window looked out onto to stairs. I was told that no one used those stairs. I wouldn’t stay there again.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: It’s was okay…

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of your recent stay at Decameron Club Caribbean! We sincerely apologize for the lapse in service you experienced during your stay. Your feedback is greatly appreciated as we endeavour to continuously improve the service offered to our guests. The issues mentioned are being addressed and we do hope that you will return to our beautiful resort for an enhanced experience!
owner_response.author: SOPHINE MILLER

destinations.name: All Other Resorts, Villas, AirBnB & Homes

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Sandals South Coast
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Discover the undiscovered. Journey to a forgotten Jamaica where the natural beauty is simply unforgettable. Within a 500-acre wilderness preserve, blue mountains, lush palm groves, pristine coastlines and shimmering turquoise waters create an unbelievable backdrop for a monumental resort. Sandals Whitehouse Europe Village & Spa perfectly blends the exotic allure of the Caribbean with the refined elegance of Europe. Charming Italian piazzas and fountains are surrounded by gardens resplendent with fragrant foliage, while three European-inspired villages – Italian, French and Dutch – are home to luxuriously-appointed, all oceanfront rooms and suites. Each one offers magnificent views overlooking the two-mile long beach, and top tier suites come with Sandals’ legendary Butler Service. Seven restaurants serve mouthwatering gourmet cuisine from around the world, and entertainment ranges from a sophisticated piano bar to bonfire beach parties and a chic nightclub. This resort is truly a world unto itself, where time is all but forgotten and the only moment is now. World Travel Awards: Sandals Resorts “World’s Leading All – Inclusive Company,” 16 years in a row. Sandals Resorts “Caribbean’s Leading Hotel Brand,” 18 years in a row. Sandals Whitehouse “Jamaica’s Leading Spa Resort” Five Star Diamond Award, American Academy of Hospitality Sciences. We’re so very pleased to announce that Sandals Whitehouse European Villages & Spa has been named in Condé Nast Traveler’s Voted 2012 Readers' Choice Awards “Top 15 Hotels & Resorts in the Caribbean,” coming in at No. 10 and “Top 30 Resorts in the Caribbean,” coming in at No. 4 as part of the annual “Best in the World” poll. Presented Certificate of Excellence for 2012 and Travelers' Choice Hotel for 2012.

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Sandals South Coast is Jamaica's only all-beachfront resort.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: First I must commend all the staff who were very friendly and courteous throughout my stay. However, I was underwhelmed with the amenities and overall offerings leaving me to feel I didn't receive value for money spent. Rooms were just okay, buffet limited and reservations required for restaurants some of which were closed.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Overrated

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We had an amazing trip to Sandals South Coast. They were renovating one section of the resort, but they were very considerate regarding the construction noise which is unavoidable if you want to visit updated resorts. The resort is so large and spread out that it wasn’t noticeable at all  unless you were sitting right in front of that section. We stayed in the South Seas Swim-Up Rondoval with Private Pool and it was a phenomenal room. Of course it’s warm in Jamaica, and I like my air conditioning set to meat locker status (meaning I like it very cold)  which wasn’t possible in that room. The ceiling fan made a significant difference in the bedroom area, but it was a little too warm in the vanity area when trying to get ready for dinner in the late afternoon. We requested a floor fan to move some of the air to that area, and it made a HUGE difference. The 2 miles of private beach is absolutely beautiful, but there is some sea grass; so I spent more time looking at the ocean but didn’t like to get in the water much. 
The Rondovals are very private, intimate, and a quiet setting. We LOVED the room. The only recommendations I could make to Sandals would be …
1) allow the air conditioning to get colder overall in the room, 
2) put an air vent in the water closet (it was pretty warm in there with no air circulation)
3) put some type of fan to move air around to the vanity area.
We loved being able to just step right out of our bedroom and into the pool. We would’ve loved to open the doors to the pool more, but couldn’t because the air conditioning couldn’t have handled cooling the room back off if we did. 

I’m not one that usually writes a review, but the main reason I wanted to leave this review is because of the absolutely phenomenal level of service we received the entire length of our stay. Our butlers, Kevin & Tevar, were complete rock stars!!! I cannot say enough about what a phenomenal job they both did. Everything from surprise decorations, to having a bubble bath with petals ready after a long day, to picking us up for dinner daily, to retrieving something from the room we forgot to bring to the beach with us, to bringing us food multiple times a day, to changing our dinner plans at the drop of a hat, to special snacks in our room, and the list goes on and on. They were top notch, and I can’t stress enough how much more special I felt because of their actions! It truly was like they were mind readers because when I would call to possibly request something, they would already be on their way with whatever I was just calling to ask about or it would already be in our room waiting for us before I could even think to call. I want to go back ASAP and stay in the Rondovals so we can have them again. I cannot think of one thing either of them could’ve done any better than what they did. 
The other resort staff were amazing as well. Next time I will try to do a better job of jotting down names so I can specifically mention them, but everyone from the lovely lady who would make sure our drinks were topped off while in our beach chair, to the wonderful woman in the gift shop who was about to hunt me down before our bus departed, to the entertainment staff, and all of the servers were so friendly and helpful. I just don’t know that you can get any better service than what you get at Sandals South Coast!
The nightly entertainment was great, with the silent disco parties being our absolute favorite.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Sexy Sandals South Coast was top notch!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
What a beautiful resort with beautiful staff members. Food was truly amazing!!! Our favs were Sushi on the Sand and Neptunes.  And don't forget about the gelato place!!! 
Our fabulous Maxine was the best with keeping our group hydrated on the beach!!! She was very attentive, kind and so sweet. She kept telling us to just relax and enjoy and that she was there to ensure that we were all having a great time.  Our other kudos for this Sandals staff was Kemo Sabe! He was one of our activities directors. His amazing energy was just what we needed!!! These 2 staff members had such wonderful & positive vibes and made us smile the entire week we were there! And let's not forget Jay...our bellhop. What a great way to be greeted as he walked us to our room on the top floor. His sense of humor was the best!!! He even checked in on us in middle of the stay and made sure we were all loaded up on our private shuttle back to the airpot. 
 We loved this resort and hope to visit this beautiful place again one day!!!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Beautiful Resort with the most beautiful staff!!!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Great teacher works well with guests on arobics and water sports he has a great personality and very hospitable showed me many things to try and stay fit, easy exercises to remember and do when I get home
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Water a robins with Rajay fitness

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This was our second time to the resort. We absolutely love the environment, the customer service, the all around experience. However, we paid for a swim up room that was renovated less than two years ago, and it did not say luxury. There were numerous water spots on walls/ceilings, patches on walls could be seen everywhere, and in general had a poorly finished appearance. The swim up pool was the same with the appearance showing a real rush job, and the water level wasn’t high enough for the filters to keep dead bugs out, so pool was littered with them. I guess I’m pretty disappointed as I thought what I paid for would show better than it did. However, like I said, and we’ve been to the resorts for three visits, their customer service and the experience they provide is hands down the absolute best around! We wouldn’t continue to book future trips if they weren’t!!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Wonderful Place, but steep price

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Couples Tower Isle
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Playground to Hollywood celebrities in the 1950s, glamorous Couples Tower Isle exudes a chic sophistication perfectly balanced by a relaxed Caribbean sensuality. Perched on the lush terrain of Ocho Rios, Jamaica—the resort seduces with breathtaking sea views, a wide sandy beach and century-old palm trees. Discover the joys of snorkeling among the reefs, windsurfing on the waves, or sailing into the sunset on a catamaran, rum punch in hand. Intricate blue tile work and jade chaise lounges offset the striking white retro architecture. Luxurious rooms boast private ocean-breeze balconies. Whether being pampered in the Zen-inspired spa—recognized as "Best in the Caribbean" by Travel+Leisure—sipping cocktails at the piano bar or indulging in an exquisite meal alfresco, Couples Tower Isle creates countless intimate moments that inspire you to return again and again.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: 10 days at this lovely resort,from the moment we walked in we were treated so thoughtful,the staff are amazing they work so hard and made our stay even better.The hotel is beautiful very 40s which we loved food was so good the 3 different restaurants was a lovely change within the week.Coffee was the best.We had a beautiful view from our room very clean and the bed was so comfy I could star fish every night the only one I had was maybe swap the nightly entertainment about but over all very nice and relaxing first time to Jamaica will differently go back.Thank you CTI
tripAdvisorReviews.title: FOR Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We originally booked our stay, then changed it the next day for a different promotion. We get to the hotel and the first 4 nights our room was hot and humid. They sent 3 different people to fix it. It never got fixed. I had to leave a review online before they would switch rooms or do anything further about it. And going back to the promotion, they said at the end of the trip that we didn’t get the promotion and that we have to pay for the credit that we had on our account. Which I called and confirmed that we were using our 100 dollar credit. We had 97.30 on the room charge and stayed under the 100 dollar limit to maximize the promotion. As we are leaving literally getting on the bus, they tell us that it’s not covered and we had a different promotion. Not to mention that most of the waiters don’t actually have a clue when it comes to food allergies. We finally found two that were AMAZING however it was only two out of a staff of a few hundred
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Book elsewhere

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Daniel D,

Thank you for choosing Couples Tower Isle for your recent visit to Jamaica. We appreciate your kind words about some of our team members who provided you with amazing service but sincerely apologize for any inconvenience because of the unexpected challenge with the air conditioning unit. We are also sorry for the misunderstanding related to the resort credit but happy that this issue was also resolved for you. Your additional feedback related to allergies is being investigated as a matter of high priority as your health is of utmost importance to our entire team. Thank you for sharing your review.

Kind regards, 

Couples Customer Care Team
owner_response.author: Michelle Gordon

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I went into this with high expectations due to having friends previously come here multiple times.  There was some good and not so good.  I had been told about CTI's staff and how wonderful they were.  This was overall not the case.  It seems like there may have been turnover since they had been.  While it's true,  some are great, many seemed bothered by the fact if you needed them for anything.  Staff was on their cell phones quite often.   It was like an act of congress to just get a clean wash cloth in your room, which I find extremely off putting.

Good:
Nice, older hotel
Nice reception
Enjoyed the included excursions
Not having to play the "chair game" at the beach.
Some of the food- Bayside and 8 Rivers
Private Beach (even though small and nothing spectacular)

Not so good:
Food was nowhere near up to par that we had been told of.
Many staff wasn't interested in helping unless you "extra" tipped.
Beach was small and kind of eh.  
Entertainment needs to be revamped.

If you are looking for a nice beach, I highly recommend going elsewhere.

Jamaica Tip:  Get Club Mobay for arrival, especially if you've never been to Jamaica before or are arriving on a busy day.  Departure isn't needed (even though we had it).
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Mixed feelings on this one.

owner_response.title: Owner response

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We just got back from our vacation yesterday. The hotel and the staff were second to none!!!  Every single person  on staff was so helpful and friendly!!.  We really didn,t go to the pool much, we like the ocean more. The beach was always clean and neat, and there were always chairs available.  The food was fantastic, and if you didn,t find something you liked then you were way to pickey. Our room was beautiful, as was the view from it!!. We did Dunn,s Falls which is a must do!!!. Overall this was a fantastic vacation from start to finish!!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Come back to Jamaica!!
