tripAdvisorDetails.name: Couples Sans Souci
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Nestled on the cliffs of Jamaica’s emerald coast above a dazzling stretch of Caribbean, Couples Sans Souci beckons you to surrender mind, body and soul. The resort's 'no worries' mantra comes to life as every day unfolds. Lose yourself exploring secluded stone pathways. Melt away stress in the healing natural mineral springs. Feel a rush of exhilaration scaling Dunn's River waterfalls. Or simply drift asleep in a hammock by the sea. Located in vibrant Ocho Rios, the resort's design pays tribute to an understated colonial elegance—intricate latticework, white woven furnishings and feathered palms set a refined stage for your island escape. Dining options abound—from authentic Jamaican fare to five-star international cuisine. Private cabanas at cliff's edge provide the ideal setting for our signature spa treatments, while the choice of resort activities knows no limits. Learn the art of living well while living in the moment at Couples Sans Souci.

address_obj.address_string: White River, St Mary, Ocho Rios Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Cooled face towels and a glass of champagne to sip on arrival-nice! Check in staff wasn't overly friendly but they weren't rude either, just seemed indifferent to our being there. Our room was clean and spacious with plenty of places to hang clothing and tuck away luggage. Lush greenery prevented a full view of the sea but no issue with that as I feel the plant life added to the beauty of the resort. The hot water in the shower took a few days for me to figure out so it was cold showers for a few. 
The grounds are breathtakingly beautiful. Resort never felt crowded and it felt as though many areas that we ventured to were ours alone. Entertainment on different nights was fantastic though I found the "Gala" night just wasn't our cup of tea. Activities staff is phenomenal, they seem to enjoy their work and make sure everyone who wants to be is included. Bartenders were fun, conversational and quick to pour a drink. Food was good, better at the restaurants you make reservations for. The coffee was delicious! If you've never had someone sing while they made you an omelet you'll get to experience that every morning in the buffet line! Awoken daily as soon as the sun began to rise by a rooster and I had wished he would have moved to another area once in a while ...but at least I was up to see the beautiful sunrise because of it. I'm sensitive to sounds and there was some type of machine beeping loudly for days behind Bella Vista that was bothersome as it was non stop. Another guest brought it to the attention of staff and it stopped for a while but started up again shortly after. This is one thing I do wish had been corrected as it did detract from the calming experience the resort otherwise provided. There was a violinist and a saxophone player who both roamed the grounds playing music at breakfast or dinner time which was lovely. Our housekeeper was wonderful and always made sure we had plenty of towels and turn down service was provided daily. Our mini fridge would get stocked when we put a card out to replenish beverages, and the room service staff was superb. We scheduled a private dinner at the wedding gazebo but there was some confusion on our part as to when we should arrive and so our photographer wasn't able to get really good photos of us before the sun set so that was disappointing. There were also a lot of flying bugs during the dinner landing on our table, us and the food (they do try to keep them away with tons of candles but it just didn't work) and it was too dark to see our food so we kind of hurried through it. It was our first time there and we didn't know what to expect but next time we will make sure to have plenty of time before dark to get photo's done and eat. Our waiter was wonderful though and he made sure music was playing while we ate and our glasses were never empty.
We never felt the need to leave the resort because they offer so much to do while you're there. The water activities are included and so my husband snorkled as I watched from the glass bottom boat, we took a spin on some water bikes and went on a catamaran ride with a helpful staff member. We met so many friendly people there (both staff and guests) and it really felt like a home away from home...with way better scenery. It was a very relaxed kind of fun so if you're looking for a party scene type of place this isn't it-it was perfect for us though. There is another business next to the main beach where loud music plays for a few hours during the day so that kind of takes away from the atmosphere on the resort for a bit but it's not something you can't escape -we just headed to the upper portion of the the resort and meandered through the stone pathways while sipping on coconut water served in a freshly cut coconut. I could go on and on about all of the reasons we overall loved it here and can't wait to go back but I think I've given a pretty good idea of our experience here. There are lots of little surprises around the resort (like the bird who said hello to me as I walked down a path) but I'll let you discover the rest on your own.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Magical

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This was our 17th time to Couples Sans Souci. First since the renovations were completed. We traveled with three other couples. Our entire stay was excellent. Never had an issue with anything.  From the bed, pillows, tv, air conditioner, hot water, water pressure, toilet flushing, liqour supply, no compliantes.

The food was excellent at all the restaurants. Cassanova's renovations were off the chain. The open kitchen design is very welcoming to guest. Breakfast at Palizzini was a great way to start your day. Very relaxing and stress free. The Belle Vista, which is the Asian restaurant at night, was very good.

The entertainment was fantastic as usual.  The new patio, where the old pool was on top, has very nice furniture to sit and watch the nightly showtime.  The Ballon Bar is now air conditioned. A welcomed reno.  

Finally, all the staff were very accomadating and greeted you with a smile. If they ran out of something, they went to get it quickly. Shout out to McQ, Andre, Herde and Nicoy for helping make our stay more enjoyable.

Steve & Victoria
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great Vacation

Some of the bartenders were rude especially  the girl that wore glasses don't remember her name but she was just nasty. Don't think i would stay here again.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Dunn's River Falls and Park
tripAdvisorDetails.description:
The unique terraced Dunn’s River Falls is a refreshing adventure in the Jamaican jungle. Get a tour guide to help you navigate through the pools and to the giant staircase waterfalls—if the going gets too tough, there are points at which you can give up and walk along the adjacent path.

The falls are a popular stop for cruise boats that pass through the area, so if you’re planning on visiting on your own, you’ll want to get there early in the morning for fewer crowds. Afterward, cross the highway and dry off on the golden sand at Dunn’s River Beach. 

– Tripadvisor

ranking_data.ranking_string: #1 of 33 things to do in Ocho Rios

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: We can get you there in time and comfort

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Had a great experience climbing the falls with our tour guide 'bigfoot' and a short dreadlock guy, who was videoing and taking photographs throughout.
At the end of the climb, the short guy asked if we wanted the video and photos for $40. We declined, his attitude soon changed and said we could at least give him a tip! He overshadowed the whole experience. 
Then, you have to walk through the dreaded craft market where you get hounded to buy there products! Worst experience ever..best thing is not to give any eye contact and walk speedily through.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Group of vultures

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Dunn's River Falls and Park is a fantastic waterfall climbing experience. The waterfall is obviously stunning and climbing up it is breathtaking. The guide Gibbs that was with us the whole time was very friendly and helpful. The tour was in a group of about 15 people that all went up the falls together in a group; we were not forced to hold hands which I was pleased about. The tour includes many photo opportunities as well as other fun things to do like jump into some pools in the falls. The site around the actual falls is very touristy and expensive so I would suggest skipping over it and just going to the actual falls and then back out again. Overall, if you want to climb up a waterfall, then Dunn's River Falls and Park is the perfect place to go; the trip up is fun as well as scenic and the guide is great.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Excellent waterfall-climbing experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We arrived a little before noon on a Saturday.  The place was already so busy we had to park in the overflow lot (and that doesn't even account for all the bus loads of tourists).  The entrance where we lined up for tickets gave us pause... tons of people and it seemed way more "attraction-ish" versus a visit to a natural wonder.  In the end we decided not to stay as we were pretty sure it wasn't the experience we were hoping for...and at the high price of admission it wasn't worth it to find out.

I'm guessing if we arrived at opening time on a weekday we would have stayed (but probably only for a short time) because it would have been less crowded.

Another day (a weekday morning) we ended up going to YS Falls and loved it.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Pick day and time carefully or look elsewhere for a waterfall experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The climb is treacherous, fun and refreshing.  Not for those reluctant to take a risk as the rocks are very slippery and the water can be forceful in places.  At least 3 points of contact with the ground recommended as you climb. The water has a "milky" appearance at all times I'm told.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Climb at your own risk

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Very fun day climbing the falls, a bit more climbing than we expected, but staff was very attentive and made sure everyone was safe.  The vendors were relentless though do not except any thing they hand you as they will charge you after they say it is a free gift
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Beautiful!

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Moon Palace Jamaica
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Moon Palace Jamaica is nestled in the beautiful surroundings of Ocho Rios, and boasts more than 700 luxurious accommodations with oceanfront and partial ocean views of the Caribbean Sea, each with 24-hour room service, free WIFI, CHI-branded amenities, complimentary calls to Continental US and Canada, and more. Renowned for over-the-top all-inclusive amenities such as unlimited gourmet dining and snacks, top-shelf drinks, a FlowRider® Double Wave Simulator, state-of-the-art Playroom for kids, a lounge designed specifically for Teens, and world-class entertainment and nightlife, it offers the perfect vacation for families and couples alike. Also home to the largest spa in Jamaica, for some serious pampering, this warm-hearted resort has everything you need right at your fingertips.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We recently visited Moon Palace Jamaica with our family. Our ride from the airport was pleasant and guided by Chuck Norris. He was very informative and very entertaining.

The resort was beautiful. The view of the mountains and the ocean was amazing. All the amenties were excellent. Lots to do on the resort. Food choices and variety was good. We especially enjoyed the Jerk Hut. And those Juicy patties are unforgettable. 
Our favorite drink was the "Bob Marley".

We had an amazing time. But what made the resort extraordinary was the staff. Diamond concierge staff was very helpful and patient. A huge thanks to Renee, Keisha, Marvin and Andre. 

A big hug and gratitude to Sabrina, Marco and Nikki. They made sure we were well taken care of. First time to Jamaica, but will not be our last. We felt at home and everyone made us feel like family.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Family Vacation

owner_response.author: Shawna-Lee Depass

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Overall, Palace Resorts is generally a positive experience.  Our family of four has often frequented Palace Resorts over the years (3 times in last five years alone).  This, however, was our first time visiting Moon Palace Jamaica.
The facilities were well kept overall.  Likely not a fair comparison, but the food at Moon Palace Grande in Mexico was definitely better.   I preferred the pools and beach in Jamaica to most other lo in Mexico.
Except for a handful of bright spots, the attitude of the staff in Jamaica overall was not particularly pleasant.  We were often treated like we were a bother.  One staff member observed a less than positive interaction we had with another staff member and encouraged me to give management feedback saying, “…people forget you are the reason we are here…there’s no way I would put up with that if I were you.”  Hospitality and a service-focused attitude is not the standard overall.
Also, fair warning, those depending on transportation to and from the airport, please be wary and prepared to find your own taxi from Moon Palace Jamaica to Montego Bay.  Our family of four was assigned a 5:00pm departure on our last day and provided written guidance to arrive at 4:45pm.  We did this coordination 48 hours in advance as required and I double checked our departure time in-person with two members of the transportation staff the morning of.  The employees confirmed our departure was indeed for the 5:00pm shuttle.  We arrived in the lobby even earlier than required at 4:20pm, but it turned out the final shuttle of the day was at 4:00pm.  For my part, I did make the mistake of providing an inaccurate flight time of 10:30pm vs. 9:00pm (the same flight departs later on the following day and I pulled up the wrong flight info when coordinating travel in advance), but this did not change when the last airport shuttle departed the day of our departure).  Rodrigo Patrón Bravo, the manager in charge of travel at the resort, refused to have the resort take responsibility for assigning our family to a non-existent shuttle and refused to provide transportation to the airport ($160) and even suggested that if we didn’t pay, the two employees that double checked and  confirmed our departure time the morning of could be held financially responsible for the mistake.  I sincerely hope Mr. Patron Bravo’s approach does not represent how Palace Resorts management treats their employees behind the scenes.
Palace has been our “go to” when seeking an all-inclusive resort or recommending a resort to others for years.  We have many family memories where a Palace Resort has been the backdrop.  Given this experience, we will have to look elsewhere in the future and advise others of this situation.  Had Mr. Patron Bravo simply made the right decision, I would instead be here singing his praises and congratulating Palace Resorts on a job well-done within an unfortunate situation.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Some Definite Bright Spots, Hospitality Lacking Overall, Unfortunate Management

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Hello lonalynn  , 
Thank you for visiting Moon Palace Jamaica and taking the time to tell us about your experience. We are sorry to hear about the inconveniences you’ve experienced upon your departure. We would like to inform you to know that our system generates the most suitable departure time correlating with the flight number given to us. If by any chance the incorrect information was provided, the time generated would not correspond with your departure shuttle time, resulting you missing the shuttle bus. We do hope based on the information provided by the Manager and my response , you will understand that this was by no fault a result of the service from Moon Palace Jamaica.

Best Wishes!
Shawna-Lee Depass
E-Concierge
Moon Palace Jamaica
owner_response.author: Shawna-Lee Depass

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Great trip , beautiful view of port and ocean.  Staff went above and beyond.  Loraine and Sutania, the beach servers were exceptional. Very fun to talk to and would made sure you had everything you needed, including grabbing lunch, ( the jerk chicken...yum) and bringing it to you so you never had to leave the beach.  Eli at the hibachi grill was fantastic.  The food he made was delicious, and was very careful to not cross contaminate shell fish, as my husband is allergic.  A/c worked super well, our room was cold all the time which felt great after being in the hot sun all day.  Pools were cleaned and well kept, and grounds were beautifully manicured.  If you up for an adventure, we highly recommend the Dunns Falls hike.  As the awesome guys at the kayak to help you with transportation. It is a bit challenging, so make sure to take water shoes and be in half way decent shape.  
The only thing we did not care for was the size of the bathroom, it was tight and cramped, but everything else was spot on perfect
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Moon Palace did not disappoint

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear lonalynn ,
We appreciate you taking the time to share your review. We are happy to hear that we did not disappoint.
Thank you for sharing the details of your experience with TripAdvisor community. Delighted to hear of the exceptional service provided by our friendly staff. We will commend them for their great job.
Thank you for sharing your review and your recommendations. It was a pleasure having you and we hope to welcome you back!
Sincerely,
Shawna-Lee Depass
E-Concierge
Moon Palace Jamaica
owner_response.author: Shawna-Lee Depass

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The only thing these people care about is chasing down guests to get them to return, buy their membership—non-stop harassement bait and switch style.  Roaches in a room, couples were  assigned two double beds and asked to upgrade and pay more in order to have the bed size they paid for. If you have any dietary requirements you might as well go back now because you’ll be fasting or having a miserable vacation. How about waiting for six hours to be checked in then be assigned an already occupied room.
Unfortunately this resort has wasted potential clearly from poor management.  The grounds are nice and staff can clearly be trained, but…there is no leadership or vision to do so.  Wait staff is very good but it is quite obvious they try to appear happy just so they could get tips. Many don’t even bother. Front desk staff is the worst, they are not even attempting to convey anything but a negative attitude or making the guest feel like they bother them or that any request is a  big deal. 
Food is OK at the buffet, but pretty much the same every day, almost no variation. Italian restaurant is horrible, ordered two basic Italian items which we could not eat: minestrone soup aka veggie brother with some party and raw cubes of zucchini and soupy risotto with absolutely no taste! We ended up leaving for the buffet just so we don’t go to bed hungry.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Indescribable incompetence

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Hello Queenie E, 
We appreciate you coming to Moon Palace Jamaica. We are sorry to hear that we did not met your expectations. We are also sorry that you were not made aware of the fact that guests with special dietary needs may visit the public relations desk, located in the lobby. They will assist in arranging to speak with the head chef about the preparation of foods that correlates with their dietary needs. We would also like you to thank you for your recommendations in relations to staff training, please note that the resort has a high level of service to maintain, hence we are regularly doing such. We have shared your review with the management team and we will look at alternatives in providing nothing short of A1 service.
It was a pleasure having you and we do hope we can have you back for a more fulfilling experience.
Kindest Regards,
Shawna-Lee Depass
E-Concierge
Moon Palace Jamaica
owner_response.author: Shawna-Lee Depass

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Myself and my wife booked this hotel on its reviews and as well as being our 10 year wedding anniversary, also using our riu points for a room upgrade which we never got even with us emailing the hotel 3 months prior..
the hotel is very clean and the food is pretty good, the only down side was the pool bar staff favored females especially girls of the same color, at one point the bar staff on the swim up pool was arrange a night out with girls rather than serving other people. as my self and my wife are smokes we felt very restricted where we could smoke even thou other people would smoke in the pool and around the pool, when we tried the same the pool attendant was all over us telling we could not smoke in this area.
what i will say Mackieba who looked after us every morning is a credit to Riu and made our holiday very pleasant and did not expect anything in return.
one advice i would give to anyone traveling to this hotel is try and use the on site excisions as these are cheaper and a lot better than the holiday companies, the trip to the water falls was amazing. if you book a private transfer from the airport to the hotel do not aspect any help from reception getting to your room they will just point you in the direction you need to go which is tiring especially after 12 hours travelling.
I know the hotel will send there standard generic reply.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: 10 Year Anniversary Holiday

tripAdvisorReviews.text:

As for all restaurants and I went in all u have made my dieting non existence

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Riu, Ocho Rios. The food was great, the staff was pleasant and helpful, and the room was clean and comfortable. tripAdvisorDetails.name: Sandals Ochi Beach Resort
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Situated on over 100-acres of lush hillside gardens overlooking the Caribbean Sea. • 519 villas, luxury rooms and suites with fantastic mountain and ocean views including the Butler Village. • 105 pools, 22 whirlpools. • A choice of 16 dining options including Room Service for Butler Serviced and Club Sandals accommodations. • Two luxurious Red Lane Spas with a tropical Solarium. • Complimentary green fees at Jamaica’s most elite and popular golf course, the Sandals Golf & Country Club (Transfers to the golf course are included). • Caribbean’s largest Rock Climbing Wall (30’ x 30’). • The Ochi Beach Club provides the ultimate party experience combining entertainment, music and cuisine.• Over-the-water Serenity Wedding Chapel. • The Caribbean’s First Speakeasy, The Rabbit Hole.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We’ve been back from our Sandals Ochi vacation for a week now, and we’re ready to go back.  Would 150% recommend!  We stayed 2 nights in a butler level room with a semi private pool, and we spent 3 nights in a Romeo and Juliet suite.  Donovan, Akeem, and Dewayne were our butlers.  They took such good care of us.  I’m not exactly sure what Dewayne’s role was (possibly a butler in training?) but he was so sweet and accommodating.  Actually, the entire staff is super friendly.  Special shout out to Dontae who wasn’t our butler, but he kindly gave us a ride up the hill to our room when Donovan was tied up on the beach side.  The private dinner on the beach is a must.  I would also recommend Dino’s Pizza and the Jerk Shack.  I’d read some negative reviews about the Italian restaurant before we traveled, but our experience there was excellent!  We never felt crowded at the resort.  Never had a problem getting chairs by the pool.  The only downside was the heat and humidity, but that is to be expected when traveling to the Caribbean in June.  So, we spent most of our time in the water.  The beaches and sunsets were gorgeous!  We had a few issues with our pool in the Romeo and Juliet suite.  The light and the filter in the pool did not work.  The jets in the hot tub did not work.  We notified our butlers, and they immediately sent engineers to do the necessary repairs.  Unfortunately, it didn’t get fixed during our stay.  We just chalked it up to “first world problems” and continued to enjoy our vacation.  Before we left, we rebooked a stay at Sandals South Coast for next year.  If you are even considering returning to Sandals, definitely book again during your stay.  The savings are huge!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Amazing!!!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We arrived at sandals ocho rios and lost my wallet and that sandals team searched for it and found it. The bartender Demario was the best bartender. Super nice guy and was fun to be around. Took really good care of us. We also did the catamaran cruise and the deejay was amazing entertainment. If anyone is looking for something to do I suggest that. Food and room service was amazing. We book another trip through sandal beaches before we ever left due to the people. The young man that booked are trip was an amazing guy and made our last day wonderful.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: AMAZING AND WONDERFUL VACATION

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Great staff, clear and calm water with a lot of seating. 

My wife and I enjoyed spending our nights at Miss Ethel’s Piano Bar, great piano playing and atmosphere. Kingroy was our pianist most nights and absolutely killed it every time. 

The only problem with the resort itself was it lacked timeliness. If you schedule something such as room service, photo session, etc. you are almost always stuck waiting. Even check in time for us ended up being at least an hour later than we expected and were originally told. 

Other than that everything else was perfect!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Our Ochi Honeymoon

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Had a horrible room the toilet kept running and leaking on the bathroom floor. There was dripping of water from the ceiling there solution was put a towel on the floor. Could hear everything from are room which made it hard for me to go sleep at night. The only positive they have Raheem works for them. He always was entertaining and would welcome everyone at the pool or the parties. We had a different situation happen and ran into hi after it happen. He made sure too take care of it when it wasn't his job. I greatly appreciate that customer service. We would only come back just be entertained by Raheem.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great customer service by a employee after awful room experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Raheem was professional, everyday he worked matter what part he was working he always checked on us to see if he can help with us anything. He went above and beyond when we had a situation. Thank you!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Outstanding Employee

tripAdvisorReviews.text: A great resort with amazing views. Location is everything, it’s right across the street from the beach. We are in room #10 which is a small studio but it has everything you need. The refrigerator could use updating but only for aesthetics, it works fine. It’s perfect for two people. The room has so much light and lots of windows that you can open and get a nice breeze from the ocean along with two skylights, one over the bed and one in the bathroom. One thing I am impressed with is the electrical outlets, there must be 20 outlets in this room, along with the phone charging ports. I can’t wait to come back.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Beautiful resort across from the beach!

owner_response.text:
Dear kevinbcahill, We first want to thank you for mentioning how much you enjoyed our hotel's location. Furthermore, please accept our sincere apologies for not meeting your expectations regarding the room you requested. We do try to honor these requests; however, there are times when we do not have the room unoccupied and available. We do understand your frustration, and we genuinely regret disappointing you. We are committed to providing a comfortable stay with exceptional service; therefore, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience whenever your travels bring you back to the area.

Clark Guinn

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Beaches Negril
tripAdvisorDetails.description: We’ve elevated the experience at Beaches Negril with 100% all-new rooms and suites, as well as a sweeping array of enhancements throughout the resort. • Located on the widest stretch of Negril’s seven mile white sand beach. • “Pirates Island" Water Theme Park with 8 slides, meandering “lazy” river, pirate bucket drops and splash deck. • Caribbean Adventure with Sesame Street® themed activities with daily character appearances, parades and stage shows. • Kids Kamp & Nursery with wide range of supervised activities. • Interactive Teens Program with “Trench Town” Teen’s Center and Teens’ Coordinator to coordinate teen activities. • Expansive Two & Three Bedroom Butler serviced Together Nest Suites. • 10 Five Star Global GourmetTM options to choose from.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I just got home from a 5 day vacation at the gorgeous Beaches Negril. This is an outstanding resort. I could not have asked for anything more. This was the first trip to Jamaica with my husband and 10 yr old son. The people at this resort are so kind and courteous...i have never experienced such exemplary customer service with a smile at all times. A big shout out to the concierge team especially to Kimberley, Genette, and Sabrina. Thank you so much for making our stay memorable. I will be sure to tell all of my friends in the US that they must visit Beaches Negril- Christine M

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text: We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your glowing review of your recent stay at Beaches Negril. It warms our hearts to hear that your experience was nothing short of outstanding, and we are delighted to have been a part of your first trip to Jamaica with your husband and son. Your kind words about the exceptional customer service provided by our team, especially Kimberley, Genette, and Sabrina from the concierge team, have been shared with them. They are thrilled to have played a role in making your stay memorable, and your gratitude will undoubtedly motivate them to continue delivering the highest standards of service. Thank you for choosing Beaches Negril for your vacation, and we truly appreciate your recommendation to your friends. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future for another unforgettable experience.
owner_response.author: Shawn Redhead

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We just got back and I wanted to share the pros and cons b/c I found reviews helpful before our trip.
Pros: The entertainment was really great; esp Thur and Fri night. It is amazing what the performers are able to do.  The watersports were a highlight.  We had a great time snorkeling with Baba (we went twice and he made sure to bring us to 2 different spots). When everyone else saw a turtle but my son was on the other side, her personally brought him over and pointed it out as it was swimming away. He really cared about making sure everyone had a good experience. We also did paddleboarding (saw giant starfish), banana boat- very fun, and the glass bottom boat.  For the boat and snorkel we got there at 8am to sign up for the next day but I don't know if that was necessary. Sean was really helpful too with the sports.  Almost every staff person we encountered seemed happy to be there- this included housecleaning who were very friendly.  The ocean water is crazy warm.  Th crepe place was one of our favorites.  Yaku and Kimonos are must do's.  Reserve dinner when you 1st arrive.
Cons: After paying a lot of $ for this vacation I wasn't expecting to have to pay more for a spot on the beach.  It was a rude awakening to find out that we couldn't sit in a cabana or any other covered spot in the front row of the beach without paying money to reserve it. This made us feel like 2nd class citizens.  Almost every day someone came by and asked us how we were enjoying our stay and when I mentioned the cabanas and other butler reserved spots, they had no response. They were sure to write down our room # b/c my guess is they had a quota of how many guests they needed to check in with.  Essentially this let us know that they didn't really care about our feedback or experience-- they just wanted to get credit for having talked to us.  And we almost never tried to sit at the pool b/c those also seemed to be reserved by butlers or people who staked out their spot before 8am.  There just isn't enough space or chairs around the pool.  The kid activities were listed but we only saw 1 in action for kids over 10.  We went to both baseball and soccer and nothing was happening, no staff showed up. This meant that our 12 yr old was mostly stuck with his boring parents all week.  Overall it is a beautiful place and the staff was great; the cons are things that seem easily remedied, if they want to...
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Pros and Cons

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Customer service overall in the resort wasn’t the best. The only employee that was nice and accommodating was Abigail that worked in Mariachi. The room was very outdated and had a wet ceiling. I had to beg housekeepers to come to my room everyday in order to get fresh towels and washcloths. We also found a Roach in our room and I was completely disgusted by it. Would never be coming back to this resort.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Horrible experience

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay at Beaches Negril. We sincerely apologize for any inconveniences you experienced during your visit, and we appreciate your candid remarks as they provide us with valuable insights to continuously enhance our services. First and foremost, we would like to express our gratitude for acknowledging Abigail's exceptional service at Mariachi. We are pleased to hear that she made a positive impact on your experience, and we will ensure that she receives the recognition she deserves.

We would like to address your concerns regarding the overall customer service and housekeeping issues you encountered. At Beaches Negril, we strive to maintain the highest standards of service, and we are disheartened to learn that we fell short of your expectations. Rest assured, your feedback will be shared with our management team for immediate review and improvement. Regarding the room condition, we regret any discomfort caused by the appearance and the presence of a roach. Your experience is not reflective of our commitment to providing a clean and enjoyable environment for our guests. 

We would also like to bring to your attention that Beaches Negril is proud to be an environmentally friendly and Green Globe Certified Resort. As part of our commitment to sustainable practices, we have implemented a towel and linen reuse program in our housekeeping department. Linens are changed every other day or as needed unless a linen reuse card is placed on the bed. Our cleaning records indicate that your room was serviced in accordance with this program, and linens were changed upon your request.

Once again, we sincerely apologize for any lapses in service and assure you that your concerns are being taken seriously. Your feedback is crucial in our ongoing efforts to provide exceptional experiences for our guests. If you would be open to discussing your concerns further, please feel free to contact our customer relations department at customersupport@sandals.com. We genuinely hope to have the opportunity to regain your trust and welcome you back to Beaches Negril in the future.
owner_response.author: Shawn Redhead

tripAdvisorReviews.text: My family and I just returned home  from an unbelievable trip to Beaches, Negril.  Starting with the staff at the front desk to the restaurant staff. Our experience was unsurpassed by any other vacation.  Our breakfast server at the Mill was Navina.  She quickly knew our beverage orders and got them to us immediately.  She was friendly and extremely attentive.  The restaurants were very good.  Chef Leon at Mariachi prepared a delicious dinner for us and checked in on us to be sure that we were pleased.  My wife and daughter had spa services and the staff was extremely professional. A shout out to Hopal and Kareena for their attentiveness! The absolute highlight of our trip was the water sports! The entire water sport team was outstanding.  Rosemarie and Janique were quick to retrieve our gear and knew our sizes. They were very accommodating when scheduling our snorkel trips. Having said that, the reputation of the water sports rests on the shoulders of Jullian, Creton aka Bubba, and Raj.  They were amazing! They were fun, knowledgeable and felt like friends and family.  Because they were so much fun, we snorkeled 7 times on our trip including a private charter to the caves! Our trip could have been great but these fellows elevated our vacation to UNBELIEVABLE! If they saw us around the property they addressed us by name and were particularly wonderful to our 2 children! Diving down and bringing up shells and sea  life was an experience my children will never forget! We look forward to returning and doing it all over!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Water Sports Elevated Our Experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We just returned from Beaches, Negril.  We had a fabulous time.  The entire staff was extremely polite, helpful and overly accommodating.  We had a few minor glitches on check-in but nothing that wasn't immediately tended to.  The grounds were absolutely beautiful and well maintained.  Our room was a perfect size for my husband and I 
 but the same room was a little tight for my son and his family of 4.  The beds were double not queen so it was a tight fit.  The restaurants were good.  We wish there were a few more to choose from but having said that, Chef Leon from the Mariachi Restaurant prepared a fabulous meal.  Stew Fish was really good too!  Allison at the front desk was extremely helpful.  At the main pool bar was bartender Leon.  He worked so hard but always attentive to the guests and made great drinks! Now I am saving the best for last...the Water Sports team.  There are not enough words to express how fantastic they are.  Starting with Rosemarie and Janique at the hut making sure that everything was good with us and figured out very quickly what size fins and we wore and made sure our grandson got the exact fins he wore everyday!  Next we come to the captains and mates on the boats.  Jullian, Creton aka Bubba, and Raj are phenomenal!!  They are so fun and so knowledgeable about the water and the snorkeling!  We snorkeled with them everyday and sometimes twice!  They looked out for my grandchildren while snorkeling and my husband and I as well.  Seeing them so much, they felt like family to us.  We even chartered the snorkel boat for a few hours to sail down the beach and around to point to snorkel in the caves and go to Rick's Cafe to watch folks diving from the rocks.  We have been to other all inclusives where some had some water sports included ( but most did not)  but we have never had an experience like we had here at Beaches Negril.  Jullian, Bubba, and Raj turned our vacation from great to "Off the Chart" fabulous.  We already miss them and we just arrived home last night!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Water Sports a Must at Beaches, Negril!!

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at Beaches Negril. We are delighted to hear that you had a fabulous time and that the entire staff contributed to making your stay enjoyable. We appreciate your feedback regarding the minor glitches during check-in, and we are pleased that our team promptly addressed any issues, ensuring a seamless experience for you. It warms our hearts to know that you found the grounds beautiful and well-maintained.

Your insights about the room size and bed configuration are valuable, and we will certainly take them into consideration as we strive to enhance our accommodations to better meet the needs of all our guests. It's fantastic to hear about the positive dining experiences, especially at Mariachi Restaurant, and we'll take note of your wish for more restaurant options. We will pass along your compliments to Chef Leon and the staff at the front desk.

We are thrilled that you had such a positive interaction with the Water Sports team, and your special mention of Rosemarie, Janique, Jullian, Bubba, and Raj is truly heartwarming. It's clear that their dedication and enthusiasm contributed to making your snorkeling experiences memorable. We will make sure to recognize their outstanding efforts. Thank you again for choosing Beaches Negril for your vacation, and we look forward to the pleasure of welcoming you back for another fabulous experience in the future.
owner_response.author: Shawn Redhead

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Based on the great reviews in the past(2019-2020) I thought this was an OK place to stay while in the parish but instead it was a nightmare.
 No cameras on the floors or even outside!
The whole place looks run down, pool area closed off ( which wasn't mentioned online),coffee machine in room but no cups/coffee pots/teas.
How can you pay for someone where that offers a balcony where you have the option of sitting but you can't because the entire area floods out because of a leak that can easily be fixed..
Nightstand lights don't work  ,they mentioned a safe but none was available!
 
Breakfast wasn't the best as options were limited ,you can also hear persons making loud banging noises on both ends while having sex,so obviously the rooms aren't sound proof!
I would recommend to the owners to do a full makeover so atleast this will be like the one owned in kingston. 
Get rid of those pillows ,they'll give you a headache! Sheets,towels caused my skin to itch so bad,I could not sleep !
Like I said ,if you like comfort and somewhere you can sleep well go ahead and take my stupid idea and book somewhere else .
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Don't waste your time /money.Go else where

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I am so glad I followed my heart and booked the Mandeville Hotel to host my wedding.  I absolutely have no complaints and would not change a single thing.  You cannot take the hotel at face value, you have to see its potential.  From reading the reviews and visiting the hotel I knew they would be able to produce the experience we desired for such a special day.

I live in the UK and therefore was anxious, however, the customer service and professional, friendly and warm encounters with the Wedding Planners gave me peace of mind.  I am a control freak and naturally it is difficult to be trusting.  I manage a large team and always feel the need to be in control.  Despite my constant calls and emails they maintained there ability to assure me.

The package and pricing was perfect for what they delivered.  Trust me if there ever is a time to get married, small and intimate (and at the Mandeville Hotel) is the way to go.  However at the Mandeville Hotel they went above and beyond to make our special day outstanding.

We had clean and comfortable beds.  Our room was charming and relaxing.  Nothing beats a good shower neither and I was not disappointed at all.  Reception welcome and responses was perfect, breakfast was superb (I love a Jamaican Breakfast) and the customer service was perfect.  I really had no complaints.

The wedding setting, decor and servicing was perfect.  I had a vision of how everything was going to be, but Tanielle (My wedding planner) and her team blew my mind and those who know me, know how difficult that can be.  The food, the cake, the DJ and the atmosphere has made it all a memory that I reflect on everyday since 26th September 2020.  I would not change a thing.

I want to say a big thank you (with tears of gratitude) for making my dream come true and our wedding oh so special.  Thank you for bearing and being patient with me.  Thank you for making the stay oh soooo sweet.  Thank you.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: My perfect wedding.  Forever thankful to the Mandeville Hotel

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The staff at the Mandeville Hotel are the best!!! 
Coleen at the front desk sells the business. She is professional, pleasant, and accommodating. When I spoke with her via telephone, Coleen made me feel at ease even though I was worried.  She is the face of the hotel. Rodian is polite and helpful; we had some good laughs. Zenga is the best, very professional, helpful, and friendly.  He is very trustworthy. The food was excellent, like no other in Mandeville or even at most all-inclusive hotels. Customer service was exceptional. Miss Gurnett, the housekeeping lady, was excellent. I would stay at this hotel only because of the staff and the food. Everyone was friendly. I felt at home and ease. Thanks to the Chefs!!!! Nuff respect.
To the management, in this era, it's tough to produce competent workers with excellent customer service. You have a team of what I call the dream team of Coleen, Rodian, and Zenga, they are the face of your business, and they make you look good. Please take care of them, let them know they are appreciated. Workers like your dream team are scarce in the hospitality industry. The building needs a lot of updating, too outdated. We are in the 21st century. You can do a lot more and still keep it rustic authentic if that's what you are aspiring to reach. Lots of work needs to do. If you do that, then you have no competition in that region of the parish.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: The Mandeville Hotel - Excellent Customer Service and Food!!!!!

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Montego Bay
tripAdvisorDetails.description: While this Jamaican spring break favorite is great for party animals, it can also be surprisingly low key – if you want. Montego Bay has excellent duty-free shopping, vibrant nightlife, and calm waters. Browse the local handicrafts at the open-air Harbour Street market, or the "hip strip" shops of Gloucester Avenue. The underwater crevices of Widowmaker’s Cave offer an intricate diving experience. Float serenely down the Martha Brae River on a bamboo raft and let your troubles melt away under the sun.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Runaway Bay
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Just ten miles west of Ocho Rios, Runaway Bay's stunning beaches see far fewer footprints than its neighbors. It's also removed from the cruise ship herds and pushy vendors. Perfect for those happy not to wander far from their resort, there are a few nearby attractions nonetheless. Bob Marley's childhood home and mausoleum is in nearby Nine Mile. Jamaican history is on view at Seville Great House and at Columbus Park Museum. To explore, rent a reliable vehicle and remember to drive on the left.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: My husband and I recently went on our honeymoon to Jewel Paradise Cove. The resort was beautiful and kept clean, the staff were friendly, the food was amazing. We met many people that had been repeat guests at Jewel Paradise Cove and that’s got to say something! We highly recommend JPC. We want to specifically shout out to the entertainment staff that made our 9 days in Jamaica so fun! Dimario, Jhavol, Rasheeda & Britnee you guys were truly amazing and we had so much fun with you all. An extra special shout out to Dimario, for taking the time to get to know us and on your off time coming to teach us card games and becoming a friend. We truly felt like we were at home!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Home away from home

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
1) When we arrived at the hotel, it us 1 hour to check in because the room was not ready.
2) While we waited for check in, we went to grab some food at the restaurant and they did not have the fruit salad
3) When we went to our room, the fridge was not stocked.
4) When we tried to use the sink, the sink was not draining properly. 
5) In all the restaurants, things for vegetarian will not be available. They were touting Walnut sauce for the Ravioli but was never available in the Moonstone italian restaurant. When we asked for vegetables, they gave 1 broccoli and 2 pieces of carrots and they did not have the spiral pasta.
6) In Jade Samurai at our table while others received several types of meats, for us (vegetarians) they just had vegetables and Rice with no Tofu as a protein option.
7) Most of equipment in the Gym was dysfunctional. Inadequate lighting in the gym and everywhere else.
8) In a supposedly tropical paradise, selection of fruits available was utterly poor.
9) In 2 days, our room A/c no longer worked and we have to pack all our things and move to another room. Although we asked for an upgrade due to inconvenience, they did not oblige.
10) The smoothie station was really bad with bad service.
11) No soy milk in the restaurant
12) Broken chest of drawers.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Jewel Paradise Cove, Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Overall this was an awesome experience. Staff was on point with customer service and rooms clean. Resort was well kept and food was good. I will recommend my friends and be back for a next trip. I was too tired from day time activities to go to the piano bar which is good.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: First time trip

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
After all the good things I've heard, my experience was horrible. I DO NOT EAT MEAT!  I'm pescatarian so I only consume vegetarian meals and fish. I ordered the seafood boil. I asked the waitress if it was possible to do my meal without the jerk sausage. She said yes. I asked her again n she said sure. I further confirmed why I was making that request by saying " I'm telling u this because I do not eat meat".
Had she told me this dish could not be prepared without sausage, I would have happily chosen something else but she told me it was OK.

My food arrived and I could only see the crabs and shrimps on top. I started to enjoy my meal only to get to a point where I bit into meat! I was so upset. Rather than apologising, her excuse is that the meal is prepared that way. My point is, if she knew it couldn't be done without meat, she should have said so! Her attitude and blatant disregard for violating my wishes, was nothing short of appalling. She was arguing and justifying her actions, saying I should have given her an explanation. I do not need to explain any reason why I don't eat meat. That's personal!
For personal health reasons I will not disclose on here why I do not eat meat. This could have been so much worse. Imagine if this was allergy related, this could have had a fatal impact by putting things in someone's meal that they cannot eat!
I doubt she understands the gravity of what she has done. She said I didn't explain to her. what further explanation does "I DON'T EAT MEAT" require?
Thanks to my family and friends who jumped to my defense. I was shaking and so nauseous I ended up vomiting.
I appreciate the supervisor who tried to offer something else and knock that meal off the bill. However I had no appetite at that point n would never trust them to make another meal. We didn't go there for free food. We went there with our money and expected to receive what we ordered.
I'm yet to receive an apology from that waitress. Absolutely disgusting. 
SHARKIES TRAIN YOUR STAFF BETTER!!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: My diet consist of vegetables and fish. I told the waitress 3 times that I don't eat meat yet while eating I found meat

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We arrived on Sunday 12th and are still here at present. To be honest, we were mithered about the mixed reviews. We are well travelled and have stayed in many different types of accommodation around the world, so we came with an open mind. Firstly, the staff are friendly, accommodating and greet you all the time. We are in a garden cottage, and yes, it is dated, but its comfortable and clean. They are revamping a few of the cottages in the resort, which TUI never made us aware of building work taking place, but it hasnt mithered us much. The style of the garden cottages gives a traditional feel, set in well-kept gardens. The food has been basic but we've always had something different to fill up on. What people arriving need to bear in mind is that it is a 3 star resort. I think covid has had a huge impact in remploying staff when things have picked up again, but then which country hasn't had lasting effects economically off the back of it? If you want luxury, pay more money and stay elsewhere. Locals do come for a breaks too, but who doesn't travel to different parts of the UK for weekend breaks back home?! This is a resort to absolutely chill out at. If you like spending your time doing nothing then this is for you. Also, remember this is Jamaica. The people and the vibe are chilled!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Honest review

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Ocho Rios
tripAdvisorDetails.description: You're on island time the moment you set foot in Jamaica. Ocho Rios, a port of call for many cruise lines, also boasts some of the most luxe resorts and spas in the Caribbean. And once you've had your stresses melted away in the island sun, you can head out for a night of dancing and reggae music.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The Good

My husband and I spent 8 days in the Moon Palace—Jamaica and were incredibly impressed with the quality of the service, food, location, and aesthetics of the grounds. I was worried I’d be bored at a small resort, but between activities, tours, shows, bars, pools, meals and snacks, spa treatments (including hydrotherapy), and the beach, we were satiated with food and experience the entire time.

I much prefer the Moon Palace—Cancun (and The Grand, by far), but Jamaica was still a great experience.

___________
Some of the exceptional employees we met included:

Roshin in the Boulangerie was my man for the week. His smile is infectious and you can see he is loved by other employees and guests alike. He recognized me every time I came by and made me feel special just for showing up. I’m really going to miss my morning coffee, mid-morning pastries, afternoon ice cream, pre-dinner chocolates, and after-dinner cakes. Thank you, Roshin, for helping me love my vacation!

Andre (Dive team) was so kind and helpful. I don’t think he was even on the clock when I stopped him and asked for help. He took his time with me to find out what I needed in terms of swim training and was able to provide me with great advice on where I could swim safely, on currents and locations, etc. 
when I returned the next day to talk to him about my swim, he gave me further advice on other routes. It would be even better for me. He. Is. Amazing!

Tony (gardener) was encouraging. He told me he was a distance swimmer who was concerned about my safety and showed me where I would be best suited for my morning swimming adventures. He even taught me some Jamaican and encouraged me to keep my heart healthy with coconut gel.

Dookie (Pier 8) greeted us with an amazing smile and was incredibly eager to ensure our meal was a fantastic experience for my husband and me. His smile and joy was contagious. 

Nurse Lyn took excellent care of me when I was down. She was concerned about my overall health and injuries, giving me advice on how to heal and improve the long-term positive outcome for my injuries. She was very compassionate and respectful and didn’t even make fun of me for my stupid mistakes.

The Scuba Caribe Team took me on two tours: a sunset catamaran experience and 11:00 snorkeling tour. The staff was so responsible and lots of fun.

Obrian was my server in Buccaneers for lunch one day. When I asked for a real fruit smoothie, instead of going straight to the bar for one using pre-mixed fruit, he asked which fruits I preferred. He then went to the buffet, collected all my favorites, and asked the bartender to blend them. It was perfect! But, even more perfect was his willingness to whatever he could to help me keep to my diet and enjoy my food and dining service. What a great representative for Palace Resorts! 

Franz in the piano/martini bar was always so polite and accommodating. He quickly learned the types of drinks I like and eagerly shared new surprises every time I was ready for another round.

Sequoia Anderson was the representative who helped me book all my spa appointments and tours before my trip. She was so patient with me, kindly accommodating all my changes. We had a huge collection of activities we wanted to do and she spent weeks with me online ensuring we would have the perfect vacation.
Sequoia Anderson (sanderson@palaceresorts.com)

—————
The Not-So-Good

There were lots of items not working in the spa. Just a few were several of the heated chairs (I was only able to sit in a heated one once), several of the fountains in the large pool (a problem because they are massage therapeutically), and, most surprising and disappointing, no hot water in the showers.

Having the pools closed at night was strange and a pain. Having them closed in the morning was a real problem because I wanted to use them to cool down from my ocean swims.

One day I wanted to go to Dunn’s River Falls so asked at the entryway the cost of a taxi for 1 person roundtrip. I was informed it was US$60. Instead, I had a delightful FREE under 3-mile walk, loved climbing the falls, and took a cab back for US$10 including tip. Palace management, please don’t let your cab drivers extort your guests.

The worst thing was the VIP beach chairs (and possibly all other pool and beach lounge chairs, but I didn’t use them). When guests are done using them, they often leave their towels on the chairs. Those towels then stay there all day so it’s unclear which chairs are taken and which were vacated hours ago. As a result, there are no clean chairs for anyone by the end of the day. One small way to combat this is to put towel return bins in the VIP area so guests would be more encouraged to clean up after themselves. Additionally, Some guests hog the chairs for the entire day. There were quite a few chairs in the VIP and pool areas that people covered with towels and cheap personal items that they left all day. The guests choose the best spots (shaded and near the action), but leave them vacant for hours a day so no one else can enjoy the experience. This happens despite the fact there are signs saying guests are not allowed to save seats. Perhaps employees could regularly place stickers on the chairs  that are abandoned and if they’re still there 30 minutes later, they could clear the chairs of towels and other items. Items could be stored in the towel exchange area until requested by the guest that rudely left them there in the first place. Though this would anger several guests who were being selfish, they would surely be less likely to do it again and there would be more guests who would likely be extremely grateful for the proaction.
________________
Some of the not-so-exceptional employees we met included:

Johnoy—gym
When I entered the gym on the evening I arrived, I met Johnoy who was sitting by the door. I asked him for a running map and he asked me why I would be asking him for a map. I asked him if he worked there and he confirmed that he did. When I explained to him that I was looking for a map that would show me where I can run long distances near the property, he eventually explained to me that he could not recommend anywhere to run other than the beach because he can only recommend things on property. This makes perfect sense, but I was very put back when he seemed so nonchalant when asking me why I might be asking him about a map in the first place. He was quieter offensive in the way he said it. Usually, employees in a gym are eager to help guests maintain their training goals while on vacation. 
Next, he told me that he wasn’t able to help me with any swimming questions. He directed me to the pier where I was unable to find anyone.
I later took a spin class where he was the instructor. He did a good job at that. Perhaps he should stick with the training, avoiding the entryway.

Krystal (gel removal and manicure): She was so unfriendly. She never greeted me and the only thing she said was to relax and put my feet up and down. I was so surprised when she rolled her eyes at me several times despite the fact that (I thought) I was really nice to her.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A Great Vacation: Relaxing and Fun

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Hello ChristyKeeler ,
We are grateful to you for choosing to vacation at Moon Palace Jamaica. We truly appreciate your detail feedback about your stay. We are glad to hear it was overall a good experience, despite Moon Palace The Grand been you favorite. Thank you for recognizing and highlighting the exceptional work of our staff, we will congratulate them for their hard work. We are happy to hear you were able to do your morning swims in the ocean, the climbing of the falls, your diving excursion, your coffee and sweet treats at the Boulangerie, the spinning classes , the snacks and the spa all made your trip worth while.
We have also noted your dissatisfaction and your recommendations and shared it with the management team, this is is consider and facilitate improving our service.
We are pleased to have hosted your stay and we look forward to welcome you back.
Kindest Regards
Shawna-Lee Depass
E-Concierge
Moon Palace Jamaica
owner_response.author: Shawna-Lee Depass

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I decided to take my children on this excursion during our trip to Jamaica. The staff are so RUDE and UNPROFESSIONAL!!

We walked in and there was such a long line because there was a family of like 30 people, okay I had to pay an extra $110 Canadian dollars (on top of what I already paid for their photo package)to get pictures of my baby and my family together at the excursion. 

We wanted to do the Sting Ray activity and waited there for 40 minutes and not one person from the staff offered to allow us to do this. Just stared upon us and offered nothing but looks. 

Okay next we’re finally going to do our encounter which was 1.5 hours late, due to how busy they were. I’m Canadian Jamaican and the staff was all cussing each other in patois, about the load of people that booked the excursion at once. All their nasty attitudes really ruined the experience. The encounter itself was great as was the lady with her Dolphin I don’t remember the lovely ladies name. We had to rush the lunch that was included because of them being late to rush over to Dunns River Falls. The food was cold, dry and they didn’t offer you options nor a drink! Water is $5 !! This place is a complete money grab! 

Now upon leaving the establishment with my children, the staff at the gate were having extremely inappropriate conversations about going down on women and things of that nature. All in all I would never return to this establishment 

Do better my fellow Jamaican people.. do better!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Waste of an Experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Tio is the man. We had so much fun we went back next day to hang out again. He is so welcoming and fun. If you want to have a blast, go see Tio mon. The drinks are excellent as well as the food. Try the Jerk BBQ wings and Ox Tail!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Tio is the man!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Sabrina was warm, welcoming and very friendly! Great service and also very personable. When we come back, we look forward to seeing her again! She is mainly in the main lobby and lobby bar welcoming guests as they come in.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Sabrina offers warm welcome!

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Hello Capo,
Thank you for taking the time to share your review and tell the TripAdvisor community about your experience. Sabrina has displayed the epitome of Moon Palace Jamaica, warm and friendly service, she is a great employee and we thank you for recognizing her and her hard work. We will commend her for her great work. It was a pleasure having you here and we look forward to welcome you back soon!
Kindest Regards
Shawna-Lee Depass
E-Concierge
Moon Palace Jamaica
owner_response.author: Shawna-Lee Depass

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Travel to Sandals Jamaica every year for the past ten years. Booked Sandals Dunns River due to the newness (May 2023 grand opening) of this specific Sandals. We appreciated the shorter transfer from Montego Bay as compared to some of the other Sandals on the opposite side of the island. We were somewhat worried about the smaller size of this resort but were not disappointed at all. The staff at this resort (each and every staff member) that we encountered here was outstanding! But ESPECIALLY would like to recognize our concierge Stacie Ann. She went completely out of her way to ensure our stay was not only memorable but incredible. She actually stayed late past her scheduled shift to decorate our room in which we were celebrating our anniversary and my birthday. She is truly an amazing person with a heart of gold! The hotel manager Shawn had helped us through a few small bumps that we encountered while here and he did not disappoint!! And Rushell, our server at the jerk shack was sure that I had enough of my favorite Jamaican cuisine of the jerk chicken each and every day we visited with her. Our only issue with this resort is that they allow other guests to vape while at the pool. I had bought this to the attention of a few staff members that did not correct those guests.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Beautiful and New Resort

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: view on way from Port Antonio

The Hotel Mockingbird is Jamaica’s #1 eco boutique hotel. It is your island home away from home. With only 10 total rooms, you’ll be able to enjoy stunning coast side views in a relaxing and exclusive hideaway. The perfect combination of sustainability and luxury, you’ll feel great about choosing the Hotel Mockingbird when looking for a place to unwind in Jamaica.
View of Port Antonio in honour of Jamaica Independence Day

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Really gorgeous small private beach with rolling waves and it has a great vibe. We ate fried and broiled fish on the beach and it was so good! Served with Pikliz and the fish had such depth of flavor that we ate 4.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Sweet Spot

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
The resort is located on a breathtaking bay, our two bedroom upper level space close enough to the water to hear the crash of the surf. Everything was spotless, maintained and comfortable. Of all the places we’ve stayed in Jamaica, nothing compares with the hospitality of our hosts- Mary and James. They are lovely people and made the experience unforgettable. Thank you guys!

We ate our most memorable meals of our trip here, dining on the open-air balcony. Sharon and Sophia our cooks were amazing and delivered spectacular meals. Curried goat- the best I’ve ever had (my wife’s Jamaican and she told the ladies that they’ve wrecked things for her as their curried goat was soo good). Ackee and salt fish, grilled lobster, pepper pot soup, pumpkin rice, fried breadfruit, steamed fish, mackerel rundown, Jame’s cousin’s jerk pork were all incredible. They are on their game, anticipate your needs and surprise you with kindness at every turn.

Everyone we ran across was sincerely welcoming and upbeat. This is a special place.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Wow, we loved our stay!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Had a wonderful stay here with my girlfriend, everyone was so friendly and helpful. 
The room was amazing you really live in the green beautiful nature and its a 100 meters walk to the blue lagoon where we snorkel med turtles.
On the evening we sat on the restaurant dock, sip on some good drink with a great view over the sea and listened to the birds and nature nightlife.
If you looking for a peace and relax stay I really recomend Kanopi house. 10/10

Thanks alot Henry and the other staff for making our trip very special.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Living like a luxury tarzan

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Loved everything about our visit to the Di Hit Strip from first impression and vibe of the lounge overlooking the water at Port Antonio to the amazing salt fish fritters and oxtail along with cocktails to celebrate a birthday. Super fun photo wall to take souvenir photos of a celebration night out with friends, family or romantic night out. Food was fantastic and enjoyed the a la carte menu. Highly recommend! Shawn was especially welcoming and made it a memorable experience.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great birthday night out

ranking_data.ranking_string: #19 of 92 things to do in Temecula

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Wine tasting was ok but we did feel hurried. Location is nice and there is a great shuttle from the Carter Estate over the road. 
Lunch was good and readied is for the tasting but otherwise it was pretty average
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Pretty average compared to Carter Estate over the road

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The tasting room, the grounds, the rooms,  the cellar tour. A must see. Bring the family and enjoy the atmosphere highly recommended Meuter Media
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Wow

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Loved the bubblies, great way to finish the day with lighter, refreshing wines.  Did a group tour and this was one of the stops. Friendly staff made you feel comfortable, whether you are a connoisseur or novice. The wines were very good.  A must stop if visiting Temecula.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Nice winery.  Must visit

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I'm not quite sure why I'm not giving this location a one-star review.  It's a mess.  The "villa" we stayed in is tired, drab, and in desperate need of a makeover.  The furniture has a musty smell.  The bedroom is even worse smelling.  There might be fresh sheets on the bed, but that's the ONLY fresh thing in that bedroom.  The makeup mirror in the bathroom is BROKEN.  With little effort, I could have had an amputated toe.  Does anyone ever check to see what might need replacement?  One of the faucets didn't turn on - at all!  The really amazing sight was the cheesecloth-thin towel with strings shredding off of them.  These are towels that become rags at my house.  I don't expect to find them at an upscale "resort."
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Tired, drab, and musty.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This winery is large and airy inside with two long bars and several small tables. Outside seating is also an option. Our server, Max, was knowledgeable and friendly. His expertise on the wine was helpful. Staff is educated on the menu and is able to answer questions from growing to tasting. We went midweek, but were old that weekends can be very busy. There is a small gift shop with wine accessories for purchase. The winery is associated with and Inn and restaurant. Only service dogs are allowed.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Don't miss this winery
